story:
Story of My Book

"Reigning the Future: AI, 5G, Huawei, and the Next 30 Years of US-China Rivalry"

This book discusses the technological competition between the United States and China through the lens of technology, international relations, and business.


My name is Dennis Wang, and I am the author of Reigning the Futre. I wrote this book hoping to inform you of this new and exciting frontier of global affairs. I hope that by reading this book, you discover compelling stories and fresh insights into international trends. I want to share my passion and excitement for US-China relations with you.

In this book, you will learn about the technological competition between the United States and China:
  • Rise of the Chinese tech giant Huawei and its position in US-China tensions
  • Implications of game-changing technologies and trends (5G, AI, Blockchain, etc.)
  • How Chinese and American technology firms are increasing their influence in far-flung parts of the world
  • So-called "iron curtain" of technology between the East and West
  • And many other topics

You will love this book if you enjoy learning about global affairs, business, and technology. The Reigning the Future is a non-fiction book that speaks to students, business professionals, and policy-makers who are experienced or new to US-China relations and technology.

 

The Book - Reigning the Future: AI, 5G, Huawei, and the Next 30 Years of US-China Rivalry

The book contains three parts.

Part 1 contains the Introduction and Chapters 1-2. From the Opium War to China's rise, this part introduces the historical relationship between China and the United States, detailing the storms of history that have led to the current state of affairs of the 21st century.

Part 2 contains Chapters 3-9. This part analyzes China's technology industry and game-changing innovations of the 21st century. These innovations will be discussed in the context of international relations, detailing the striking similarities between current US-China affairs and the Cold War.

Part 3 contains Chapters 10-13. This part looks into the times to come. Having presented stories, findings, and analyses in previous sections, Part 3 provides insights into the future of US-China relations and possible scenarios as well as solutions to global challenges.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling before publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Dennis Wang has studied economics and political science at Duke University and has worked at China Central Television (CCTV) in Beijing and Huawei Technologies in West Africa. In college, he has been involved with the Duke-UNC China Leadership Summit for three years, serving as its Deputy-Director.

From experiencing the Arab Spring to witnessing a Nepalese Maoist movement to being accused of a petty crime in North Korea, Dennis has been passionate about global affairs at a young age. His expertise lies specifically at the intersection between US-China relations and technology. Only until recently has US-China tech relations rose to the forefront of international attention. Having researched this topic and interviewed experts and stakeholders from both China and the United States, Dennis presents his stories, findings, and analyses in his book. He believes that the Tech Cold War between the two great powers will be one of the most significant challenges of the 21st century.

Through Reigning the Future, Dennis hopes to inform you about our changing world and how you can navigate these tumultuous times. He hopes that, ultimately, the relationship between the two world powers will become more constructive.

In his spare time and whenever not writing this book, Dennis loves to watch YouTube videos on the couch while drinking tea and eating chocolate. His friends describe him as someone who spends most of his time like a 90-year-old, reading about current affairs and passing the time in slow conversations filled with aging wisdom.

For more information you can connect with Dennis at dennisw3255@gmail.com or LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/in/tianyidenniswang/)

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #ReigningTheFutureBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.


Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Yours truly,

Dennis Wang

story:
About the Book

What have crocodiles got to do with tomatoes? Crocodiles are the stuff of nightmares, their huge jaws snapping at your ankles as they try to eat you! Tomatoes are ....well they're tomatoes.  This hapless crocodile may well turn out to be vegan, who knows?

The Greedy Crocodile is a funny, action packed children’s picture book about a tomato obsessed crocodile and fearless twins Elodie and Adele. Can the twins save Dad's 'matoes from the mighty jaws of the crocodile? Mischief and Mayhem combined they love nothing more than to roll up their sleeves and jump feet first into the action!

Inspired by the grow it yourself/urban gardening fever that swept the nation, I have sneakily wound the life cycle of the tomato plant into the story.  I believe the story should always come first and once it's fun and engaging then  learning happens naturally! 

This book would be suitable from ages 1 to about 8 depending on the child.  Enjoy reading to, reading with and the encouraging independent readers in your life!

 

About Me

I am an independent author living in Cork, Ireland with my partner Tom, our three young children and a greenhouse full of tomatoes.  You can read more about me on my website. 

I am so lucky to work with talented artist and illustrator Anastasia Kurtulus whose drawings have brought so much more to the story. You can check out her portfolio here.

About You

You can pre order the book and earn exclusive perks.  Please also consider sharing this project on your social media or letting your friends and family know about it so they too can add "The Greedy Crocodile" to their collection.

About the perks

Buy the book or go fancy, whichever you prefer.  Children and indeed adults learn best through fun and play so I have many perks to choose from. Grow your very own tomatoes from seed, grab a handy fridge magnet or digital edition for those who like their library on the go!

Details Details Details...

The Greedy Crocodile will be a 32 page 10 X 8 inch   (25 x 20 cm) matt laminated, perfect bound book. This size is suitable for children and adults to handle easily. The inside paper is a whopping 170 gram silk which adds a luxurious finish to the book.

I really believe in this project so apart from writing the story I have already invested my own funds to pay for  the illustrations, layout and typography. What I really need your help with is  mostly the printing and distributing costs.

Here is how the money raised by the Indiegogo campaign  will be used:

What happens then

If the project is fully funded then I should be able to print and deliver the books to you before  Christmas.  I have have added an extra bit of  wiggle room in case of delay with postage (due to Covid 19) or any other unforeseen circumstance. 

If I don't raise the full amount please don't worry your card will be refunded!

I will keep you updated at all times!

story:
Story of My Book

Unfocused: The Journey to Self-Actualization is a book about truly redefining what success means and the journey of self-actualization. This book goes into depth about the role of goal-reliance in our current definition of success. It emphasizes the need to focus more on the present, with the past as a gentle guide, and the future as a medium for fueling our curiosity.

My name is Ester Teper and I am the author of Unfocused. I wrote this book because I felt there was an inherent gap between research, religion, popular psychology, and personal experiences. This book brings these aspects together and provides the reader with action-items.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what self-actualization means to you, in this moment. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for understanding our lives as more value-driven, mission-focused, and vision-fueled. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you find your path in some way.

In this book, you'll hear stories from over 125 individuals, among which are leaders and innovators in their respective fields, including medicine, law, religion, education, fitness, and art. These are people from around the globe who have shared their stories with me, and now I get to pass them along to you. Included among them are Jeffrey Seller, producer of Hamilton, who was able to apply his authentic passion for producing and take it to the stage; former US Ambassador to Canada Bruce Heyman, and his lovely wife Mrs. Vicki Heyman, who used art and culture to forge a stronger bond between nations; and Holocaust survivor and psychologist Dr. Edith Eger, a lively and animated woman with love for everyone she crosses paths with. 

Unfocused is a nonfiction book that speaks to young readers and go-getters who want to look at purpose, success, and goals in a new way. 


The Book - Unfocused

The book is written in 4 parts.

  • Part 1 contains the introduction and explains the working definition for self-actualization. 
  • Part 2 contains chapters about the Values. It focuses on generosity, curiosity, and authenticity. 
  • Part 3 contains chapters about the Mission. It helps the reader develop a clear mission statement based on the foundational values covered in Part 2.
  • Part 4 contains chapters about the Vision. This is the true mindset change which will allow you to relinquish the need for constant control over your future.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

 This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Ester Teper is a junior at Vanderbilt University studying Chemical Engineering and Communications in Science and Technology. She has completed a major core in Psychology from Fairleigh Dickinson University, as well as an Associate Degree in Piano from the Associated Board of the Royal School of Music. 

Ester started writing this book as a way to better understand her own mission and vision for life, and realizes that the theoretical concepts she learned about in her psychology courses were actually a passion. More research led to more questions, and the content started to pile up. That, combined with over 120 interviews, inspired her to write the book she wishes she could read: a combination of religion, research, interviews, and personal experiences. 

For fun, Ester has returned to her third-grade self and started a book collection. When she is not searching for books to read, she is actually reading them on Vanderbilt's beautiful campus, engaging in Jewish life, or connecting with girls in her engineering sorority. Instead of writing this right now, Ester should probably clean her room, but that's a problem for next weekend :)

For more information, you can connect with Ester Teper at esterteper22@gmail.com and at:

  • Instagram: @esterteper
  • LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/ester-teper/ 

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

 The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Unfocused and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ester Teper

story:
WE DID IT!

With YOUR support we reached our funding goal! We are thrilled and forever grateful for those of you who have shared our campaign with family, friends, and co-workers.  Not only do you believe in us and our books, but you believe that society can do better. 

Your contribution and willingness to share our campaign represents your commitment to promoting conversations about race, inequities, acknowledging differences, and growing from discomfort. We understand that speaking about these topics during our current climate is not the easiest conversation to confront, however, James Baldwin said, “not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced.” 

 

THE IMPACT

As a result of being fully funded, we are able to provide each homeroom teacher within our schools a copy of each book. There are 40 homeroom teachers who will be receiving our books and impacting 822 students. We currently have 320 books to donate to teachers across the Chicago area! Chicago Public School District is the 3rd largest in the United States with 642 schools and 355,156 students. Now imagine the number of students we could impact if we are able to get more books out there? There are a few days left of our campaign and we have exceeded our goal by 4%. With that money we can print 100 additional books. 

 

WHAT'S NEXT?

Since starting this campaign, the urgency to bring these books to all classrooms and libraries has become more clear than ever before. By hitting our goal of 20K, we are now able to provide FREE copies of both books to over 50 homeroom classes. What’s even more exciting, anything that exceeds our current goal will go towards printing additional books and donating them to schools in the Chicago area. 

 

OUR STORY

Hi, we are Katie and Marley. We met six years ago teaching on the Southside of Chicago. As co-teachers, we spent a lot of time together...and we mean a lot of time. Naturally much our conversations were centered around what and how we would be teaching. Our discussions also encompassed many other topics like that of race and the inequities that are prevalent for our students. Sometimes our conversations got uncomfortable. Hard questions were asked and we spent hours listening to each other. These honest and tough conversations are the reason our professional relationship extended to a true friendship. 

So...we get that talking about race isn’t easy. It’s often hard knowing what to say and how to best say it. Notice how we said it can be difficult to “talk” about race. We meant to say that. Now let’s consider what it’s like to teach students about race, inequities, and what our society is facing as a whole right now. Feeling tongue tied? We’re here with you. 

As educators, we know the value of read alouds and classroom discussions. If certain conversations aren’t happening within the home, we can only hope they’re taking place within the classroom. Eventually we found ourselves talking about the number of resources our classrooms were lacking so that we could begin having more conversation around race. Yes, teachers do way more than focus on the Common Core State Standards! Luckily, we have time embedded into the day for teaching social emotional skills and this also allows us to be responsive to the needs of our students. More often than not, what happens outside of the classroom becomes a topic of conversation and a moment for learning within the classroom. 

Luckily for us, we know what we have to do when something is missing within our classrooms. Luckily for you, we knew our messages were too valuable to keep to ourselves and we wanted to bring you on this journey with us. Our hope is that our books will go beyond the classroom and into the homes of all students. We trust that you’ll enjoy learning along with us and being a part of The Race to Understand. 

Before we sat down to write, we knew we wanted to educate and inspire society to think, be, and do better. We wanted to make tough conversations about race more accessible to children, parents, and educators. This summer we did just that. Together, we came up with two book ideas. Writing and publishing one book before we started the other was never discussed. We knew that BOTH books had to be written because their messages were equally important. 

During the summer, we came up with several book ideas. We have so much more to share and that led to us creating The Race to Understand. Our goal here today is to keep it about our first two books, but we cannot wait to share more about the additional children’s books and classroom resources that are in the works. 

Learn more about our story by reading the Q & A blog post we did with Indiegogo. 

 https://go.indiegogo.com/blog/2020/11/seeing-color-in-a-new-light-a-qa-with-katie-engelking-and-marley-olivera.html

 

OUR FIRST TWO BOOKS

It’s so important that our books get into the hands of K-8th grade students. The lessons are invaluable for students and adults. Meet Lincoln, Remi, McKinley, and Bryce who are vulnerable characters and share what they’ve experienced at school with their parents and siblings! By talking through what has taken place at school, Lincoln does some meaningful learning and McKinley reminds herself that the only limitation that can be placed on her is the one she sets on herself.

I See Color, I See You

When Lincoln makes a classmate upset, he finds he has a lot to learn about the world he once knew. Turning to his dad to make sense of why it’s important to see color, he begins to understand the importance and the power (good and bad) in people’s differences. Lincoln’s first day of school may teach him one of the most valuable lessons in life. 

Do You See Color, Do You See Me?

When McKinley’s classmate questions her abilities, she realizes that the world may not see her the way she was raised to see herself. McKinley has to remember all of the things that make her brilliant and hopes to help others see that too! McKinley’s experience reignites her will to believe in herself even if she’s the only one who believes… for the time being.

At the end of each 8.5 x 11 book you will find leveled discussion questions. Wow, our administrators would be so proud of us right now! These questions allow us to go a step further with our readers. We wanted to make sure the conversation didn’t end when our books did. 

 

THE TEAM

They say many hands make light work. Well, the work definitely wasn’t light, but our team made it so much easier for us! We are so thankful for the talent and hard work put in by these four individuals. Jena, Corbin, Mac and Gloria - we cannot thank you enough for helping us make our books and LLC come to life. 

      JENA HOLLIDAY              CORBIN ADAMS                  MAC WILCOX                 GLORIA ALAMREW                 Illustrator                      Videographer                  Graphic Designer                          Editor

Jena Holliday is a full-time artist, writer, entrepreneur and storyteller. She is the creator and owner of Spoonful of Faith illustration and design studio. She loves to help others in their journeys through creativity, storytelling, and illustration and is dedicated to bringing their visions to life. She and her husband live in Minnesota and are grateful parents to their two children.

Corbin Adams is a burgeoning videographer. Prior to doing videography he spent 10 years in the insurance industry, sitting on multiple boards in the insurance industry and was featured as top young agent in a magazine.

Mac Wilcox is a full-time brand designer, illustrator, and shoe enthusiast, currently working in Chicago advertising. The only thing he enjoys more than spending his time eating sandwiches and building brands is his lovely fiancé (she didn’t tell him to write that). His simplistic design style lends well to all concepts as he wants to make this world a little bit more beautiful than before.

Gloria Alamrew is an Ethiopian-Canadian writer, currently based out of Edmonton. Having written for distinguished publications such as Zora Mag, CBC, Bustle, Huffington Post Black Voices, and FLARE, among others, she focuses her pen on all things that centre around Blackness, culture, and the myriad ways they intersect and interlock - both in her life and the world. She is also a member of Gumbo Media's editorial team, based out of Chicago.

 

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

We need your help to cross the finish line. As self-published authors, there are several upfront costs that we don’t have a publishing company to rely upon for. We didn’t just give birth to one baby, but we have twins. That means double the strollers, braces, and college tuitions. Well, in this case, double the cost for illustrations, editing, printing and so forth! One of the largest costs we accrued was paying for our beautiful illustrations. Seeing our characters and messages come to life has been an incredible process.

By backing our campaign you have the opportunity to pick out some rewards that speak to you! 

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We are first time authors going through the self-publishing process. We have yet to go through the printing and distribution process, but we are ready to continue our learning so we can get ahead of any challenges we might face. 


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We understand that some people just can’t contribute and we totally get that! Your help is still needed and your efforts would mean the world to us. 

You can help us reach our campaign goal by tapping into your social and personal circles. Each time you talk about our campaign, send an email, or share our campaign link on social media you are supporting us. Together, we can make our books possible and get them into the hands of readers! 

 

THANK YOU!

But finally, a huge thank you goes out to our family, friends, and colleagues. We couldn't have gotten this far without you. We know that many of you were brought to our crowdfunding campaign because of them. They have a bigger impact than they'll ever know.

story:
Humble Dream is a book about African women leaders where I share the stories of women who inspire and impact others for good.

My name is Meriem Boudjadja and I am the author of Humble Dream. I wrote this book because I wanted to showcase African inspirational stories and move away from the negative narrative and stereotypes around Africa.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that despite adverse circumstances, African women are carving a great future for themselves and paving the way forward for other younger women. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for women empowerment. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you feel inspired about what can be achieved when you start small.

In this book, you'll learn about skills that leaders exhibit, how you can become a leader by tweaking tradition, by dreaming, and by solving a problem for yourself or for your community. You'll hear stories about people such as...

  • Isabelle Sambou, who enjoyed traditional wrestling in Senegal and took it all the way to the Olympics. 
  • Marie Korsaga, who became the first doctor in Astrophysics in West Africa coming from a country where one in three girls can read and write. 
  • Nike Okundaye-Davies, who honed her craft as a traditional weaver and turned into an artist whose work is now part of the Smithsonian.

You will love this book if you like to be moved, inspired and motivated to become a better version of yourself.


Humble Dream is a nonfiction book that speaks to women and men who want to look at female empowerment and the definition of leadership in a new way.

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapter 1. These introduce and set the tone of the environment surrounding these women. It describes the challenges and difficulties these women face daily. 

Part 2 contains chapters 2-12. These chapters explain how these female African leaders all have something in common; they all started their journey and their dream small. They either followed tradition or tweaked it a little. They had a dream, a passion. They thought of solving a problem for themselves or their community. Finally, they even broke with tradition and social norms and ventured into men’s territory, working in areas that were not open to women. 

Part 3 contains the conclusion, where we sum up what was learned in the previous chapters. 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go toward the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish next Spring.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author 

Meriem Boudjadja is a gender and social inclusion consultant with work experience across four continents. Her insatiable curiosity led her through an unconventional path of diverse education and multicultural experiences to be a “cultural bridge.” 

Committed to encouraging cultural understanding and sharing her experience of diverse cultures, she felt compelled to write a book spotlighting inspirational stories of young women from Africa to change the negative narrative surrounding the continent. 

Through the women portrayed in the book and the contextual data provided, Meriem hopes that it will help the new generation of young Africans realize that women leadership takes many forms in Africa and help them identify opportunities in all areas of life. 

An avid reader and lover of classical music, Meriem enjoys traveling the globe, learning about and experiencing different cultures. When she is not trying new food, you will find her on the back of a horse or in a paddock. 

For more information, you can connect with Meriem Boudjadja at meriemboudjadja@gmail.com, at https://www.instagram.com/meriem_boudjadja/, and at linkedin.com/in/meriemboudjadja.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #Humbledream and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!


Thanks again,
Meriem Boudjadja

story:
Court sommaire

Je suis un passionné de littérature, de peinture, de photographie et de musique et je suis aussi un agent communautaire qui lutte pour la défense des plus démunis.

Depuis mon adolescence, je suis interpellé par des questions qui me bouleversent:  mes origines ancestrales, les ravages du colonialisme,  l'oppression des peuples, la pauvreté, le racisme, l'intolérance, les injustices sociales, la dégradation de l'environnement. Ces questions m’ont conduit dans une réflexion intérieure qui a fait ressurgir en moi toutes mes angoisses  face aux problèmes du monde.

Je désire à travers « Résurgence », mon premier livre de poésie, sensibiliser les gens sur les souffrances et les injustices de l'humanité, 

 J'utilise la poésie pour exprimer de façon limpide et suave, mes préoccupations et pour inviter les gens à réfléchir sur les souffrances du monde et à apporter collectivement une réponse pour changer positivement le visage de  notre planète. Ce, pour un meilleur avenir pour tous.

Extrait du livre

Les jeux de la misère

Un égout à ciel ouvert
Un enfant à demi-nu
Habits en haillons
Souliers délabrés
 

Un enfant souriant
Qui salue les passants


Les yeux défaillants
La peau collée au ventre
Blanchie par la poussière
Sous un soleil de plomb


L’enfant déambule dans une rue crevassée

Des maisons en tôles, en tissus et cartons délavés
Entourées de rigoles servant d’accotement

Puanteur à couper le souffle

 

Décor abject

Des hommes
Des femmes enceintes
Des bébés
Des enfants
Des vieillards

Plantés et résignés

Les jeux de la misère créent une ambiance ignoble
Les jeux de la misère nous interpellent


L’enfant continue sa route
Regardant çà et là des personnes
Fouillant des montagnes d’immondices
Pour trouver quelques miettes
Rivalisant avec les porcs et les chiens
Le soleil leur servant d’ombrage


Dans les dédales, l’enfant continue sa route

Les jeux de la misère nous adjurent
A nous regarder
A nous regarder autrement
Des gens sans vie qui cherchent la vie

L’enfant traverse des barricades
Théâtre de guerre pour les misérables
Mort subite des innocents
 

Barricades enflammées
Mitrailleuses qui chantent des cantiques
Un monde paniqué
Un monde violenté

Les jeux de la misère nous implorent à creuser
Sur la souffrance
Sur la misère
L’oppression
Des gens sans abris, sans habits

Sans espoirs pour les siens
Sans espoir de la vie
 

L’enfant poursuit sa route

Un terrain de foot
Des enfants s’amusent
 

Malgré le ventre creux
Malgré la gorge altérée
L’enfant vit l’illusion du bonheur

L’enfant saute de joie
Embrassades
Câlins
Poignées de mains

Les jeux de la misère anéantissent
Tout espoir
Toute attente pour les démunis, les exclus
Les abandonnés, les estropiés

Les jeux de la misère
Des jeux macabres à méditer les yeux ouverts

Court sommaire
Je suis un passionné de littérature, de peinture, de photographie et de musique et je suis aussi un agent communautaire qui lutte pour la défense des plus démunis.
Depuis mon adolescence, je suis interpellé par des questions qui me bouleversent:  mes origines ancestrales, les ravages du colonialisme,  l'oppression des peuples, la pauvreté, le racisme, l'intolérance, les injustices sociales, la dégradation de l'environnement. Ces questions m’ont conduit dans une réflexion intérieure qui a fait ressurgir en moi toutes mes angoisses  face aux problèmes du monde.
Je désire à travers « Résurgence », mon premier livre de poésie, sensibiliser les gens sur les souffrances et les injustices de l'humanité, 
 J'utilise la poésie pour exprimer de façon limpide et suave, mes préoccupations et pour inviter les gens à réfléchir sur les souffrances du monde et à apporter collectivement une réponse pour changer positivement le visage de  notre planète. Ce, pour un meilleur avenir pour tous.

story:
Story of My Book

Working Title: The Importance of the ECHL in Developing NHL-Caliber Players.

In summary, this book is about the ECHL and its role in developing NHL players. The book follows the stories of several players and looks at the ECHL’s current developmental situation.

My name is Griffin Germond and I am the author of The Importance of the ECHL in Developing NHL-Caliber Players. I wrote this book because there is limited literature and coverage on the ECHL, I believe that the league unfairly gets a bad rep, and I think that it is very important to realize the ECHL as a legitimate and true developmental league for NHL players and prospects.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that the ECHL has successfully developed 662 alumni to the NHL and that the league is trending in the right direction to increase those numbers. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for the ECHL, NHL, and player development in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you better understand ice hockey player development through the ECHL.

In this book, you'll also learn about some of the players that have gone from the ECHL to the NHL and the developmental future of the league:

  • This past October, Connor LaCouvee started the season as the third goaltender on the Maine Mariners, behind NHL contracted goaltenders, Chris Nell, and Brandon Halverson. In June, he was facing Cole Caufield, the Canadiens’ first-round pick in the 2019 NHL entry draft, on a breakaway in Montréal’s developmental camp. Who woulda thought?
     
  • After coming off of an explosive final season in the Quebec Major Junior Hockey League in 2013, Josh Currie had his eyes set on an NHL contract. The AHL was a second thought, and the ECHL wasn’t even a thought, to begin with. Yet, as fate would have it, he wound up in the ECHL the next season after failing to make the AHL’s Portland Pirates out of training camp. Though disappointed, he persevered, rounding out his game, and finally had a chance to prove his worth this past year in Edmonton.
     
  • The Newfoundland Growlers are one of the newest expansion franchises in the ECHL and are the proud affiliate of the Toronto Marlies and Toronto Maple Leafs. Franchise expectations were set high early on, and those expectations were fulfilled and exceeded, as Newfoundland won the Kelly Cup. The Growlers utilized 9 players under the age of 22. Yet, there are still some doubts about whether or not they paved the way for how development should be done at this level.

 

You will love this book if you’re a casual hockey fan, a hardcore hockey fan, and/or a minor league hockey fan. 

The Importance of the ECHL in Developing NHL-Caliber Players is a non-fiction book that speaks to hockey fans and players who are looking at minor league hockey and the ECHL as a true developmental league for the first time.

The Book - The Importance of the ECHL in Developing NHL-Caliber Players

The book is currently written in 5 Chapters, as opposed to parts...

Chapter 1: 3 parts. They contain the introduction + additional background to help better understand the ECHL, its history, and why I’m writing this book. One of the most famous goals in hockey history, specifically Vancouver Canucks history, was made possible by an undrafted player who worked his way through the minors and ultimately, into the hearts of many fans, and the hatred of others.

Chapter 2: 5 parts. In this chapter, you’ll meet some new faces. Four of the five I’ve interviewed directly and all have unique stories in their developmental phases in the ECHL. The fifth is somewhat of ‘exceptional talent,’ who’s been the subject of debate, as well as praise and disregard. But, he’s out to prove something.

Chapter 3: 5 parts. This chapter talks about how these players’ experiences take form, and how we can learn from those experiences. This chapter goes over the importance of experience and opportunities, connections, and the mental and physical sides of the game that must be realized in a highly competitive professional environment.

Chapter 4: 2 parts. The chapter is about “developing development,” which is the best way to describe it. There are insights into the Kelly Cup-winning Newfoundland Growlers and why they’re so important, as well as problems encountered in ECHL development.

Chapter 5: 4 parts. These parts primarily focus on how the ECHL can do better for its players and be a better developmental league. This includes better scheduling, more financial stability, and the importance of streamlined development through affiliates.

After the 5th Chapter, there are also some ‘Final Thoughts’ to end on.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019.
  • The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder.
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats).
  • The Copyediting for my book - to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this in the winter.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

Pre-order (1) eBook and receive...

  • Early access to the Introduction of my book
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

- - -

Pre-order (1) Copy of the Book and receive...

  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • Each book will be hand-numbered out of however many copies are sold during the pre-sale (For example, 1/xxx, 2/xxx, 3/xxx).

Pre-order (2) Copies of the Book and receive...

  • All previous incentives
  • Early access to part of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • A 2016-17 Upper Deck Young Guns Rookie card of one of the players whom I interviewed
  • A 2018-19 Upper Deck Young Guns Rookie card of one of the players whom I interviewed

Pre-order (4) Copies of the Book and receive...

  • All previous incentives
  • The opportunity to attend a book topic/workshop seminar(s) where I will share the experiences of writing my book
  • An official Maine Mariners ECHL baseball-style cap

Pre-order (10) Copies of the Book and receive...

  • All previous incentives
  • (4) Tickets to a future 2019-20 ECHL regular-season game of your choice on me (choice must be made by December 1st)

 

About the Author

Griffin Germond is a first-time author for New Degree Press. He is also a proud alumnus of the Communication and Media Studies Department at the University of Southern Maine, Class of 2019, and Gorham High School (Maine), Class of 2015.

He wrote this book because he has a passion for the sport of ice hockey, and being a season ticket holder for the ECHL’s Maine Mariners and attending a total of 39 Mariners games this past season alone, he felt that this is a topic he should pursue.

When he’s not watching hockey, he’s probably excitedly counting down the days until it’s back on.

For more information, you can connect with Griffin at griffin.germond@maine.edu, on LinkedIn, and on Instagram.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier. The shipping is included in the cost for anywhere worldwide.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #ECHL2NHLBook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page, to a variety of outlets.

Please share my book with friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of the support!

Warm regards,
Griffin Germond
#ECHL2NHLBook

story:
This is a story about Meredith, a bumbling witch struggling to survive in the world of the wicked. A fantasy novel equal parts comedy, action and drama. Jump through a portal to Galavan and see what witches have been up to since they were cast out from Earth!

I firmly believe in Try Before You Buy, so here is half the book in website format.

In this story you will get:

Magic! Incantation, Artificing, Golemancy, Dermaturgy, Alchemy, Mezzocraft, Botany... Meredith isn’t good at any of them!

Wickedness! Witches are pretty awful people, who could’ve guessed?

Worldbuilding! History, locations, maps, currency, governance, weather and utterly daft traditions, Galavan’s got it all.

Questionable judgment Heroism! When your back is against the wall, the only way out is through.

Failure! When the only way out is through, sometimes you get cut down to pieces.

Love! Of several different sorts.

A stab through the heart! Ha ha ha ha ha!

Slavery!

Art! Illustrations, signs, hand-written notes, an exciting receipt proof-of-purchase form for a soundstill, all obsessively depicted in detail. I included in the campaign gallery the non-spoiler art, but there is much more.

For the physical copy, this will all come bundled in a 6x9-inch book, 430 pages and glossy cover, all held to the highest standard of quality. Or if you want the DELUXE version, the hardcover is a gorgeous red linen wrapped in a matte dust jacket, the picture doesn't do it justice!

The interiors are crafted with love and care, with art for every chapter header, custom drop caps and lots of illustrations. Take a look at some of the first pages:

 

Why crowdfund?

This is more of a launch event than a crowd-funded project, because it’s a frikkin’ novel, a one-man show on which I’ve worked in my spare time through the years. But the money will be put to good use and every penny will be accountable. Please refer to the graph below:

This campaign does allow for some neat extras that a simple Amazon webpage wouldn't, such as signed books, bookmarks, posters and an exclusive hardcover edition.

Goals:

IndieGoGo only lets you choose a dollar amount as the goal, but my real goal is to sell 100 physical copies. I love the feel of a printed book (and bookmarks, I am so very much into bookmarks) and I want to ship this thing all over the world.

Potential risks:

It’s all done, from index to glossary. You will get your book unless I drop dead in the middle of the campaign, and even then you’ll probably still get it.

That being said, this is my first crowdfunding campaign ever so I expect mistakes and delays somewhere, probably with the extra bits like bookmarks and posters. Words don’t exist to express how much I care about this project, and I will spare no expense in time, effort and money to fix any problems that might arise.

PLEASE SHARE THIS ALL OVER

I'm a social outcast, help me through my shortcomings and save me from abject failure, ha ha ha! The sharing tools are at the top, next to the "back it" button.

Thanks a lot for reading. You're a peach.

After over 60 years, the original 1955 inviolate text is again available!

Welcome Urantia Book Readers!

For the first time in over sixty years, the unabridged, unaltered, inviolate first edition text of The Urantia Book has been reprinted exactly as it was originally published in 1955.

Until now, readers who want a first edition of The Urantia Book must search far and wide and pay dearly–currently $700 to $800 or more for used copies. This makes it especially difficult for scholars, scientists, theologians, and serious students who need to verify the timeliness of the information as stated in the 1955 first edition.

For example, Dr. Mark A. S. McMenamin, professor of geology at Mount Holyoke College, published a book titled: The Garden of Ediacara, Discovering the First Complex Life (Columbia University Press, 1998). In this study, Dr. McMenamin makes some remarkable references to The Urantia Book. He wrote to a Urantia Book reader with this inquiry: “If [The Urantia Book] was written in 1955, parts of it are strikingly ahead of their time. I could only locate the 1984 edition; can you confirm that pages 664-671 appeared as is in the 1955 edition?”

If the authentic 1955 inviolate text were available at a reasonable cost it would greatly facilitate complying with Dr. McMenamin’s request. Urantia Foundation published 10,000 copies of the inviolate text of The Urantia Book in 1955. It never again published the original inviolate text of The Urantia Book; changes were made in all printings of The Urantia Book after 1955.

For a limited time, readers have the opportunity to acquire a certified perfect replica of the 1955 first edition text of The Urantia Book for as little as $25 plus $5 shipping. This new publication is the same 7” x 10” size and color as the original book, hardcover, jacketed, and printed on high quality law book stock. The dust cover is the same light blue color as the original dust cover of the first printing. We selected Thomson Reuters, a prestigious international company that specializes in printing high quality case bound books, for this project. This inviolate first edition of The Urantia Book is a premium quality publication—not a print-on-demand product.

To achieve a perfect replication of the original inviolate text, we used a pristine 1955 first edition of The Urantia Book. We discovered that these 60-year-old books are in a state of disintegration and not amenable to ordinary scanning procedures. Consequently, we found it necessary to engage Joseph Merritt & Company, a leading specialist in the duplication of rare books.

Their duplication process involves individual high resolution photographic copies of each page, not scanning. We selected this costly process to insure high resolution files of the inviolate 1955 text of The Urantia Book that exactly replicate the text of the first printing.

 

How to Order Books

We have a limited number of extra books from the printing. Because we reached our goal, Indiegogo allows us to continue to offer these books for people to buy as perks on this webpage. 

To order books, hover your mouse over the box on the right that indicates the number of books you want. A large “GET THIS PERK” button will appear. Click on this button to order books.

During the process you can check the box designated “Anonymous”, if you prefer, so that your name and donation amount will not be listed publicly.

Your satisfaction is unconditionally guaranteed.

 

This project was offered to Urantia Foundation.

 

We offered this entire project to Urantia Foundation in 2015 to commemorate the 60th anniversary of the first edition. Our intention was to anonymously collaborate with Urantia Foundation to publish the inviolate first edition without requesting reimbursement or fees. Mo Siegel, President of Urantia Foundation, was interested and presented the project to the Board of Trustees at their meeting in July. We were told some Trustees thought it was a nice idea for the 60th, but they were all very busy with several other projects. They would need to take it up again at their next board meeting in October.

Mo reported back to us after the October meeting that the Trustees had decided not to pursue the project. He acknowledged we could publish the 1955 first edition of The Urantia Book on our own without the permission or participation of Urantia Foundation.

We appreciate those who labor in different vineyards at Urantia Foundation. However, our hope is that eventually Urantia Foundation will respect the views of those of us who are concerned with the permanent preservation of printed copies of the original 1955 inviolate first edition as mandated in their Declaration of Trust.

The Declaration of Trust that established Urantia Foundation in 1950 and was approved by the original Trustees and the revelators is posted on Urantia Foundation’s website. It states that: “It shall be the primary duty of the Trustees to perpetually preserve inviolate the text of The Urantia Book ... from loss, damage, or destruction and from alteration, modification, revision, or change in any manner or in any particular.”

We are concerned that these 60-year- old books are now in various states of decay. Effort should be made to preserve the inviolate text in book form (as also mandated in the Declaration of Trust) and make it available at a reasonable cost to anyone who wants a copy.

Some have suggested that a first edition of The Urantia Book can be downloaded from the internet. However, digital files can be altered, a printed book cannot. In addition, if printed from a download on ordinary copier paper (double-sided) it takes more than two reams of paper.

It is our goal to reprint the inviolate first edition text of The Urantia Book in book form to reserve this touchstone for all generations. Urantia Foundation and Urantia Fellowship have worked together to create a Standard Reference Text (SRT) which contains changes to the 1955 edition. We believe that the unaltered inviolate first edition is an essential anchor for the revelation and a necessary complement to the SRT editions.

Please join us in this historic effort to reprint the inviolate first edition text of The Urantia Book and restore it into the evolutionary mainstream. It is also a rare opportunity to acquire a copy of a true keepsake of a lifetime.

For more information, visit our website at www.urantiabookfirstedition.com

The following “Certificate of Authenticity” will be published within each copy of this inviolate first edition printing:

story:
Things that go bump in the night...

We're diligently working on a Carolina Haints book and YOU can be part of it!  For three years now, The Carolina Haints Podcast has delivered a spooky and compelling show about the ghost stories, folklore legends, unexplained mysteries, dark history and true crime stories from the Carolinas.  Now we're expanding and exploring these stories even deeper.  

But we need your help!  Writers Jeffrey Cochran and Dan Sellers will be visiting numerous locations across North Carolina to conduct research for the book.  In order to make it to all of these (sometimes hard to reach) locations, we need to raise funds for transportation, lodging, documentation, etc.  

Contributors who help us reach our goal can receive the following perks:

  • A shout out on an upcoming episode of the podcast,
  • Acknowledgement in the book,
  • An item of merchandise of your choice from Wreak Havoc Productions' catalog, 
  • A special, un-published episode of the podcast,
  • A signed copy of the book once its published, and
  • One of the Book's Dedications!

story:
The Canadian Festival of Spoken Word (CFSW) is a week long festival celebrating finely crafted verse, heartfelt performance, and cut-throat competition. It's like the Olympics for feelings and talking. Except no other countries are invited. This year CFSW is in Peterborough, Ontatio. We're ready to go, we just need your help to get there!

Meet The Team

This year's team features a mix of CFSW veterans (as feared as we are huggable) and never-before-seen secret weapons (risen through the ranks of other poetry scenes and ready to take over CFSW.)

Anomaly is a poet, musician, and activist who grew out of the seaweed and lichen of the West Coast. She's captained teams from Vancouver to Montreal, and this will be her third time at the Canadian Festival of Spoken Word. She has appeared in Oratorealis, the Soliloquies Anthology, and has several self-published chapbooks. Offstage you can find her smashing the state or in an alley trying to pet a cat

Halogen, aka Jenny Smart, aka “that girl who just fell out of a tree and then hugged it” is a poet, performer, and aspiring person. She has competed at CFSW three times and keeps going back for more. Her work can be found in print in The New Quarterly, Soliloquies, Headlights, and on little scraps of paper mixed into her laundry. Halogen hopes to be a plant when she grows up and would like to be your imaginary friend.

Halfwhitefullblack: spoken word poet, screenwriter, podcast host, and activist jared roboz, widely known as j-rob, seeks to change the world by offering honesty, compassion, and a raised fist. fighting the power, for the people, he wishes to give a voice to the silenced through art and interviews, cinema and soundwaves. he is a gamer, a comic book geek, hip-hop head, and, most importantly, a human being

Caroline is an aspiring poet and biology student at McGill. She believes we should all work to protect this pale blue dot we call Earth. Her hobbies include visiting local coffee shops and humming.

Raissa Simone is a writer, musician, and activist living in Kingston, Ontario. She is the founder of the POCTALK open mic for people of colour, former director of Slam Kingston, and a finalist in the 2011 Canadian Festival of Spoken Word. She has performed and featured at numerous events and festivals. Currently pursuing a PhD at Concordia University, Raissa aims to fuse her social justice activism and artistic fluidity into her performances, creating an atmosphere of tension, fervor, and vibrancy.

 

FAQ (Frequently Assumed Questionable-ness)

Now, you may be wondering, “What kind of rag-tag team of confused post-beatnik hipster bohemians am I getting myself mixed up with here?” In true poet style, we have the answers to questions you haven't even asked yet.

Can a bunch of over-emotional Anglo Montrealians really know what's up in the worlds coolest poetry scene?
Thanks for asking. As a matter of fact our city is kinda good at this stuff. Montreal has been sending a team to CFSW for almost a decade. The Throw! Team has qualified for semi-finals and finals many times and in 2015 we placed 2nd in the country by less than half a point. We're going back for that 0.5 we missed.

Do they even own berets?
We're more of a toque crowd, but every single on of us almost speaks French. The charming farm themed locals of Peterborough will be in awe of our artsy auras.

What if they get lost on the way to Ontario and end up road tripping across Saskatchewan while collaboratively writing The Great Canadian Novel of the century but missing nationals?
With your help, we'll have the funds to print off enough Google Maps directions to get there AND back.

If I donate, will you spend my money on something cool, like a gold-plated microphone or a parrot who recites Shakespeare?
No. We'll spend it on something lame like gas money, hotel bills, and not starving.

“Helping” is nice and all, but what's in it for me?
How about some of the coolest, cutest, weirdest, wildest poetry prizes you've ever seen? Check out our perks for watermelon-smashing shenanigans, cat-finding missions, even some physical objects that actually exist.

Sharing is Caring

Can't contribute cash? Don't worry, we can still be friends. You don't even have to miss out on the perks! We're all about spreading the word, so everyone who shares our campaign on social media will get a personalized haiku. Just send a link or screenshot of your post to halogenpoetry@gmail.com and a team member will hit you up with a 17 syllable thank you.

story:
Hello, Everyone!

My name is Kimberly Gasuras and I live, and write, in a small town in Ohio. I've been a writer for as long as I can remember and after 15 years in the newspaper business as a reporter, I am now going it alone as a freelance writer and author. My articles have appeared in USA Today as well as multiple publications and websites.

Immigration has been a topic of discussion lately, yet many people do not understand the immigration process. They don't know how long it takes someone to legally come to the United States, or how long it takes an immigrant to become a United States citizen. I didn't know, either, until I asked my dad to tell me his story of coming to this country from Greece when he was just 14-years-old.

My dad’s story is extremely interesting and highlights the issues that immigrants face before, and after, they arrive in the United States. After writing a blog post featuring a small part of his story, I learned more information from my cousin, Vicky, and wanted to expand the entire family’s story into book form. I also became curious about the story of my mom and her family’s migration to Ohio from Virginia, and how, with parents coming from so far away, my brother and I ended up being raised in Bucyrus, Ohio.

Growing up as part of one of the few Greek families living in Bucyrus, a town steeped in German heritage, has been very interesting. My brother jokes that he and I are "Greek Hillbillies" but having a family history of two completely different cultures has taught me much about life and about how to treat others who are different from me.

My book is a story of immigration, migration, prejudice, and acceptance. I'm hoping to enlighten people on how the immigration process worked when my dad came to this country, and how it is set up today. I realize my dad was never an illegal immigrant, but through his story, I realized how easily a person could become one and I'm hoping readers of my book will learn that too.

My book will feature stories about my dad’s family such as my Uncle Pete who came to the United States with a note that simply read, “Bucyrus, America.” Uncle Pete eventually opened his own shoe shine business in downtown Bucyrus, and many local residents worked for him. The actual shoe shine stand that was used in his shop is now on exhibit at the Bucyrus Historical Society. My book will also feature the true love story of my parents, how they met and the obstacles they faced trying to date because of prejudices that my grandfather had towards “foreigners.” It will highlight my dad’s job loss due to downsizing and his subsequent success in opening a Greek Restaurant in a town in which many residents had never even tried Greek food! It will tell how my mom learned to cook Greek foods as perfectly as she did the Southern foods she ate while growing up. In essence, this book will show how people can be very different from each other, yet so similar in more ways than they realize. My book will also feature all the positive things about Bucyrus and what made my parents want to stay and raise me and my brother in the town in which they'd met.

My campaign for “When Two Journeys Became One: A Story of Immigration, Migration, Prejudice, and Acceptance,” is to offset the costs of the writing, producing, and publishing of this book. My publication goal date is August 5th of this year in hopes of having copies of the book before the annual Bratwurst Festival for which Bucyrus is known!

If you donate to my campaign, there are perks! Whether you can donate or not, I appreciate your interest in my campaign and would love it if you could use the Indiegogo tools to share my campaign on your social media pages!!! Thank you so much for stopping by!!

story:
Life in Yellow is a memoir about my own journey with personal growth and acceptance after experiencing hardship. .

My name is Liz Irons and I am the author of Life in Yellow. I wrote this book to reflect on my mom’s colon cancer diagnosis and treatment throughout my sophomore year of high school. At the time, I wrote about our family’s experience for my local newspaper and felt a surge of comfort in sharing my story. As I’ve grown, I’ve wanted to experience that comfort and strength again and share the insights I’ve gained from this experience and others.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover something new about yourself. My experience reading memoirs has always sparked my own self-reflection. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to further understand and cherish those around you — to build more honest relationships within your immediate family, with your friends, and even with yourself.

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of what it means to be a woman and how to aspire towards selflessness through narratives that include:

  • A story about discovering the power behind a pair of yellow hospital socks and what it means to care for a parent who’s only ever taken care of you.
  • An essay about the way women idolize one another when seeking out their own perfection and how this journey can lead to its own highs and lows starting at a very young age.
  • A story about realizing the confines you had created for yourself and the freedom found in a midnight bike ride around Milan, Italy.

 

You will love this book if you love coming-of-age stories, learning more about those around you, and have experience overcoming hardship.

Life in Yellow speaks to young women and men who want to grapple with family hardship and self-reflection in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Life in Yellow inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How do we measure our own progress over time? Do we like this current version of ourselves?
  • How do we balance being a more selfless and loving friend/family member while still prioritizing our own independent growth?
  • How can we further empower young women to share their stories?

 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe that openly discussing our personal hardships and will change us all for the better.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021].
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook.

When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

About the Author

Liz Irons is a graduating senior at The George Washington University, having studied political communication and public health throughout her undergraduate career. With a keen interest in health policy, Liz will begin a full-time position executing public relations in the health care sector later this summer.

Liz wrote her story to learn more about her own parental relationships, to describe the struggle to become more independent as a young person, to get over her first heartbreak, to share her experiences travelling alone, and to further grow and become a more intentional and selfless version of herself.

In her spare time, Liz likes to read, bake every dessert under the sun, and explore DC’s various neighborhoods and restaurants with her friends. She is also a big fan of tortilla chips, romantic comedies, and spending as much time as possible by the ocean.

For more information, you can connect with Liz Irons at lizirons@gwu.edu and @lizironic across all social media platforms.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #LifeInYellow and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Liz Irons

Life in Yellow is a memoir about my own journey with personal growth and acceptance after experiencing hardship. .My name is Liz Irons and I am the author of Life in Yellow. I wrote this book to reflect on my mom’s colon cancer diagnosis and treatment throughout my sophomore year of high school. At the time, I wrote about our family’s experience for my local newspaper and felt a surge of comfort in sharing my story. As I’ve grown, I’ve wanted to experience that comfort and strength again and share the insights I’ve gained from this experience and others.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover something new about yourself. My experience reading memoirs has always sparked my own self-reflection. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to further understand and cherish those around you — to build more honest relationships within your immediate family, with your friends, and even with yourself.In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of what it means to be a woman and how to aspire towards selflessness through narratives that include:

A story about discovering the power behind a pair of yellow hospital socks and what it means to care for a parent who’s only ever taken care of you.
An essay about the way women idolize one another when seeking out their own perfection and how this journey can lead to its own highs and lows starting at a very young age.
A story about realizing the confines you had created for yourself and the freedom found in a midnight bike ride around Milan, Italy.

 
You will love this book if you love coming-of-age stories, learning more about those around you, and have experience overcoming hardship.Life in Yellow speaks to young women and men who want to grapple with family hardship and self-reflection in a new way.Ultimately, I hope that Life in Yellow inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

How do we measure our own progress over time? Do we like this current version of ourselves?
How do we balance being a more selfless and loving friend/family member while still prioritizing our own independent growth?
How can we further empower young women to share their stories?

 
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe that openly discussing our personal hardships and will change us all for the better.
