story:
ANGELA fits many 3rd world child stereotypes. Small for her age, lives in an orphanage, 11 years old but studies in the 1st grade. Powerful images of children like Angela from developing countries frequently solicit our attention on TV or online in order to provoke an altruistic response; who can say no to a child in need? But would their stories be the same if the children were the ones doing the talking?


Let’s LISTEN

Would you have guessed that when asked to describe herself Angela ended her response with y me gusta como soy – and I like the way I am? In fact, during a series of pilot workshops designed to allow a class of first graders to explore and take pride in their unique identities this past spring, the students responded with an abundance of profound, heart-felt, and eye opening examples of what it means to be an elementary school student from Quetzaltenango, Guatemala. Many were responses that children from the developing world have traditionally been denied from expressing in American mass media. One student wrote that they want to be a police officer when they grow up to “round up all the thieves and assassins to make the country a better place.” Many wrote about how much they care about their families. Several of the 6 and 7 year olds were simply emphatic about their dislike of vegetables. We’ve ignored their voices for too long.

Why Y Me Gusta Como Soy Matters

While cultural and racial diversity continue to rise among US school children, the diversity of children’s literature they have access to has not kept pace. In fact, today a large gap exists in children’s literature leaving many minority groups under represented in bookstores, in libraries, and in classrooms. According to the US Department of Education National Center for Educational Statistics and the Cooperative Children’s Book Center, part of the University of Wisconsin’s School of Education, minorities make up approximately 48% of the US K-12 student population, yet are only represented in about 8% of currently published children’s books. By supporting Y Me Gusta Como Soy you are helping to reduce this diversity gap. And you’re helping to turn a class of elementary students into published authors. Future sales of the Y Me Gusta Como Soy children’s book will bring money back to the students and their school, improving families’ economic security and providing a continued investment in the education of the children.

_____________________________________________________________________________

This project is not about giving a voice to the children. It’s about listening to what they have to say. And what they have to say matters. Y Me Gusta Como Soy promotes cross-cultural exchange – connecting the voices of children from one classroom in Guatemala to the ears of children and families from all around the world – and adds much needed cultural diversity to children’s literature. This isn’t a book about children from a developing county; it's a book written by them.


Program Basics

The Y Me Gusta Como Soy campaign will fund a six-month long after school program designed to engage the students in activities that strengthen their academic performance and celebrate who they are. Activities will include structured and unstructured writing prompts, artistic development through drawing, painting and story-telling, reading and writing assistance, homework help, and other activities designed by the children. Student material from the after school program will be compiled to produce the contents of the bilingual book. Do you have an activity idea for the children? Please share HERE.


The School

The Y Me Gusta Como Soy project will be carried out with the collaboration of Escuela De La Calle. Escuela De La Calle (Edelac) is an elementary school located in the suburb of Las Rosas, Quetzaltenango, Guatemala. Founded in 1996, the school provides educational and community services, including a recently opened health clinic, to over 150 students from impoverished families at risk of homelessness. The mission of Edelac is to empower the children in Las Rosas with an education that provides them with a solid economic foundation for their future to keep them from returning to the streets.

The Children


We will be working with these soon to be second graders from Las Rosas, Guatemala. During my time volunteering in the classroom with them this past year I got to know each one of them very well, and was often humbled by their positive views on life and the future. If you take the time to listen to these children, they will change the way you think!

The program will begin in mid January 2015 (the start of the Guatemalan school year) and continue through June 2015 when the children leave for summer vacation. A nutritious lunch (the first meal of the day for many students) will be provided for the students at the start of each activity. Following lunch, students will have two hours to work on the week’s activities and receive homework help they may need.

The students’ written and artistic responses to each week’s activities will be compiled into the contents of the children’s book. The book will be bilingual, in Spanish and English, in order to preserve the children’s original words. Topics of the book will be based on what the children think of as important to them and will include themes such as family, cultural identity, stories and jokes told by the students, the students’ dreams, the students’ fears, and what they like to do in their free time.


The Facebook page for Y Me Gusta Como Soy will serve as the project’s media outlet and frequent updates will be posted over the span of the program keeping you, the sponsor, informed about the book’s progress. The Facebook page is a space where you can personally connect with the students and the project; your feedback and comments are welcome!

Why Support Y Me Gusta Como Soy?

·  Promotes cultural and ethnic diversity among children’s books

·  Provides Escuela de la Calle with resources and school materials they lack

·  Upon publication of the book the students will become published authors with profits from book sales returning to the school and to the students for further educational investment

·  Says to the students, “Yes, we appreciate you the way you are!”

Your Funding

Your generous donations will be used to:

·  Purchase craft materials and art and writing supplies for the program’s activities

·  Provide a lunch prepared with wholesome local ingredients at the beginning of every activity

·  Provide stipends to teachers and staff to provide adequate staffing during program hours

·  Purchase personal and educational supplies for students and the school. These will be provided on an as-need basis and range from toothbrushes, soap, and first aid items to things teachers use every day in the classroom such as whiteboard markers, poster paper, toner for the school’s printer, and books for the library

·  Design and edit the manuscript for publication

·  Provide me with a living stipend to be able to continue volunteering full time in the school as an assistant teacher

_____________________________________________________________________________

Our global society demands higher quality and more diverse children’s literature. Why should we accept books written about a group of people when we can listen to them speak directly? Please show your support by donating or choosing a perk that interests you and by sharing this campaign with others who support a child’s right to like they way they are!

story:
Short Summary:

Hi! I'm Tiffany, the creator of the Bohemian Wild Lenormand! After a successful adventure with my Lenormand Deck, I've started on a new path. I am now illustrating a new deck inspired by the Elder Futhark Runes. 

I'm a over halfway through the artwork. It's taking longer to complete the artwork for a prototype deck because I'm drawing multiple images per card that is going to bring the runes to life.

With your help and support this runic deck will come to life here, first on Indiegogo!

What Will Happen:

I'm starting with aiming for $500 in order to get a select few decks into the community. Check out the fun perks inspired by the whimsical illustrations! The funds will be 80% for production and 20% for media materials.

A little about Rune cards:

Runes are an ancient Germanic alphabet, used for writing, divination and magic. They were used throughout northern Europe, Scandinavia, the British Isles, and Iceland from about 100 B.C.E. to 1600 C.E. and the Elder Futhark is thought to be the oldest version of the runic alphabet.

Runic divination, "runecasting", is not just fortune telling. The runic symbols represent the entire universe. As one asks a question, one's conscious and unconscious mind focuses on that question, so that the runic cards selected are not just random selections, but are choices made by the subconscious.

The 24 runes of the Elder Futhark are in their prescribed order for a reason. Each rune and each aett in turn is built upon a foundation of the runes that proceed it in a logical and methodical pattern. Beware of authors that rearrange the runes into new random patterns and claim it’s due to their being “enlightened”. The organization and arrangement of the Elder Futhark has been in use and in place for 3,000 years. Even the name “Futhark” is a representation of the first six runes of the first aett.

The runes of the Elder Futhark are divided into three groups of eight runes each. Each group is called an Aett.

The first group, aett, is associated with the Goddess Freya. This aett symbolizes the creation of the universe, order out of chaos, and the creation of all things.

The second aett is named after the God Heimdall. This aett is about the disruptive forces that cause great change in the energies established in the first aett.

The third aett is named after the God Tyr. This aett is essentially about the gods and divinity.

What we need and what you get:

The illustrations for the cards are almost complete and if this campaign is successful, the deck will be ready to hit the printing press almost immediately. However, we need your help to make that happen and we will be so excited if together, we can bring this deck into the world! Listed in the perks is a limited number of decks available  get yours today!

This 24 card deck will be printed at standard 2.45 x 3.95" card size, packaged in a custom card tuck box. 

Other ways to help:

If you cannot contribute, another way to help is to spread the word and share this campaign on Instagram, Facebook, Twitter or a blog.

The Perks!

story:
Story of My Book

 

Making Moonshots.
My name is Rahul Rana and I’m the author of Making Moonshots, a deep-dive into the mindsets, philosophies, and strategies that are conducive to building moonshot companies. These are businesses that take an advanced technology or science and use it in a radically-creative solution to solve a huge problem in the world. I’m writing this book because I want to inspire people to make more of these breakthrough startups. We can all benefit from more of them, as they work on the frontiers of what’s possible and take on seemingly-impossible missions with audacious, cutting-edge solutions.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the moonshot mindset, comprised of key mental models, guiding principles, and states of mind, and actively apply it to your own life. From maximizing human potential to navigating entrepreneurial complexity, I delve into various facets of the journey in making a world-changing company. While I portray them in the context of impactful deeptech startups, the universal lessons can be used for anyone’s personal goals. Ultimately, I hope to instill the same passion and excitement in you that I have for important breakthrough enterprises by demystifying the non-obvious aspects of founding one.

In this book, you'll learn about:
  • The characteristics of an innovative founder; their mindset, and how this translates into the process of materializing a groundbreaking idea.
  • Philosophies and mental models either used by these entrepreneurial pioneers or those that are proven to help make ideal decisions when dealing with AI, SpaceTech, BioTech, and so many more industries.
  • A blueprint for solving the most complex problems and then applying it to the real world, thus building an ecosystem of moonshot companies that solve the world’s most intractable problems. 

You will love this book if you are 1) excited by the future of science, technology, and entrepreneurship 2) if you want to make an impact on the world and 3) have a bold life mission that you want to fulfill.

Making Moonshots is a non-fiction book that speaks to aspiring founders and STEM/business enthusiasts who are looking to solve the most pressing problems in our world by creating unique startups. A new golden age is about to erupt in modern times. Dare to dream bigger. Let’s make some moonshots.

 

The Book - Making Moonshots


The book is written in 4 Parts...

Part 1 contains the introduction + beginning chapters. This section is all about setting up the scene about what a moonshot company is, the etymology of the term, and the basics about it. It’s a general foundation for the blueprint to come. From Wally Moon and John F. Kennedy to Elon Musk and some lesser-known founders, you’ll get to see a complete profile on how to think like them.

Part 2, entitled The Moon, contains the intangible aspects— psychology and philosophy. In the 60’s, the Apollo missions were more than just a bold and seemingly-impossible task— the mindset that JFK imparted onto the nation was most valuable. Many are now applying a similar thought process to startups, as there are clear characteristics and mental models — from radical creativity to futurist thinking to stoicism — that define a moonshot founder.

Part 3, entitled The Shot, contains tangible aspects— strategy and ecosystem. Taking the aforementioned aspects of the radically-creative mindset, I delve into how to act upon it in the real world and how we can nurture an ecosystem of these impactful deeptech companies.

Part 4 contains the conclusion. This section is all about wrapping it up and leaving you, the reader, with a final call to action. I hope after reading it that you will go on to fulfill your life’s purpose and pursue your moonshot task within. It’s all about recognizing your truest passions and the chips on your shoulder to channel that energy into a meaningful project, whether it’s to ease human suffering, ensure planetary health, or anything else that truly matters to you.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

Rahul Rana is studying Finance, Business Analytics, and Cognitive Science at Rutgers University. He's vastly interested in venture capital, startups, deeptech, and making impact. 

Rahul is writing this book because he wants to help solve all of the world’s most intractable problems — societal issues that affect millions, if not billions, of people — and lead a truly impactful life. Story of My Book
 
Making Moonshots.My name is Rahul Rana and I’m the author of Making Moonshots, a deep-dive into the mindsets, philosophies, and strategies that are conducive to building moonshot companies. These are businesses that take an advanced technology or science and use it in a radically-creative solution to solve a huge problem in the world. I’m writing this book because I want to inspire people to make more of these breakthrough startups. We can all benefit from more of them, as they work on the frontiers of what’s possible and take on seemingly-impossible missions with audacious, cutting-edge solutions.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the moonshot mindset, comprised of key mental models, guiding principles, and states of mind, and actively apply it to your own life. From maximizing human potential to navigating entrepreneurial complexity, I delve into various facets of the journey in making a world-changing company. While I portray them in the context of impactful deeptech startups, the universal lessons can be used for anyone’s personal goals. Ultimately, I hope to instill the same passion and excitement in you that I have for important breakthrough enterprises by demystifying the non-obvious aspects of founding one.In this book, you'll learn about:
The characteristics of an innovative founder; their mindset, and how this translates into the process of materializing a groundbreaking idea.
Philosophies and mental models either used by these entrepreneurial pioneers or those that are proven to help make ideal decisions when dealing with AI, SpaceTech, BioTech, and so many more industries.
A blueprint for solving the most complex problems and then applying it to the real world, thus building an ecosystem of moonshot companies that solve the world’s most intractable problems. 

You will love this book if you are 1) excited by the future of science, technology, and entrepreneurship 2) if you want to make an impact on the world and 3) have a bold life mission that you want to fulfill.Making Moonshots is a non-fiction book that speaks to aspiring founders and STEM/business enthusiasts who are looking to solve the most pressing problems in our world by creating unique startups. A new golden age is about to erupt in modern times. Dare to dream bigger. Let’s make some moonshots.
 

The Book - Making Moonshots

The book is written in 4 Parts...
Part 1 contains the introduction + beginning chapters. This section is all about setting up the scene about what a moonshot company is, the etymology of the term, and the basics about it. It’s a general foundation for the blueprint to come. From Wally Moon and John F. Kennedy to Elon Musk and some lesser-known founders, you’ll get to see a complete profile on how to think like them.Part 2, entitled The Moon, contains the intangible aspects— psychology and philosophy. In the 60’s, the Apollo missions were more than just a bold and seemingly-impossible task— the mindset that JFK imparted onto the nation was most valuable. Many are now applying a similar thought process to startups, as there are clear characteristics and mental models — from radical creativity to futurist thinking to stoicism — that define a moonshot founder.Part 3, entitled The Shot, contains tangible aspects— strategy and ecosystem. Taking the aforementioned aspects of the radically-creative mindset, I delve into how to act upon it in the real world and how we can nurture an ecosystem of these impactful deeptech companies.Part 4 contains the conclusion. This section is all about wrapping it up and leaving you, the reader, with a final call to action. I hope after reading it that you will go on to fulfill your life’s purpose and pursue your moonshot task within. It’s all about recognizing your truest passions and the chips on your shoulder to channel that energy into a meaningful project, whether it’s to ease human suffering, ensure planetary health, or anything else that truly matters to you.

story:
Who are you?

My name is Clare C. Marshall, and I’m an author/publisher. My publishing imprint is Faery Ink Press, and I publish young adult science fiction, fantasy, and horror novels--all written by me.  Since 2011 I’ve published one book a year and travelled across the country promoting my work at various conventions, readings, and signings. I also edit, format, and manage websites for a variety of authors like myself. Anything publishing-related, I’m there.

What is The Silver Spear?

The Silver Spear is the second book in the Violet Fox quadrilogy. 

In the land of Marlenia, there are two kinds of people.

Those who live on the surface (the Marlenians)...

...and those who are forced to live underground (the Freetors).

In the first book, The Violet Fox, Kiera Driscoll (aka, The Violet Fox) was like a 15-year-old Robin Hood: she snuck up to the surface and stole food and resources for her people living underground. One day, she was tasked by the Elders to disguise herself as a princess from a neighbouring province on the surface and sneak into the castle to retrieve a stolen magical artefact. Of course, when she got to the castle, she became entangled in castle politics, and fell in love with the prince!

Now, in The Silver Spear, she faces a greater threat. Tensions are high between the West and the East. War threatens to break out, and her people are not ready. But far to the West at the edge of the world, on the land her ancestors used to own, the Silver Spear is rumored to lie deep in a cave from where no one has returned. Kiera, accompanied by Prince Keegan and a mysterious bard with a secret must make the journey across the land--risking their lives and the safety of the West--to retrieve a weapon that could unite the Freetors and the Marlenians against their common enemies.



Cinderella meets Robin Hood: that’s the overall tone and plot of the series.

I’ve never heard of The Violet Fox.

You can pick it up from any eBook retailer ($3.99), select Canadian bookstores, or directly from the source at FaeryInkPress.com. The Violet Fox is also available at several of the perk levels.

But how do I know if I'll LIKE this book series?

If you enjoy:

1) Fairy tale retelling & adventure

2) Detailed fantasy worlds

3) Castle intrigue, where no one is who they seem! (dun dun dun…)

4) Female protagonists who KICK BUTT!

5) Forbidden romance!! :O

6) Epic journeys across a fantasy land

...then you will enjoy The Violet Fox Series, and especially The Silver Spear.

Don't believe me? Try it for yourself. Sample of The Silver Spear, below (contains NO spoilers):

Read a sample from the second chapter here:

A gurgle-infused whisper overlaid the Holy One’s once-powerful, booming voice. Today, it was hoarse from not speaking for a while, but it still carried a strength that would put fear into any law-disobeying Freetor. I left the door open a crack, just in case Keegan or another attendant needed to come in.

I stepped closer to the dying man. It was strange to think of him as a man, really. For so long he was an untouchable figurehead, the leader of the surface world. He was always old, always frail—but seeing his glazed-over eyes, the countless wrinkles engraved in his sagging face, his skin dry and white and his once-brilliant white hair now turning to ashen grey—I guess I never thought in my life I’d feel sad for a man that supported the death of my people. That was before I’d saved his life from Elder Erskina, though. I couldn’t have feelings for Keegan and hate the man that gave him life.

I didn’t want to sound rude or forward, but because death was near, I had to use my time with him wisely. I sat on a stool beside the bed. “Why did you ask me here?”

One raspy breath in, and another out. My fingers wrapped around the bedpost. If he died before me, right now, Keegan would never forgive me. Whatever it was he had to tell me, I had to get it out of him quick so Keegan could have his father back.

“Dashiell came to me, in a dream,” the Holy One said finally.

I parted my lips to speak, but he shook his head slowly. “I know your people don’t believe. I know that…that my ancestors have done violent things in his name. But seeing you…in the Grand Square…”

He fell into a violent coughing fit. There was a pile of white tissues beside the collection of remedies on the night table, and I offered him one, but it came back red.

He wiped his mouth. “My dream…Dashiell, brilliant in white light. He spoke to me. He said, my messenger will put me back together again. Do you know what this means?”

I shook my head.

“Your name. Kiera Driscoll.” He pronounced the words slowly, carefully. “In the library, in the old texts, it says the Driscolls held land by the Forever Sea, near the western-most tip of this province.” He held up a heavy hand and pointed to a pile of tomes on the nightstand. “I have been reading about before the war.”

My breath caught. I found my feet and sauntered to the texts. Information about my ancestors, before the Marlenian-Freetor war. Not Rordan, nor my father, had told me anything about what my family had done on the surface. All we’d known, for two hundred years, was hate.

I flipped through the pages. Most of them were faded records and maps of who held what land, who was the eldest son of whom and what daughter had married what other lesser lord. Some of the handwriting was so faded that it was impossible to decipher. But if my family history was in here, then maybe Laoise’s was too, and all the other Freetors. We would finally know what lands were really ours.

And so would the Marlenians.

“Most of these books were destroyed during the war,” the Holy One said. “No one wanted any record of Freetors holding lands, in case one came to claim them.”

My hand passed over the leather-bound cover. “What does this have to do with your dream?”

The Holy One coughed blood again into a tissue clutched tightly in his hand. Even his eyelids were creased with little wrinkles. I wondered how old he really was.

“Your name. Driscoll. It means, the messenger. Dashiell said, the messenger will put me back together again.”

“That’s it?” I knew I was being rude, but I couldn’t help it.

“The pieces of Dashiell,” the Holy One said. “You know them.”

I frowned. “I don’t know--”

“The pieces.” He was more insistent this time. “The artefacts.”

Yes, I did know them. The Orb of Dashiell, once held by the Holy One’s sceptre, was safe in my quarters. That was one of them.

“The orb. The cloth. The slab. The spear.” He hacked more blood.

“I’m calling Keegan. You need to rest,” I said.

I went for the door when his powerful voice overcame me. “You must find the spear.”

I stopped, and turned slowly. “The…Silver Spear?”

“Yes. You know the story.”

Actually, I didn’t. Not really. There was a myth that Alastar the Hero had travelled to the end of the Forever Sea and found a spear encased in ice. It was the most beautiful thing he’d ever seen, and he wanted it, because he could see it was magic. When he tried to break the ice with his own spells, it shattered and marred his face. He lost an eye, some said. Others insisted that he played a game of riddles with a magical tiger guarding the spear and lost, losing his eye as penance, but still made off with the spear anyway. I didn’t know whether or not he kept the spear, or whether this happened before or during the war.

“It’s just a story,” I said. But even I could hear the uncertainty in my voice.

***

You can read the first few chapters of The Violet Fox, the first book in the series, here.

What do I need the money for?

I am raising $1,000 to cover the editorial cost of publishing the The Silver Spear. This will cover a structural edit and a copy edit from my editor as well as the fees from Indiegogo. If I surpass this goal, the extra money raised will go to the production costs--and if we surpass it by lot, I will be able to do a small offset run.

Why should I contribute to this project?

Publishing is not a sprint. It's a marathon. I went to school for publishing, I work in publishing, and I spend my free time publishing. I will always be a publisher. Here's a little bit more about me, my press & the Silver Spear.


The Violet Fox was on the Winnipeg Bestseller list!

Richard Hatch of Battlestar Galactica fame even bought a copy at KeyCon 2013, which was pretty cool!! :)


The Violet Fox has been on the Amazon bestseller list a time or two as well!

About Faery Ink Press

Faery Ink Press publishes young adult science fiction, fantasy, and horror novels. My novels feature strong, intelligent young women thrust into fantastical circumstances. One fights aliens with her new superhero friends at a secretive university in Northern Alberta. Another fights for her people's freedom to live on the surface in the fantasy land of Marlenia. I aim to publish great looking, smart spec fic that women young and old will enjoy--and stories that will hopefully stay with them for a long time.

Contributing to The Silver Spear gives me the means to continue making beautiful books that people across the country--and the world--have come to enjoy. By publishing my own books, I am taking control of my art, and building something that I hope will outlast me. 

Book Themes

The Violet Fox Series explores three major themes.

1) The definition of freedom

For the first time in over 200 years, the Freetor people have a real shot at returning to their rightful place on the surface. No longer will they be forced to live underground. They are free.

Or are they? Just because the law has been changed, does not mean their freedom is guaranteed. There is no room on the surface for them, and many are too afraid to abandon the caves that they have come to know as home. Others feel that they are not free because those they consider to be their enemy still lives. Many Freetors see the Silver Spear as a symbol of their freedom, as it was the weapon of legend wielded by their ancestor against the Holy One of old, before they were forced underground. If Kiera retrieves it, it will give them the permission--the courage--they desperately seek to live in the sun once more.

The question is: is freedom something that must be given or ordained, or is it something that must be taken by force?

2) Love vs Duty

Kiera, our protagonist, struggles with this in the first book but now faces it head-on in The Silver Spear. She has deep feelings for Prince Keegan and is faced with the very real possibility of being the future queen of the land. But does she really love him, or is she marrying him to give her people a better future? Her feelings for him are tested as they journey together across the world in search of an artefact that may or may not exist--which only heightens the tension between the two of them, for she is dead certain that The Silver Spear does exist, and that it can help them win the inevitable war to come.

3) Prejudice against minorities

This has already been explored in The Violet Fox, but the theme is carried over in The Silver Spear. Prejudice doesn't disappear overnight and we see what happens when Kiera, a Freetor and once considered a Robin Hood figure, is now expected to rule over the people she used to steal from.

Risks & Challenges

Publishing is a risky business, but I’ve done a lot to minimize my publishing costs. Editing is the one major cost for publishing a book, besides printing. The other aspects of publishing--interior formatting, eBook creation, cover design & creation--are done by me or my partner.

This also isn’t my first rodeo. The Silver Spear will be my fifth publication and I’ve refined my process each time.

Wait, hold up, why does shipping cost so much?

Shipping in Canada is expensive. Books are heavy. Unfortunately, books like The Violet Fox and The Silver Spear, because of their page count, fall into the parcel category. Because of this, they are automatically at least $10 more expensive than shipping it as a letter (must fit through the letter slot). And that's just within Canada. Canada Post is the cheapest shipping solution I've found for my needs, but if there's enough orders, I may be able to find a cheaper solution. So please, spread the word! Or if the shipping is too much of a problem, choose the eBook versions for your reading needs. :)

What about your distribution?

My distribution is pretty limited at the moment. It's something I'd like to work on as I get more titles. It's not economically feasible for me to have a proper distributor since I a) don't always have proper print runs; b) many distributors don't take self-published books (even though I have branded myself as a press); c) I wouldn't make  as much money if I have to share a portion of the pie with someone else other than the store. Plus, the publisher is responsible for the costs of shipping to and from the store, which gets very expensive and also cuts into any money I might make. 

I'm in select bookstores (changes every few months due to consignment limits), most of my print titles are available on Amazon for purchase, you can buy my titles on my website, but my main venue for selling is conventions. I travel across the country hand-selling my books and this has worked well for me so far.  Once I have a larger catalogue, I think it will make sense for me to partner with an existing publisher and utilize their distribution network. Until that day, I continue to work hard to make sure my books are seen and heard!

What Can I Do To Help?

If you’re unable to contribute, please talk about and share the campaign page with others who would be interested! Every little bit helps.

end of the Forever Sea and found a spear encased in ice. It was the most
beautiful thing he’d ever seen, and he wanted it, because he could see it was
magic. When he tried to break the ice with his own spells, it shattered and
marred his face. He lost an eye, some said. Others insisted that he played a
game of riddles with a magical tiger guarding the spear and lost, losing his
eye as penance, but still made off with the spear anyway. I didn’t know whether
or not he kept the spear, or whether this happened before or during the war. 
“It’s just a
story,” I said. But even I could hear the uncertainty in my voice.
***
You can read the first few chapters of The Violet Fox, the first book in the series, here.
What do I need the money for?
I am raising $1,000 to cover the editorial cost of publishing the The Silver Spear. This will cover a structural edit and a copy edit from my editor as well as the fees from Indiegogo. If I surpass this goal, the extra money raised will go to the production costs--and if we surpass it by lot, I will be able to do a small offset run.
Why should I contribute to this project?

Publishing is not a sprint. It's a marathon. I went to school for publishing, I work in publishing, and I spend my free time publishing. I will always be a publisher. Here's a little bit more about me, my press & the Silver Spear.
The Violet Fox was on the Winnipeg Bestseller list!

Richard Hatch of Battlestar Galactica fame even bought a copy at KeyCon 2013, which was pretty cool!! :)
The Violet Fox has been on the Amazon bestseller list a time or two as well!
About Faery Ink Press
Faery Ink Press publishes young adult science fiction, fantasy, and horror novels. My novels feature strong, intelligent young women thrust into fantastical circumstances. One fights aliens with her new superhero friends at a secretive university in Northern Alberta. Another fights for her people's freedom to live on the surface in the fantasy land of Marlenia. I aim to publish great looking, smart spec fic that women young and old will enjoy--and stories that will hopefully stay with them for a long time.
Contributing to The Silver Spear gives me the means to continue making beautiful books that people across the country--and the world--have come to enjoy. By publishing my own books, I am taking control of my art, and building something that I hope will outlast me. 

Book Themes
The Violet Fox Series explores three major themes.
1) The definition of freedom
For the first time in over 200 years, the Freetor people have a real shot at returning to their rightful place on the surface. No longer will they be forced to live underground. They are free.
Or are they? Just because the law has been changed, does not mean their freedom is guaranteed. There is no room on the surface for them, and many are too afraid to abandon the caves that they have come to know as home. Others feel that they are not free because those they consider to be their enemy still lives. Many Freetors see the Silver Spear as a symbol of their freedom, as it was the weapon of legend wielded by their ancestor against the Holy One of old, before they were forced underground. If Kiera retrieves it, it will give them the permission--the courage--they desperately seek to live in the sun once more.
The question is: is freedom something that must be given or ordained, or is it something that must be taken by force?
2) Love vs Duty
Kiera, our protagonist, struggles with this in the first book but now faces it head-on in The Silver Spear. She has deep feelings for Prince Keegan and is faced with the very real possibility of being the future queen of the land. But does she really love him, or is she marrying him to give her people a better future? Her feelings for him are tested as they journey together across the world in search of an artefact that may or may not exist--which only heightens the tension between the two of them, for she is dead certain that The Silver Spear does exist, and that it can help them win the inevitable war to come.
3) Prejudice against minorities
This has already been explored in The Violet Fox, but the theme is carried over in The Silver Spear. Prejudice doesn't disappear overnight and we see what happens when Kiera, a Freetor and once considered a Robin Hood figure, is now expected to rule over the people she used to steal from.
Risks & Challenges
Publishing is a risky business, but I’ve done a lot to minimize my publishing costs. Editing is the one major cost for publishing a book, besides printing. The other aspects of publishing--interior formatting, eBook creation, cover design & creation--are done by me or my partner.
This also isn’t my first rodeo. The Silver Spear will be my fifth publication and I’ve refined my process each time.
Wait, hold up, why does shipping cost so much?
Shipping in Canada is expensive. Books are heavy. Unfortunately, books like The Violet Fox and The Silver Spear, because of their page count, fall into the parcel category. Because of this, they are automatically at least $10 more expensive than shipping it as a letter (must fit through the letter slot). And that's just within Canada. Canada Post is the cheapest shipping solution I've found for my needs, but if there's enough orders, I may be able to find a cheaper solution. So please, spread the word! Or if the shipping is too much of a problem, choose the eBook versions for your reading needs. :)
What about your distribution?
My distribution is pretty limited at the moment. It's something I'd like to work on as I get more titles. It's not economically feasible for me to have a proper distributor since I a) don't always have proper print runs; b) many distributors don't take self-published books (even though I have branded myself as a press); c) I wouldn't make  as much money if I have to share a portion of the pie with someone else other than the store. Plus, the publisher is responsible for the costs of shipping to and from the store, which gets very expensive and also cuts into any money I might make. 
I'm in select bookstores (changes every few months due to consignment limits), most of my print titles are available on Amazon for purchase, you can buy my titles on my website, but my main venue for selling is conventions. I travel across the country hand-selling my books and this has worked well for me so far.  Once I have a larger catalogue, I think it will make sense for me to partner with an existing publisher and utilize their distribution network. Until that day, I continue to work hard to make sure my books are seen and heard!
What Can I Do To Help?
If you’re unable to contribute, please talk about and share the campaign page with others who would be interested! Every little bit helps.

story:
A quick update (02-25-2018) for the purposes of Indiegogo's 'In Demand' live campaign  chocolatecake is hopefully with your help and thank you (smile/nudge) trying to reach the stretch goal ($5K) and do a print run in paperback of project '5'. The e-book is funded. Indiegogo's backers can still support by way of contribution the soon to be independently and digitally published creative code in order for it to reach a wider demographic. A futurism-type activity book for the (12-18) YA market (or the child within)

chocolatecake is a moniker for a new writer and hybrid micro-brand

anxiety-crusher
#howhowhow

There are many ways to resonate (a mind path) with the interdimensional constructs of project 5. Transmutational by design. Now one can interact with light emanations decoded as micro-messages from an alternate universe. Ethereal + Holographic. (a hologram of sorts)

Why learn to interact with interstellar codes and re-imagine 'X'?

introduction

What if one suffers from extreme shyness and is highly sensitive (a child or adult) and becomes more and more isolated however well attuned to cosmic energy (whereby one searches for solace) but still feels disconnected from others. Either way depending which side of the spectrum nothing seems to work. The absence of a deep connection to one's inner self or another being eventually over a prolonged and sustained period of time turns to dread. A habitual, nagging and self-deprecating thought form if untreated over years becomes a pathology.

isolation

There are a million variations to counter loneliness but when severe depression leads to despair and hopelessness how do you dispel the onset of chronic mental illness?
The dark state of zero-feels ie no feeling. So how do you even begin to remotely connect (woe-is-me) when neurologically speaking the connections in the brain (synapses) are rendered null and void? F**k you blocked. Are you, really? Yes/No. No/Yes.

Meditation is one way to find the center of self to become less attached to thought forms which requires discipline to basically still the mind. The list of other transcendental or mindful modalities is endless (choose x,y,z)

how-to module

The reverse at-play.
A how-to module utilizes thinking (which we all do anyway) and counting.

- hmm counting that's unusual and only really consciously worked on by K-12 students studying mathematics or related fields of study where numbers have relevance to said exercise and there's nothing special about thinking.

so what is this how-to module?

- to dispel zero-feels when the mind dynamic is at an all time low (yuk moment.) Neurons in the brain search for a connection but there is no memory from the past to draw upon. Zero recall. The 'otherness' escapes one. There is no former bliss point. Unconsciously loneliness is a long drawn out drag drag drag as the future is elusive. A dead end.

There is a way to combat loneliness through a new-format and interactive module to out image the ethereal dimension.  A thought - matrix designed to think it into beingness.

think

Think what? Think light. Encoded emanations to re-imagine the elusive 'otherness'. What form does this take? Tracking 'Never Never Land' or Elysian Fields and/or however one chooses to think of the idea associated with sacred space or divine union (whether mythological or celestial) and how it should read-like, sound-like or be seen-like. ie a self ascribed DIY rendering of a fairy tale or paranormal romance? (kind of)

left-brain + right-brain activation

A visualizer is usually associated with the right-brain. Project 5 is solely a left-brain module
(a tool) to afford one (the reader) a way to trigger the right-brain. Higher consciousness in context to a spiritual awakening from a logic based perspective sounds almost counter intuitive to finding the connection to self. Imagination and creativity is in and of itself simply energy. Unbounded. If the mental body is blocked it can be unblocked - hmm but how? Gently nudged? Noooo!

worked-on

- if the vibration of love in its myriad forms is 'alien' and out of one's life experience decoding a universal light code activates new connections in the brain which prompts the neurons to 'see' as if one is being guided to put the pieces together of a holographic cosmic jigsaw puzzle. A systematic mental rendering of DNA. A rewiring of the senses. Through a series of basic steps (page-by-page) what seemed virtually impossible to begin with becomes possible. This would 'appear' in the mind's eye (as if by magic) to have given rise to a renewed sense of feeling, if only a momentary glimmer of hope.

to re-imagine 'X' by-passes the inability to remember (as remembering is out of the user/reader's experience or state of consciousness)

benefits

deeper connection to self
heightened sense of well-being
acute understanding of unity consciousness
agile mind
inner strength (rediscovered)
confidence (renewed)
energy field (expanded)
mind set (positive)
approach to life (goal orientated)
esoteric knowledge (interest peeked)
growth (new found openess)

what form does project 5 take to out image multi-convergent and interconnected codes of light which make up the thought-matrix?

an activity book
DIY exercises (building blocks)
journal
basic math book
puzzle-maker
you + me (reader and writer) learn to #hackstargates
follow 'X' to enter the 5th dimension

predetermined words which form the non-linear story (in-part a fantasy)
whereby one is prompted to exchange letters for their corresponding number value
followed by shape-building in the mind
by thinking X (transmutational) one enters metaphysical space
the replication (page-by-page) of a basic math equation links the reader
into a straight forward and comprehensible quantum visualizer
counting up numbers from zero to infinity
a how-to module to imagine the 5th dimension
a new take on the star system

project 5's interactive how-to module can be accessed simply by reading the e-book as is (or the paperback if funded) and following the number breakdown and/or by interacting with the letters x numbers by counting with one's fingers or counting out aloud and/or in one's mind. Or a mix-and-match approach. The reader could also choose to doodle, scribble or write down the equations on a single piece of paper (or multiples) or jotted down in a basic exercise book or make-up the light encoded equations on a mobile's notepad or calculator. As this can be considered autodidactic the way-in is solely up to the individual.

what chocolatecake need's and what you get

funds needed to produce version 1 e-book
based in Cape Town South Africa

update 11 11 2018

V1 e-book is funded
V2 paperback (stretch goal)

US Dollars converted to South African Rand currency

$ 500 = +/- R 6 608.10 (18/11/2017)

- 5% for Indiegogo = +/- R 6 277.7
- $25 for Indiegogo bank charges = +/- R6252

e-book production R 2700
graphic design R 1000
web design R 1000
online marketing R 1000
facebook and twitter advertising R 500

the impact

one unknown quantum thought-form
one unknown equation #twolettersonenumber
one unknown entity chocolatecake links-in with
one hundred unknowns the collective on indiegogo

5 x $100 to out image V1
or
1 x $500 (one unknown backer) to back in full V1
or
1 x $5000  (one unknown super backer) or technology company
to back V1 (e-book) and V2 (paperback)
US $5000 = +/- R 61 862.00 South African Rand Currency

story:
You can now order directly on our official online store.

 

 

Draw everyone into the conversation on climate change and the energy transition!

 

The Infographic Energy Transition Coloring Book (IETCB) is a unique visual communication and education tool that uses infographics to engage people of all ages in the conversation on climate change and renewable energy.

  

 

It’s a project driven by passion, with each fact meticulously researched by industry professionals and 33 hand-drawn infographic spreads.

Ellery Studio Co-Founder Eugen Litwinow with Chancellor Angela Merkel

 

Climate change mitigation and the need to develop a decentralised renewable energy supply are among the greatest challenges of our time. Our goal is to keep the public engaged in the conversation and informed about exciting scientific breakthroughs and opportunities. 

 

 

This award-winning coloring book is a perfect introduction to the current challenges and achievements in the climate and energy world!   

 

 

Fridays for Future officially supports The Infographic Energy Transition Coloring Book

 

Fridays for Future (Berlin) released a statement supporting project.  For full text of the statement, visit the link here.

 

"... In The Infographic Energy Transition Coloring Book, Ellery Studio and the Institute for Climate Change, Energy and Mobility (IKEM) communicate scientific information about climate change in a unique way.
This is especially important in the digitalage, because access to information is one thing; understanding its complexity is another. That’s why we need materials like the IETCB, which can facilitate a cross-generational understanding of fundamental issues. The writers and designers behind the coloring book have developed an innovative format to illustrate the measures and strategies needed to achieve the energy and mobility transition.

The IETCB presents basic facts and figures on climate change and the energy transition in a playful and creative way. Schools, in particular, should take advantage of this format in order to introduce comprehensive climate education in schools as early as possible."

 

 

It’s official: the Infographic Energy Transition Coloring Book is one of the world’s top infographic publications

 

 

The first edition of the IETCB won the Gold Award (Criteria Innovative Format) and the Main Award for Climate Change and Environmental Commitment Best Graphic at the prestigious Malofiej Infographic Awards (World Infographic Summit) – ahead of media giants like The New York Times. 

 

 

Featured by:

 

IKEM's Anika Nicolaas Ponder wrote an op-ed article for Medium - "An energy transition for everyone". 

 

 

1. Playful comic-style illustrations break down the complexity of the energy transition

The IETCB makes complex climate- and energy-related issues accessible to people of all ages, inspiring engagement and enabling effective action. 

 

2. Colorable infographics debunk myths about renewable energy

The book is packed with expert content based on the most up-to-date statistics from sources including the International Energy Agency (IEA), the German Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy (BMWi), and the Natural Resources Defense Council. The IETCB covers topics ranging from sustainable mobility to Germany’s Renewable Energy Act and offers recommendations for reducing our carbon footprint. 

Who knew learning about energy subsidies could be so fun? 

 

 

The IETCB is designed to spark dialogue on climate change.

The innovative coloring book format opens doors to new audiences – including change-makers at the top of our government. IETCB team members have personally given coloring books to politicians like Chancellor Angela Merkel and Environment Minister Svenja Schulze.

 

It's your turn: 

The IETCB offers a great way for you to engage with your own local representatives, communities, and decision-makers. The fun illustrations make the book a great ice-breaker. And thanks to the info-packed graphics, it's also an ideal tool for introducing complex climate-related issues. 

With a new, up-to-date edition of the IETCB, we can keep the conversation going!

Ellery Studio Co-Founder Dodo Vögler with Svenja Schulze, Germany's Environment Minister

 

 

Book details

  • 33 colorable updated infographic spreads + NEW Fridays For Future spread 
  • 74 pages
  • Size: 26.9 x 20.5 cm (10.6 x 8.1 inches)
  • Produced using green printing processes at Ruksaldruck, a family-run eco-printing facility founded in Berlin in 1935
  • Printed on Blue Angel-certified recycled paper 

 

Six of the book’s 33 stunning infographic spreads

 

 

Chapter 1: Global Energy and Emissions: A New Hope 

01_【Shine Bright Energy!】The Power of the Sun

02_【The Story of Global Emissions】World CO2 Emissions from Fuel Combustion by Region

03_【It's All Relative...】Comparing Emissions per Head of Population Represented by Each Country’s Current Leader

04_【What Goes Around Comes Around】Total Lifetime Emissions per Electricity Source

05_【The Big Picture】Renewable Power Capabilities in the World

 

Chapter 2: The Energy Transition in Germany

06_【The EGG】The Renewable Energy Law that Made It All Happen

07_【A Slice of Subsidy Pie】Looking at the Allocation of Energy Subsidies from 1970-2016

08_【Mega What??】Understanding Quantities of Energy

09_【Strommixer】The Ingredients in Germany’s Electricity Blender

10_【Meet the Renewables】

... and more!

 

Chapter 3: Planet Home

28_【My Energy Impact】Find Your Path to Sustainable Living

29_【Dude, Where's My Electric Car?】

30_【From Individual Ownership to Shared Mobility】

31_【The Paris Agreement】

32_【DYSTOPIA】If We Don't Act Now, Our Future Looks Grim

33_【From Small Actions to Global Movements!】

 

 

A book for everyone

The IETCB  is an educational tool, an activity book, and a light-hearted conversation-starter designed to engage, inform, and inspire people of all ages who are curious about climate change and the energy transition. 

 

 

From adults to children!

 

 

 

The IETCB  is the product of a collaboration between two Berlin-based organizations: the Institute for Climate Protection, Energy and Mobility (IKEM) and Ellery Studio for Creative Strategy. The teams joined forces to research, write, and design the first edition of this self-published book.

 

IKEM is an NGO that conducts interdisciplinary research exploring energy transition pathways toward a sustainable society, with an emphasis on the policy framework driving Germany’s Energiewende. 

https://www.ikem.de/en/ 

Ellery Studio for Creative Strategy is an award-winning team of designers and strategists on a mission to boosts creativity and excitement in renewable energy, sustainability and social responsibility.  

https://www.ellerystudio.com

 

 

This project grew out of our passion for environmental protection and our drive to build a sustainable future.  

Amid the onslaught of disheartening news about the future of our planet, the prospect of taking action on climate change and the energy transition can feel daunting at best. But the truth is that we are making progress, and recent breakthroughs have made this an exciting period of change. 

 

We believe it’s important to communicate a feeling of hope and excitement about the future of the energy transition. Meaningful change starts when we draw everyone into the discussion – so we invested our personal time, energy, and funds to create a book that does just that. 

Ideating and testing

 

Testing "How to color"

We hope you’ll enjoy reading and coloring this book as much as we enjoyed making it. 

 

 

Delivery: December 2019!

 

Based on our current production schedule, the book should be printed in time for delivery in December 2019. 

We're estimating a four-week shipping time worldwide.

All  shipments will be tracked.

Of course we'll keep you up to date with important milestones along the way!

 

September 2019

Research: update all the facts and figures in the book

October 2019

Design and illustration: start the design process with updated data 

November 2019

Production: print books at eco-friendly facility in Berlin

December 2019

Delivery: start shipping rewards to our backers!

 

 

Show your love by not only backing the project, but sharing this campaign to your friends, family, colleagues, and all your loved ones! 

If you don't feel like sharing, that's alright.

Follow us on Facebook & Instagram and subscribe to our newsletter for exciting updates and news!

 

Official Facebook Page

Official Instagram Account

Our Newsletter

 

Risks and Challenges

Because we’ve already released two editions of the coloring book we expect the production process to go smoothly. Still, nothing is risk-free!

Potential challenge would be delivery: Please note that shipping times are estimated. Actual shipping times may vary due to unexpected delivery delays during the holiday season.

That’s why we need materials like the IETCB, which can facilitate a cross-generational understanding of fundamental issues. The writers and designers behind the coloring book have developed an innovative format to illustrate the measures and strategies needed to achieve the energy and mobility transition.
The IETCB presents basic facts and figures on climate change and the energy transition in a playful and creative way. Schools, in particular, should take advantage of this format in order to introduce comprehensive climate education in schools as early as possible."
 


 
It’s official: the Infographic Energy Transition Coloring Book is one of the world’s top infographic publications
 

 
The first edition of the IETCB won the Gold Award (Criteria Innovative Format) and the Main Award for Climate Change and Environmental Commitment Best Graphic at the prestigious Malofiej Infographic Awards (World Infographic Summit) – ahead of media giants like The New York Times. 
 


 
Featured by:

 
IKEM's Anika Nicolaas Ponder wrote an op-ed article for Medium - "An energy transition for everyone". 
 


 
1. Playful comic-style illustrations break down the complexity of the energy transition
The IETCB makes complex climate- and energy-related issues accessible to people of all ages, inspiring engagement and enabling effective action. 

 
2. Colorable infographics debunk myths about renewable energy
The book is packed with expert content based on the most up-to-date statistics from sources including the International Energy Agency (IEA), the German Federal Ministry for Economic Affairs and Energy (BMWi), and the Natural Resources Defense Council. The IETCB covers topics ranging from sustainable mobility to Germany’s Renewable Energy Act and offers recommendations for reducing our carbon footprint. 
Who knew learning about energy subsidies could be so fun? 

 

 
The IETCB is designed to spark dialogue on climate change.
The innovative coloring book format opens doors to new audiences – including change-makers at the top of our government. IETCB team members have personally given coloring books to politicians like Chancellor Angela Merkel and Environment Minister Svenja Schulze.
 
It's your turn: 
The IETCB offers a great way for you to engage with your own local representatives, communities, and decision-makers. The fun illustrations make the book a great ice-breaker. And thanks to the info-packed graphics, it's also an ideal tool for introducing complex climate-related issues. 
With a new, up-to-date edition of the IETCB, we can keep the conversation going!

Ellery Studio Co-Founder Dodo Vögler with Svenja Schulze, Germany's Environment Minister
 

 
Book details

33 colorable updated infographic spreads + NEW Fridays For Future spread 
74 pages
Size: 26.9 x 20.5 cm (10.6 x 8.1 inches)
Produced using green printing processes at Ruksaldruck, a family-run eco-printing facility founded in Berlin in 1935
Printed on Blue Angel-certified recycled paper 

 

Six of the book’s 33 stunning infographic spreads
 

 
Chapter 1: Global Energy and Emissions: A New Hope 
01_【Shine Bright Energy!】The Power of the Sun
02_【The Story of Global Emissions】World CO2 Emissions from Fuel Combustion by Region
03_【It's All Relative...】Comparing Emissions per Head of Population Represented by Each Country’s Current Leader
04_【What Goes Around Comes Around】Total Lifetime Emissions per Electricity Source
05_【The Big Picture】Renewable Power Capabilities in the World
 
Chapter 2: The Energy Transition in Germany
06_【The EGG】The Renewable Energy Law that Made It All Happen
07_【A Slice of Subsidy Pie】Looking at the Allocation of Energy Subsidies from 1970-2016
08_【Mega What??】Understanding Quantities of Energy
09_【Strommixer】The Ingredients in Germany’s Electricity Blender
10_【Meet the Renewables】
... and more!
 
Chapter 3: Planet Home
28_【My Energy Impact】Find Your Path to Sustainable Living
29_【Dude, Where's My Electric Car?】
30_【From Individual Ownership to Shared Mobility】
31_【The Paris Agreement】
32_【DYSTOPIA】If We Don't Act Now, Our Future Looks Grim
33_【From Small Actions to Global Movements!】
 

 
A book for everyone
The IETCB  is an educational tool, an activity book, and a light-hearted conversation-starter designed to engage, inform, and inspire people of all ages who are curious about climate change and the energy transition. 
 


 
From adults to children!
 


 

 
The IETCB  is the product of a collaboration between two Berlin-based organizations: the Institute for Climate Protection, Energy and Mobility (IKEM) and Ellery Studio for Creative Strategy. The teams joined forces to research, write, and design the first edition of this self-published book.
 
IKEM is an NGO that conducts interdisciplinary research exploring energy transition pathways toward a sustainable society, with an emphasis on the policy framework driving Germany’s Energiewende. 
https://www.ikem.de/en/ 
Ellery Studio for Creative Strategy is an award-winning team of designers and strategists on a mission to boosts creativity and excitement in renewable energy, sustainability and social responsibility.  
https://www.ellerystudio.com
 

 
This project grew out of our passion for environmental protection and our drive to build a sustainable future.  
Amid the onslaught of disheartening news about the future of our planet, the prospect of taking action on climate change and the energy transition can feel daunting at best. But the truth is that we are making progress, and recent breakthroughs have made this an exciting period of change. 
 
We believe it’s important to communicate a feeling of hope and excitement about the future of the energy transition. Meaningful change starts when we draw everyone into the discussion – so we invested our personal time, energy, and funds to create a book that does just that. 
Ideating and testing
 
Testing "How to color"
We hope you’ll enjoy reading and coloring this book as much as we enjoyed making it. 
 

 
Delivery: December 2019!
 
Based on our current production schedule, the book should be printed in time for delivery in December 2019. 
We're estimating a four-week shipping time worldwide.
All  shipments will be tracked.
Of course we'll keep you up to date with important milestones along the way!
 
September 2019
Research: update all the facts and figures in the book
October 2019
Design and illustration: start the design process with updated data 
November 2019
Production: print books at eco-friendly facility in Berlin
December 2019
Delivery: start shipping rewards to our backers!
 

 
Show your love by not only backing the project, but sharing this campaign to your friends, family, colleagues, and all your loved ones! 
If you don't feel like sharing, that's alright.
Follow us on Facebook & Instagram and subscribe to our newsletter for exciting updates and news!
 

Official Facebook Page

Official Instagram Account

Our Newsletter
 
Risks and Challenges
Because we’ve already released two editions of the coloring book we expect the production process to go smoothly. Still, nothing is risk-free!
Potential challenge would be delivery: Please note that shipping times are estimated. Actual shipping times may vary due to unexpected delivery delays during the holiday season.

story:
WHAT IS CRASH PHILOSOPHY?

Hi! My name is Thomas A. Fowler, Author of Nerdy Things. Last year, my publishing company, Nerdy Things Publishing, released Crash Philosophy: First Collision. It had 25 stories, each one a different combination of 5 characters (Alien, Clown, Imaginary Friend, Kaiju, and Robot Assassin) and 5 settings (Apocalyptic Wasteland, Evil Laboratory, Human Mind, the Ocean, and the Triassic). Now, I've gathered 24 new combinations by introducing a Dinosaur and Psycho Killer as characters and Space and an Alternate Future as settings!

  • I've self-published or been published in 13 books now, including the Award-winning Porcelain Prompts Series. Writing since high-school, I've always loved science-fiction and started working with a wide variety of authors to build these anthologies.
  • This campaign is to help, since over two dozen creative minds had to come together to make Crash Philosophy happen. It's important to me that all of them received author copies, getting paid for their writing. I refused to offer "experience" as compensation. But with so many people, this anthology takes a tremendous amount of time and resources, which is why I'm asking for your help.
  • Your contributions help support the editors, authors, proofreaders, designers, and formators, the literal dozens of incredible contributors who joined me on this journey. Without them, I'd still be banging my head just to get the stories written.

So I hope you'll back us, we have levels from an ebook to getting a complete library from a group of the authors who wrote for this anthology, as well as t-shirts and more. Thank you for stopping by and I hope you'll help us crash (in a good way!) once again!

WHY WE'RE CROWDFUNDING

The time and passion that went into making this happen was exorbitant, by backing this you'll help us do the following:

  • Pay the huge team that assembled like the Avengers to proofread, format, help with marketing, and most importantly: write the stories.
  • The perks go from entry-level to t-shirts from the Geeky Gab Podcast and book bundles. You can get both Crash Philosophy installments and add standalone novels from the contributing authors. It's a chance to discover new authors, new stories, and a new reading experience!
  • We're not doing an "all-or-nothing" campaign; as a result, any contributions will go toward the funding necessary to pay authors and experts helping make Crash Philosophy come to life and "expand the portal" to add new characters and settings.

 

THE DIFFERENCE YOU'LL MAKE

  • The contributing authors vary from published authors with several credits to their name to this being an aspiring writer's first publication! By backing this campaign, you're literally helping people's dreams come true.
  • You'll also help us continue building a new reading experience! This anthology's success will let us continue introducing new characters and settings, constantly making this an evolving literary world we can experience before.
  • At this point, the stories are gathered, edited, and the cover is done. As a result, your support is to champion us to the finish line, which we've done already with the First Collision. We'd love for you to help us with it all.

THE BENEFITS

We have a lot to offer. If you choose some of our packages, you may get the option to choose a book from another author, or one of our Geeky Gab t-shirts. See the benefits below.

Power Play by Kimberly Keane - (eBook or Print) A narcissist. A vicious tormentor. An entity the gods can't vanquish. All the while, the balance of the universe is tipping in the wrong direction.

Orion's Honor by Melissa Koons - (eBook or Print) John has illusions of grandeur after reading too many books about knights. To escape his past, he convinces his friend, Ben, to join him in the marines. Stationed on Wake Island in 1941, John believes this is his chance to become the knight he's always wanted to be, but Ben is more realistic about their situation. Ben has to choose: allow John to destroy his future by believing in knights during a real war, or save him by revealing a secret which will destroy their friendship. The world is at war, does Ben have time before it finds their island?

Triorion: Awakening by L.J. Hachmeister - (eBook only) Three siblings, one terrible secret: It’s not just love that binds them together, but the power of an ancient evil. And if anyone finds out, the price will be paid in more than blood.

Blue Sky Tomorrows by L.J. Hachmeister - (eBook only) Only the elite get into the Dominion’s Military Academy. Or those ruthless enough to sacrifice everything.

The Shield Breaker by Scott Beckman - (eBook or Print) Fifteen years ago, magic destroyed the world.

The Shield Breaker is a post-apocalyptic urban fantasy novel from the author of Pantheon, White Star Phase, and The Fox and The Blade. It is the first book in the Enclave Saga, and the gripping introduction to Cait Verlyn, the series' conflicted young protagonist.

The Scarlet Derby and Midnight Jay - Volume 1: Gallery of Rogues by Mike Cervantes - (eBook or Print) Meet Thaddeus Hedwater and his wife Mary Jane, two newlyweds who share an incredible secret: when night falls in London, they scour the streets of crime as the city’s most stalwart crime-fighting duo, The Scarlet Derby and Midnight Jay.

A New Awakening: Book one of Karnation’s Prophecy by David Munson (Print Only) I will always remember it as the day my world of waiting tables with my brother Tannis in a small peaceful village was suddenly and violently torn asunder. The very earth I stood upon crumbled and quaked and I was suddenly swept off into the unknown. Looking back, it wasn't the darkness that I feared, but the knowledge that unseen hands had the power to pull me into it. I had no knowledge of Wizards, Dragons, Trolls, and other monstrosities that thrive in the dark places of the world, but that changed abruptly. 

A New Zepher: Book Two of Karnation's Prophecy (Volume 2) by David Munson (Print Only) Nothing in my life could have prepared me for the gruesome sights and unspeakable horrors that filled those once peaceful caverns.

Crash Philosophy: First Collision created by Thomas A. Fowler, written by Various Authors (eBook or Print) A portal has been opened. A portal leading to an expanding universe where science fiction collides with reality, where the future includes a myriad of characters, and each story is as odd as the last. In this anthology, you’re given the power to choose where you’ll go and who you’ll take with you! With this first collision, you can choose between five characters and settings to create twenty-five fictional possibilities. 

Shatter Your Image by Various Authors (eBook or Print) In our lives, people tell us who we should be. We gain the notion we could be happier by trying to be someone else. But we don't have to be perfect for the world, we just have to be ourselves. Shatter Your Image is an anthology from writers telling stories through fiction and poetry. 

T-SHIRT OPTIONS

If you choose one of our packages with a t-shirt, you'll have three options to choose from: Peggy Carter Forever, Lowering Your Jeff Goldblum Expectations, or Arnold Shirtzenegger. See the shirt designs below and choose your size!

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Because I've already released the first installment of this anthology, it would take drastic action for this anthology not to come together. We're quite far into the editing process so all stories are gathered and being refined while the campaign launches.

  • My day job is Project Management in advertising, which requires constant evolving to challenges and finding ways to make things work within budget. As a result, even if we don't hit our goal, the project will still see the light of day!
  • One of the biggest risks is time. However, now that I've been through the process of self-publishing several times, our release of late May should be feasible unless I end up having a rough injury or both my main folder, and backup, disappear without explanation.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Money can be tight at times, believe me, as a father of four I get that. I wish I could back all of my author friends. If you like the idea of this project, but cannot back us, there's still plenty you can do to help:

  • Share the campaign on social! Spread the word to help us get discovered by awesome readers like you!
  • The campaign has easy share tools on IndieGoGo.
  • You can sign up for our newsletter. Alongside my Geeky Gab podcast host, Melissa Koons, we have a monthly newsletter where you can receive updates on new books and projects, as well as free ways to interact, come see us at conventions, and such. We do quarterly giveaways so you may even win a signed copy of Crash Philosophy! Sign up here.

Thank you so much for any support you can give. You're helping dozens of writers and creators expand a reading experience the world hasn't really seen yet. Thank you for coming along and helping us!
