story:
Try, Catch is the story of a young engineer trying to fit into life in the Bay Area after graduation.

Hello and welcome to my Indiegogo Campaign! My name is David Cantu and I am the author of Try, Catch, a comedic book set in the Bay Area, California, that follows the wacky and unpredictable life of a young software engineer following his life after graduation. I wrote this book because of my own personal experiences being a recent graduate myself working and living in the Silicon Valley. It goes without saying that everyone has their own experiences with adjusting to life after graduation and their first jobs, but I hope that people can relate, and laugh, with the characters in the book as they navigate through life, in an seemingly endless stream of bad luck.

My hope is that, in reading this book, people will be able to relate with my characters and have a laugh. I want anyone who reads it to see it as an opportunity in their lives to laugh, escape from all the things that are happening in the world, and accompany the main character in the book in his journey through life after graduation and subsequent descent into relative insanity.

John Buntington is a recently graduated software engineer living in the Bay Area, California, that is suddenly faced with the realities of corporate America, whilst enduring the general absurdities that come with the region. The dream to work for a big tech company, thrive, and learn is not necessarily what he encounters when he moves out west to follow the “correct” path of a software engineer. He slowly but surely realizes that he himself has still a lot of growing and adjusting to real life. He also begins to see that corporate life, regardless of the fact that it’s the tech industry, an industry which is nationally known to be progressive, efficient, and a fun environment, is not entirely what it’s played out to be in the media or testimonials. Alongside some of his newly made friends, Carson, Luis Filipe, and Neveah, John goes through a series of hilarious experiences that slowly but surely change his perspective on the Bay Area and force him to make irrational, and hilarious, decisions throughout the book.

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of comedy, software engineering, and life after graduation through narratives like:

  • At a certain point, my main character decides to go to Yosemite, which is a very calm and beautiful place near the Bay Area that is a must. Once he’s there, he is able to appreciate this fact, but at the same time, Yosemite is not empty. It’s in fact filled with other humans, some of which happen to be very interesting characters. Everybody knows that every much-needed planned trip always goes exactly according to plan. Right? Right...
  • John loses the key to his apartment after an unfortunate series of events, so he has to go replace it. No decent place will replace his key, as it’s a “special” key. Therefore, he has to go out of his way and find the “Key Man”, who is able to help him replace his lost key. The “Key Man” turns out to be a hilarious character full of opinions on what’s happening to his hometown.
  • John, Carson, Neveah, and Luis Filipe, attend a party in San Francisco where they experience first-hand what it is to go to a young, college-graduate-aged house party. The story begins with John showing up late to the party. Slowly, through time hops and gentle revealing, you will learn all about John’s night that did not go exactly how he wanted it to go.

You live in the bay area, you work or have worked in tech, recently graduated from school, or if you’re just a fan of comedy and want to be taken for a ride, then this is the book for you.

Try, Catch speaks to Software Engineers and lovers of comedy. Anyone who wants to be taken for an emotional rollercoaster is welcomed aboard.

Ultimately, I hope that Try, Catch inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

Am I alone in feeling this way about life after graduation? Is the Silicon Valley the promised land?

I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing life after graduation and working in corporate will change us all for the better.

What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December of 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author


David Cantú is Software Engineer that has been at the job for two years now after having graduated from the University of Pennsylvania in 2018 with a degree not in writing.

After living in the Bay Area for some time, and struggling himself to adjust to his job, David thought it would be therapeutic to write about his experiences and scenarios that he’s seen go down. To him, life is funny if you know where to look or if you look at it through the right lens, which is never an easy thing to do.

David is just a dude trying to make other people (and himself) laugh, while bringing some of his character into each of his characters. You can catch him playing video games, watching sports, or playing piano, while he’s not playing the lets-try-our-best-to-write-a-book game, which has slowly become his favorite game to play.

For more information you can connect with David at davigfre@gmail.com and @dfcantug on Twitter and Instagram.

He also likes to write about himself in third person on special occasions.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TryCatch and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

story_txt:
Try, Catch is the story of a young engineer trying to fit into life in the Bay Area after graduation.Hello and welcome to my Indiegogo Campaign! My name is David Cantu and I am the author of Try, Catch, a comedic book set in the Bay Area, California, that follows the wacky and unpredictable life of a young software engineer following his life after graduation. I wrote this book because of my own personal experiences being a recent graduate myself working and living in the Silicon Valley. It goes without saying that everyone has their own experiences with adjusting to life after graduation and their first jobs, but I hope that people can relate, and laugh, with the characters in the book as they navigate through life, in an seemingly endless stream of bad luck.My hope is that, in reading this book, people will be able to relate with my characters and have a laugh. I want anyone who reads it to see it as an opportunity in their lives to laugh, escape from all the things that are happening in the world, and accompany the main character in the book in his journey through life after graduation and subsequent descent into relative insanity.John Buntington is a recently graduated software engineer living in the Bay Area, California, that is suddenly faced with the realities of corporate America, whilst enduring the general absurdities that come with the region. The dream to work for a big tech company, thrive, and learn is not necessarily what he encounters when he moves out west to follow the “correct” path of a software engineer. He slowly but surely realizes that he himself has still a lot of growing and adjusting to real life. He also begins to see that corporate life, regardless of the fact that it’s the tech industry, an industry which is nationally known to be progressive, efficient, and a fun environment, is not entirely what it’s played out to be in the media or testimonials. Alongside some of his newly made friends, Carson, Luis Filipe, and Neveah, John goes through a series of hilarious experiences that slowly but surely change his perspective on the Bay Area and force him to make irrational, and hilarious, decisions throughout the book.In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of comedy, software engineering, and life after graduation through narratives like:

At a certain point, my main character decides to go to Yosemite, which is a very calm and beautiful place near the Bay Area that is a must. Once he’s there, he is able to appreciate this fact, but at the same time, Yosemite is not empty. It’s in fact filled with other humans, some of which happen to be very interesting characters. Everybody knows that every much-needed planned trip always goes exactly according to plan. Right? Right...
John loses the key to his apartment after an unfortunate series of events, so he has to go replace it. No decent place will replace his key, as it’s a “special” key. Therefore, he has to go out of his way and find the “Key Man”, who is able to help him replace his lost key. The “Key Man” turns out to be a hilarious character full of opinions on what’s happening to his hometown.
John, Carson, Neveah, and Luis Filipe, attend a party in San Francisco where they experience first-hand what it is to go to a young, college-graduate-aged house party. The story begins with John showing up late to the party. Slowly, through time hops and gentle revealing, you will learn all about John’s night that did not go exactly how he wanted it to go.

You live in the bay area, you work or have worked in tech, recently graduated from school, or if you’re just a fan of comedy and want to be taken for a ride, then this is the book for you.Try, Catch speaks to Software Engineers and lovers of comedy. Anyone who wants to be taken for an emotional rollercoaster is welcomed aboard.Ultimately, I hope that Try, Catch inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:Am I alone in feeling this way about life after graduation? Is the Silicon Valley the promised land?
I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing life after graduation and working in corporate will change us all for the better.What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December of 2020.
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

To him, life is funny if you know where to look or if you look at it through the right lens, which is never an easy thing to do.David is just a dude trying to make other people (and himself) laugh, while bringing some of his character into each of his characters. You can catch him playing video games, watching sports, or playing piano, while he’s not playing the lets-try-our-best-to-write-a-book game, which has slowly become his favorite game to play.For more information you can connect with David at davigfre@gmail.com and @dfcantug on Twitter and Instagram.He also likes to write about himself in third person on special occasions.Risks & ChallengesThe biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. story:
Absolute obedience, servitude, neutrality.

These were the laws that once governed Bartholomew, an immortal soulcatcher, until one ill-fated night when he was forced to make a choice: rebel against his masters or reveal an ancient, dangerous secret.

He chooses defiance.

Imprisoned for centuries as punishment for his decision, Bartholomew wastes away—until he creates an opportunity to escape. By a stroke of chance, Bartholomew finds himself in the human world and soon learns that breaking his bonds does not come without a price. Cut off from the grace that once ruled him, he must discover a new magic in 1930s Chicago.

Armed with only a cryptic message to give him direction, Bartholomew desperately tries to resume the mission he had started so long ago. Relying on the unlikely guidance of the streetwise orphan Charlie Reese, Bartholomew must navigate the depressed streets of the City in the Garden. But in order to solve this riddle, he must first discover if choice and fate are one in the same.


A Lightning Bolt Moment is merely a starting point. Most people know the story well about how J.K. Rowling came up with the idea for Harry Potter on a train ride from Manchester to London. For me, my bolt of lightning was not so obvious, at least not initially. I met my muse during the fall semester of my sophomore year of college. I was taking public speaking at the time and our latest assignment was to write an informative speech. We were allowed to choose anything as a topic and being that it was October, I thought it would be fun to talk about the history of Halloween.

 

I researched the topic online and to my surprise I did not have to dig far because the History Channel already had its Halloween spread active. Combing through the information, I came across the history of the Jack O’ Lantern and learned that the practice stems from an Irish folktale about a man named Stingy Jack. As the story goes, Stingy Jack tricked the Devil twice, each time making a deal, that if he should die, the Devil could not take his soul. When Jack died, God would not let such an unsavory character into heaven and true to his word, the Devil did not claim Jack’s soul. From that day on, Jack was doomed to roam the earth, with only piece of coal inside a hollowed turnip to light his way.

 

From there, I tried to learn more about this Stingy Jack, but no other stories were written about him, nor could I find the true origins of his Irish folktale. It fascinated me, the lack of information about this ill-fated character, confused why no one would have written a story about his wanderings, although one might claim Tim Burton already did in A Nightmare Before Christmas. But I was not looking for the Pumpkin King. I wanted to know what a mortal soul would do with its eternity. Could Stingy Jack fall in love? Would the Devil still be trying to beat his now immortal foe? Could Stingy Jack change his ways? Could he be granted a reprieve and be allowed into heaven? I wanted to know! And in order to know, I had to write his story. But it would take five years before Stingy Jack and I would meet again and another eight before the first story, which actually doesn’t feature Stingy Jack, was polished enough to get off the ground.

 

 

 

 

As of June 2015, I parted ways with my previous self-publishing company, realizing my first attempt at publishing was a bit of a farce, and was picked up by Wise Ink Creative Publishing. As they say, at first you don’t succeed, try, try again. And try I have! Team Wise Ink has not only managed to breathe new creative life into the rebooting my first novel, but they have provided exemplary service, direction, and support. Now armed with a new cover, title, and a professionally polished manuscript, The Breedling & the City in the Garden is ready to be released and take center stage in the literary world of Fantasy, Historical Fiction, and YA. Although, don’t be fooled by the young adult branding. It may be written for the taste of young readers, but the narrative transcends age.

 

Enter the Lords and Ladies of the world!

 

Having gotten this far, I know I will need assistance to continue on with the second and third phases of my publishing journey. It is with great humility, I call upon the classic practice of patronage, engaging the generosity of Lords and Ladies who are able to advance my dream.

 

PHASE 2 involves a pre-order campaign for my first book The Breedling & the City in the Garden, which will help fund the printing of the first 1000 copies, which makes up a predominate portion of the funding campaign. (Est Value: $3700)

 

PHASE 3 involves the design, editing, and proofreading of Book 2 in the Element Odysseys series The Breedling and the Trickster, in order to guarantee an expedient release of June 2017. (Est. Value $5200)  

 

If you are not able to give monetarily, you still can be a Lord or a Lady and spread the word.

story:
Short Summary


My name is James Hoffmann. I've been writing about coffee online since 2004 at jimseven.com. In 2014 I published The World Atlas of Coffee. I was the World Barista Champion in 2007, and I cofounded Square Mile Coffee Roasters in 2008.

I've written hundreds of posts online, and I wanted to take the best of them, to organise them, lay them out properly and create a compilation of my writing that people could enjoy in hardback form.

What We Need & What You Get

I want to fund the printing of the book. This campaign allows you to preorder the book at a special price, or just order the ebook if you'd like to support the project in some way.

I want to raise enough to cover the printing of at least 1,000 books.

Wholesale

We are offering wholesale quantities, the minimum being a box of books. If you're interested then do please get in touch.

Risks & Challenges

There is little risk as a backer of this project. I've already covered the costs of having the book designed, edited and proofed and laid out ready for print. The only cost that remains is printing so if the project is funded you are guaranteed a book!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've enjoyed the blog in the last 12 or 13 years, then I hope you'll support the project. Even if you don't want to back the project, sharing it on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram is hugely appreciated. (There are sharing buttons on the page!)

story:
Short Summary

Update: Goal has been reached, but that doesn't mean you can't purchase a copy. If I get to $6K, I'll be able to publish a hardcover edition!!!!

 

Hi! My name is J.W. Galliger and I'm the author of The Terminal Code. I wrote this book because for as long as I can remember, my dream has been to be an author. This book is my latest attempt at fulfilling that dream.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you'll think more about how technology, while powerful, can often be dangerous or exploited in the wrong hands. But ultimately, I want this book to be an escape into a world full of exciting characters, settings and of course mystery, action and adventure.

My story takes place in 2050 - NYC. A city that's been transformed by the advent of a virtual reality system, known as SCAPE. SCAPE is so incredible, so life-like, so amazing that many have abandoned the real world for the pleasure of the virtual. But, as society has shifted, so has crime. Our protagonist Dashiel Kincaid, a cocky security consultant known for his prowess and knowledge of SCAPE's systems, and fixing problems within them, is called to the scene of a murder. A murder that turns out to be much more than it seems - one that has crossed the bounds of SCAPE into real life. His quest for the truth reveals a deeper conspiracy. One that causes him to question the nature of his society, reality and even himself.

You'll love this book if you're a sci-fi or mystery buff, or if you're looking for a literary escape on a rainy Sunday afternoon.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

 

And much more!

About the Author

J.W. Galliger is a digital marketer with a passion for examining the world, it’s people, places, and the stories they tell. When he’s not polishing prose, pivoting spreadsheets or piloting ideas you can find him over a grill, dancing at a concert, or learning to be a new dad. This is his debut novel. He lives with his wife and daughter in Northern Virginia.

For more information you can connect with him on his website, on LinkedIn or on  Instagram @jwgalligerbooks. 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #theterminalcode and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
J.W. Galliger

story:
Story of My Book

The Wisdom of Guncles is about queer people and our relationship with family – however we choose to define it. Featuring a diverse pantheon of gay uncles (“guncles”) and other queer mentors, their stories offer powerful perspectives about life, love, and personal empowerment. From unpacking the role of the “black sheep” in challenging traditions to examining what the journey of coming out teaches us about self-discovery and transformation, this book is about the evolution, affirmation, and resilience of identity. It is anchored on the human journey of uncovering, covering, and recovering one’s truth. It is about all that may encumber, enable and enlighten our path to personhood and the wisdom that accumulates.

My name is Michael Dumlao, and I am the author of The Wisdom of Guncles: Stories and Advice on Living Life from a Queer Perspective. I wrote this book to explore the relationships between “Guncles” or “gay uncles” and our beloved niblings (the gender-neutral term for nieces and nephews), godchildren, baby cousins, and anyone younger who we might consider our proteges. And in doing so, I discovered that there is something truly unique about the lived queer experience that offers the world special examples, ideas and insights—wisdom, if you will—about what it means to live life with authenticity and compassion on your own terms.

My hope for this book is that it honors these uniquely queer and profoundly human stories that are not always told. My hope is that it becomes a resource for inspiration for those seeking advice about how to live their most authentic selves.

In this book, you’ll learn about the shift in the construct of family (especially the growing prevalence of chosen families) and what it means to be a disruptor in a family—someone who interrupts archaic practices and toxic patterns of behavior that keep us from reaching our potential. Stories such as these showcase how each Guncle desires to build a better world: 
 
  • From the non-binary drag artist from Paraguay who plays with gender and empowers their niece to come out as queer
  • To the African-American wheelchair-using academic from Ohio who wants his god-daughter to understand the joy of travel
  • To the trans masculine cosplayer in Atlanta who wants to create a world that empowers their protégé to explore who they are
  • To my own story of being the rainbow sheep of my family who grew up under martial law in the Philippines, immigrated to Australia, then moved across the United States to become a safe harbor and mentor to young people who felt they didn’t belong

You will love this book if you are a fellow Guncle and queer mentor—as well as a Guncles-in-waiting. I hope you see your self, your experience, and your relationships reflected in these stories. This book is also for you, our beloved protégés, so you can see how much you are affirmed and seen.

These stories are for people who chafe against tradition and norms and seek examples of dismantling and redefining them. Those of us who never fit in, who can’t help but stand out, and yearn for evidence that there is magic in resilience, comfort in transformation, and power in challenging the immovable.  

 

The Book - The Wisdom of Guncles

The book is written according to 10 archetypes of hard-won wisdoms, reflections, and cautionary tales reflective of the lived queer narrative: 
 
  • The Black Sheep offers an introduction to the underlying premise of how queer people’s role as the perpetual black sheep or outcasts of a family offers them unique perspectives. From challenging traditions to disrupting toxic patterns of behavior, this chapter explores how queer mentors help families and communities become more inclusive and equitable. 
     
  • The Bridge offers how my own story as a gay, Filipino immigrant who has lived and thrived on three continents makes me uniquely qualified to bridge cultures, histories, and ideas. I demonstrate this through my role as a guardian to two female, biracial (half-Filipino, half-Black) cousins who grapple with their intersectional identities.  
     
  • The Brother offers the story of a gay Peruvian immigrant and their close relationship with their decade-younger sister and her biracial daughter. His story demonstrates the power in questioning authority and institutions, and why young people must be equipped to decide their destiny for themselves.  
     
  • The Explorer offers the story of a gay, disabled, wheelchair-using African-American academic from Ohio who travels the world to escape prejudice and ultimately find his true self. He is the god-father to a young, biracial woman in whom he wants to instill the love for exploration. 
     
  • The Pioneer offers the story of a gay immigrant from Venezuela who escapes turmoil by coming to America. Here he establishes a new life and community that becomes a safe harbor for his niece, who looks to her guncle’s life-lessons on resilience and self-reliance as she navigates life as an undocumented student. 
     
  • The Nerd offers the story of a pansexual, transgender cosplayer from Atlanta who found the love, affirmation, and support they lacked from their abusive parents in their cosplay, fan convention, and choral communities. As a god-parent, they created a safe space for their god-child to come out. Their story proves the power and integrity of chosen families.  
     
  • The Alchemist offers the story of a queer, non-binary drag artist from Paraguay who suffered their immigrant parents' disappointment that they will never be the “golden child.” An artist who dismantles gender-norms, they created the safe-space they never had to embolden their niece to come out. 
     
  • The Beacon offers the story of an engaged gay couple whose same-sex relationship has become their many niblings’ only example of relationship stability. One comes from a Catholic family in Boston, the other a conservative Christian family in Maryland. Their story teaches that love is love.  
     
  • The Chameleon offers the story of a bisexual, African-American, non-binary, Army veteran from Alaska who has decided to never dim their light ever again after a lifetime of code-switching and a family legacy of hiding queer members. Their inspiring story of assertive authenticity becomes a beacon for their niblings and siblings to live their truth.  
     
  • The Patriarch offers the story of a queer, retired government worker in New York City who survived the AIDS crisis then became the leader of a family who has yet to know his full truth. This story honors the stories of all our secretly queer uncles and aunties who were hidden away but inspired future generations to create a world where everyone can come into the light. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021

  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this late summer, 2021
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Michael Dumlao is an artist, author, and activist equipped with twenty years of advancing diversity, equity, and social justice through award-winning brand management, digital marketing, and creative storytelling in corporate, federal, academic and non-profit environments. He recently led the rebrand of a Fortune 500 company and currently serves as a Senior Advisor for leaders in government, defense, and intelligence in diversity, marketing, and creative strategy. 

A sought-after speaker on audacious authenticity, brand activation, and social equity, Michael is passionate about the role of creativity and the arts in making a better world. He is a baritone in the Gay Men’s Chorus of Washington, DC, the founder of Fashion Fights Poverty, and the proud dog daddy of a 10-pound, long-haired chihuahua named “America.” 

For more information, connect with Michael via 

  • michael@thewisdomofguncles.com
  • www.linkedin.com/in/michaelrdumlao 
  • www.instagram.com/michaeldumlao 
     

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use  #thewisdomofguncles and #guncles and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts. You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Michael Dumlao

THANK YOU EVERYONE!

With YOUR help I raised enough for a professional editor, designer and for a small batch of limited edition books! In case you missed the chance to support my Indiegogo, you can head over to dougielux.com to pre-order your copy :)

With gratitude,

Dougie

 

---- CAMPAIGN ENDED ----

 

The Short Scoop!

Welcome to the crowdfunder for my new novel “The Motorcycle & The Molecule”! The book was inspired by a solo research expedition to explore alternative communities in Central America  and transports readers from the deep wilderness of Oregon to the jungles of Costa Rica. Join me on the adventure and you will:

  • Discover an array of unforgettable characters, unconventional communities and uncomfortable ceremonies.
  • Get introduced to Mayan rulers, mischievous beavers and mind-bending molecules.
  • Leave a trail of benevolent mischief sprinkled on your path!

 

Snippets, Excerpts & Audio Readings!

  • “When I woke up I had no idea that the day would involve getting intimate with a butch, hairy chested, bald man; that just wasn’t typically my sort of thing….” (Read the full excerpt or listen to the audio) 
  • "So here I was, lying on a raggedy couch, my throat scratchy from a night of drinking and smoking, and my chest hair sparkling with glitter. A couple of hours earlier, I found myself in a treehouse, the uninvited guest at a bizarre wedding and witness to the strange tradition of penis limbo." (Read the full excerpt or listen to the audio) 

  • "And that’s when the full humor of the situation hit me. Here we were in plastic ponchos, every color of the goddamn rainbow, slipping and sliding on the ruins of a culture that had collapsed due to climate change, environmental degradation, overpopulation, overconsumption, brutal infighting and war-mongering, and finally the sheer weight of its own bloated, ineffective governance… And that was all before the Spanish arrived to finish the job. Sound familiar? You’re damn right it sounds familiar, Rodrigo! Here we are raising our eyebrows over the exact same issues that we are facing in our own culture, and watching these amorphous blobs of purple, yellow, pink and blue, staring wide-eyed and taking pictures like the whole scenario was so completely alien to them seemed pretty damn funny right now." (Read the full excerpt or listen to the audio) 

 

 

What I Need & What YOU Get!

I just finished the final draft and I'm asking for your support in helping me publish a limited run of first-edition copies.

  • PROCEEDS from this crowdfunder directly fund the publishing costs. More specifically: the final editing process, cover design, interior design, copy editing, proof from publisher, first run of books and the postage to send them all out.
  • PERKS: Besides physical books, I’m also offering an ebook and an audiobook as well as a variety of experiential perks, such as RETREATS at Trillium, the wilderness community and retreat center where I live, as well as ADVENTURES on the West Coast of the US! (Click the links for details!)
  • QUESTIONS about any of the perks or scheduling experiences etc? Feel free to email me at indiegogo@dougielux.com :)

 

 

The seasons at Trillium Wilderness Community & Retreat Center. Sign up for a perk to visit!

 

Join me for a variety of adventures tours on the west coast! Check out the perks!

For example, let's go on an adventure in my colorful VW van "Mobo"!

...want to chat about a niche topic? I've got a perk for that too!

 

Who is Dougie Lux?

Dougie Lux is the alter ego of experience designer Douglas Campbell, cofounder of the Los Angeles event series MindshareLA and tech collective Syyn Labs, the latter of which became known for building the RGM music video  for the band OK Go. After a yoga teacher training in southeast Asia left him questioning his existence, Douglas returned to the states and began a three year identity experiment. He changed his name to Dougie Lux, left his flashy life in Southern California behind and moved to a wilderness community in Oregon. In the quiet of nature he learned carpentry and began restoring his old cabin, and in his proudest achievement, he finally settled down enough to write a book; "The Motorcycle & The Molecule" is a novel about his explorations of Central America during the winter of 2018.

Douglas Campbell lives on as an experience designer and event producer. Dougie Lux continues to explore his untapped capabilities... while also getting away with things that Douglas Campbell would simply never admit to doing :)

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The book is pretty much done but rather than just hoping my punctuation is perfect, designing a sub-par cover and using a shoddy printer, I decided to run a crowdfunder to finish it right! 

If I don't reach my full goal then I will reduce the professional publishing costs, do all the final editing and design myself, and eat beans and rice for the rest of the year... because one way or another if you order a book, you're getting a book!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sign up for a perk and help me realize my dream of bringing this book to the world :) Also you can be a huge help by sharing this crowdfunder with you friends!

THANKS AGAIN!

- Dougie Lux

story:
"The History of Rock (for Big Fans and Little Punks)" is a children´s book packed with 100+ pages, 150+ illustrations and hundreds of fun facts and curiosities about 70 years of rock music.

The book features the top artists and bands from every period of rock music history as well as from other genres and artistic movements that influenced rock music.

From Rock 'n' Roll pioneers of the 1950s to the 21st century rockers, the book is divided into 35 chronological chapters.

 

The authors selected and illustrated the most important and influential rock bands and solo musicians since the 50s, including artists like Elvis Presley, David Bowie, Lou Reed, Björk, and bands such as Nirvana, U2, Talking Heads, Breeders, The Prodigy, Sonic Youth, Metallica, The Beach Boys, The Clash and many more.

Hand-picked songs from hundreds of artists and bands are featured in the book, resulting in an extended playlist of over 1000 songs that pays tribute to the History of Rock in all of its glory.

The playlist will be available on Spotify and other similar platforms as soon as the book is published.

In addition to legendary rock musicians and bands, the book also features and describes the artistic movements that influenced rock or were influenced by it, such as Blues, Jazz, Soul or Hip-Hop, highlighting the bands responsible for the most creative and groundbreaking fusions.

Women are fundamental in the History of Rock!

Artists like Janis Joplin, Patti Smith and Joan Jett or bands like L7, The Breeders, The Runaways and many others inspired hundreds of boys and girls to become musicians.

The "History of Rock for Big Fans and Little Punks” is a book meant to be read by kids and to unite families around music and literature.

By browsing the book together, while watching music videos and listening to the suggested songs, kids will enjoy the songs their parents love.

The book and the posters are also a fun collection of Joana's illustrated portraits that have already received an enthusiastic thumbs up from legends such as Iggy Pop himself.

Last year, we published in Portugal a smaller version of this book and developed workshops in schools.

The amazing feedback and enthusiasm that we received from children and adults has inspired us to write a bigger and better international version in English.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Rita Nabais and Joana Raimundo are the creators of this book and they have poured their hearts and souls into it.

Rita is an accomplished and influential rock music DJ and a music researcher. She has a Master´s degree in English and American Culture and is also a teacher and a publisher, having published more than 60 authors.

Joana is a published illustrator, animator and designer. She worked in Portugal and Italy after studying drawing and illustration in Barcelona, and has collaborated on several children’s books, some of which became part of the official recommended books for children in Portugal.

It was their deep love affair with rock music that drove Rita and Joana to write and illustrate this book. Other members of the team include Nuno, Andreia and Hugo who have lent a much needed hand.

Nuno and Hugo have vast editorial experience, across more than 40 children's and educational books - as authors or publishers. Andreia is a Graphic Designer and has been making books with us for more than five years. Our team is spread between Alcobaça, Lisbon and London.

 

It was U2's frontman Bono Vox who said :

“Pop music often tells you everything is OK, while rock music tells you that it's not OK, but you can change it. There's a defiance in rock music that gives you a reason to get out of bed in the morning. Most pop music doesn't make you want to get out of bed, I'm sorry to say. It puts you to sleep.”

Rock music and artists can teach our children valuable lessons they could never get from much of the music currently playing on the radio or found in popular playlists. The obstacles that many rock legends have had to overcome in order to follow their passion and became successful provide great lessons for young readers.

That´s why we mention the difficult childhood Elvis Presley, Johnny Cash, Jimi Hendrix or Neil Young had; or how Jerry Lee Lewis' family had to sell their house allong with an enormous ammount of eggs to help launch Jerry's career; the way female musicians, like Janis Joplin, had to overcome gender bias; and the very harsh conditions some of the greatest blues pioneers were brought up while working the cotton fields.

If children should learn one lesson from our book, we hope it is that music, especially Rock music, can save and give meaning to one´s life.

 

We ship worldwide. In order to keep these shipping costs affordable, we will keep the book weight + package under 500 grams (approx. 17.5 oz), reducing both the cost and the CO2 emissions from the transportation.

Also, we have a universal Flat Shipping Rate of £5 (roughly $6.5 USD  or €5,7) for each book purchased.

music.The book features the top artists and bands from every period of rock music history as well as from other genres and artistic movements that influenced rock music.From Rock 'n' Roll pioneers of the 1950s to the 21st century rockers, the book is divided into 35 chronological chapters. The authors selected and illustrated the most important and influential rock bands and solo musicians since the 50s, including artists like Elvis Presley, David Bowie, Lou Reed, Björk, and bands such as Nirvana, U2, Talking Heads, Breeders, The Prodigy, Sonic Youth, Metallica, The Beach Boys, The Clash and many more.Hand-picked songs from hundreds of artists and bands are featured in the book, resulting in an extended playlist of over 1000 songs that pays tribute to the History of Rock in all of its glory.The playlist will be available on Spotify and other similar platforms as soon as the book is published.In addition to legendary rock musicians and bands, the book also features and describes the artistic movements that influenced rock or were influenced by it, such as Blues, Jazz, Soul or Hip-Hop, highlighting the bands responsible for the most creative and groundbreaking fusions.Women are fundamental in the History of Rock!Artists like Janis Joplin, Patti Smith and Joan Jett or bands like L7, The Breeders, The Runaways and many others inspired hundreds of boys and girls to become musicians.The "History of Rock for Big Fans and Little Punks” is a book meant to be read by kids and to unite families around music and literature.By browsing the book together, while watching music videos and listening to the suggested songs, kids will enjoy the songs their parents love.The book and the posters are also a fun collection of Joana's illustrated portraits that have already received an enthusiastic thumbs up from legends such as Iggy Pop himself.Last year, we published in Portugal a smaller version of this book and developed workshops in schools.The amazing feedback and enthusiasm that we received from children and adults has inspired us to write a bigger and better international version in English.       Rita Nabais and Joana Raimundo are the creators of this book and they have poured their hearts and souls into it.Rita is an accomplished and influential rock music DJ and a music researcher. She has a Master´s degree in English and American Culture and is also a teacher and a publisher, having published more than 60 authors.Joana is a published illustrator, animator and designer. She worked in Portugal and Italy after studying drawing and illustration in Barcelona, and has collaborated on several children’s books, some of which became part of the official recommended books for children in Portugal.It was their deep love affair with rock music that drove Rita and Joana to write and illustrate this book. Other members of the team include Nuno, Andreia and Hugo who have lent a much needed hand.Nuno and Hugo have vast editorial experience, across more than 40 children's and educational books - as authors or publishers. Andreia is a Graphic Designer and has been making books with us for more than five years. Our team is spread between Alcobaça, Lisbon and London. It was U2's frontman Bono Vox who said :“Pop music often tells you everything is OK, while rock music tells you that it's not OK, but you can change it. There's a defiance in rock music that gives you a reason to get out of bed in the morning. Most pop music doesn't make you want to get out of bed, I'm sorry to say. It puts you to sleep.”Rock music and artists can teach our children valuable lessons they could never get from much of the music currently playing on the radio or found in popular playlists. The obstacles that many rock legends have had to overcome in order to follow their passion and became successful provide great lessons for young readers.That´s why we mention the difficult childhood Elvis Presley, Johnny Cash, Jimi Hendrix or Neil Young had; or how Jerry Lee Lewis' family had to sell their house allong with an enormous ammount of eggs to help launch Jerry's career; the way female musicians, like Janis Joplin, had to overcome gender bias; and the very harsh conditions some of the greatest blues pioneers were brought up while working the cotton fields.If children should learn one lesson from our book, we hope it is that music, especially Rock music, can save and give meaning to one´s life. We ship worldwide. In order to keep these shipping costs affordable, we will keep the book weight + package under 500 grams (approx. 17.5 oz), reducing both the cost and the CO2 emissions from the transportation.Also, we have a universal Flat Shipping Rate of £5 (roughly $6.5 USD  or €5,7) for each book purchased.

story:
My name is April Wahlin and I've finally published my first novel 'The Centennial ~Short Stories of Ithiria' on Amazon! 

     Now comes the hard part, getting it to my audience. Lifetime banners on Facebook cost hundreds of dollars, editing runs in the thousands, and traveling costs to promote can add up pretty fast. Let alone the cost of printing copies for book sellers.

     What is a first time, independently published novelist to do?
     Indiegogo!

     So here I am, relying on the kindness of strangers to get this book out of the endless depths of Amazon listings and into peoples hands.


My Series:

     'The Centennial ~Short Stories of Ithiria' is the first in a long series of fantasy fiction novels I am writing. These books span the fictional gaps to encompass magic, technology, modern times, and medieval.

     The world of Ithiria features many different lands. Lands of magic creatures, electric wonders, oddball inventors, gods, and fearsome monsters. The tales themselves are full of great adventures, epic battles, bumbling sidekicks, brave heroes, and surprising romances.

 

Summary of my first fantasy novella now available on Amazon and Kindle:
'The Centennial ~Short Stories of Ithiria':
     It has been one hundred years to the day since the brothers Voodoo last met in the land of Hollywood. From all across the world of Ithiria they have come with tales of weary navigators, fearsome monsters, and ancient creatures. However, with unstable magics wreaking havoc in their home lands, only a few of the brothers are able to make the trip. Between interruptions from the fates and delayed siblings, they struggle to present the thirteen tales needed to revitalize their guardianship of Ithiria.

 

~~~~~

 

About Me:

      I am a professional writer that has been published in the pirating publication 'Mutiny Magazine' and done work for the new online card game 'Hex: Shards of Fate' by Cryptozoic. Seven of my professional working years have been spent in the Entertainment Industry as an Actor. In 2007 I won a reality show titled ‘Search for the next Elvira,’ and I have worked at Comic Con International since 2001.

 

~~~~~

 

To get an idea of the world of Ithiria, below is a list of similar titles-

     Similar Book Series: Harry Potter, Lord of The Rings, Percy Jackson

     Similar Authors: Gregory Mcguire, JK Rowling, Christopher Moore

     Similar Media: TV Show 'Once Upon a Time,' Graphic Novel Series 'Fables', Made for TV Movie '10th Kingdom'

     Demographic: Females and Males ages 13-35. As well as anyone that just has a love of fantasy fiction.

 

~~~~~

 

What We Need & What You Get:

     My goal is to fund editing, publishing, and promotions for my book series through social medias, book stores, conventions, and any other avenues that might help my work get to the people who will enjoy it.

     With the donation of $25 or more you get a signed copy of 'The Centennial ~ Short Stories of Ithiria' sent to you and your name will be listed in a special thank you at the back of my next novel.

     If I do not reach my goal, what has been raised will be put toward what banners, adds, editing, convention costs, and copies it will afford or be placed in an account until I have reached the amount needed for such things.
     I will post updates on my Facebook page for the World of Ithiria
www.facebook.com/worldofithiria

 

~~~~~ 

 

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help!:

     If you can't donate but are interested in the concept of the series or would like to support this endeavor, you can still contribute in many ways.

     -Use the Indiegogo share tools!

     -Like my Facebook page for the World of Ithiria-
www.facebook.com/worldofithiria

     -You can blog or write reviews of 'The Centennial ~Short Stories of Ithiria' on your favorite sites.

     -Encourage those you think might enjoy the book to check it out, donate, or comment.

     -You can purchase a copy of 'The Centennial ~Short Stories of Ithiria' book on amazon.com at the link below.

http://www.amazon.com/The-Centennial-Short-Stor...

 

~~~~~


     Thank you so much for your interest and taking the time to check out my campaign to get the world of Ithiria to its audience! :)

     Sincerely,

     April Wahlin :)

 

~~~~~

 

     If you would like to know more about the series, I have listed some basic story information below along with descriptions of the other novels I have written. I very much hope to edit, publish, and promote all these stories with the help of this campaign.

 

Background of Ithiria:

     Ithiria is a world much like our Earth, with whole continents and all species of people. I created this place to encompass our mythologies: from Christian and Indian stories to Greek Mythology and Fairy Tales. Here they all exist and interact with one another in precarious magical lands.
     These lands have broken apart into their own continents due to a war which separated them with an influx of magic and electricity. However, they are all still very much a part of the same world and timeline—whether they are aware of one another or not.
     The individual lands are in an enlightened and experimental period where continents rich in electric current are discovering magic reverberations and vise versa.


Here are just a few land examples:

     Old World is a land where all the characters from Grimm’s Fairy Tales and Hans Christian Anderson clash, complete with majestic castles, great villages, and of course ominous and enchanted forests. Magic flourishes here and provides people with access to simple and fearsome spells alike, as well as bewitched objects like magic mirrors and wands.


     The Industrial Domain is a land of cobblestone streets and glass lanterns that would make Sherlock Holmes feel perfectly at home. It is a place of new science and technology, where boats sail into the sky and Tesla-inspired gadgets are an aspect of everyday life. However, the underbelly of this old new world is akin to Jack the Ripper’s: any number of ill tidings can befall unescorted passersby.

 

     Gods Grace is a Mythology-based land where the Gods have gone to retire from their terrifying exploits in the Vacant Realm. Gods Grace is a great mountainous land mass which humbles Mount Olympus and is surrounded by seas so ferocious and full of beasts that Poseidon will never want for anywhere else. It is a land of almost pure magic where the clouds themselves are tread upon.


Other Works:

 

Ithiria: An Epic Adventure Novel
     This epic journey through the beginnings of Ithiria follows a young Princess with deep ties into the very heart of Ithiria. With the help of forest rogues, gypsies, and others like herself, she fights to defeat an evil queen determined to destroy the lands and all those within.

 

Rayne in the Black Wood: A Young Adult Novel

     Rayne, a newly turned sixteen year old from Old World, attempts to attend a prestigious public school after being home-schooled all her life. When assigned a class project on the social aspects of their land after all the good subjects are taken, she and her miscreant friends turn to the bad. Determined to ace the project, Rayne leads her friends into the dangerous Black Woods, full of terrible monsters and horrific spells. However, upon entering, they quickly find that the bad guys are not as bad as they thought and the good guys are not as good.

 

Pandora Syndrome: A Supernatural Horror Comedy Novel

     Pandora Blackheart is having the worst twenty-first birthday in history: not only has she been left behind by her friends, she has woken up in a stranger’s bed with a terrible craving for blood. In this quirky comedic horror novel, Pandora must adjust to her new life as a blood sucker. Unfortunately, once she seems to get the hang of it, an undead force comes to challenge her. Wanting nothing more than to sit and play video games, she finds herself wrapped up in a deadly plot encompassing her past, present, and future.

 

The Persephone: A Seafaring Fantasy Novel

     This story is of Moira McLandon, a sea captain’s daughter who is stolen into slavery and forced to fight her way to freedom. When dressed as a boy to escape her slavers, she crosses paths with a duo of cargo-stealing pirates, who have more on their mind than simple thievery. Moira transforms into the illustrious Captain McBane and follows the lead of her mentor on adventures which take her across countless seas, through the grips of monsters, and into the very jaws of death.

story:
Voces libertarias: Los orígenes históricos del anarquismo en Puerto Rico

"A book about the history of Puerto Rican radicalism and anarchism"

My name is Jorell A. Meléndez Badillo. I'm an independent scholar interested in the history of radical ideas. I am also a history teacher by trade, an anarchist by conviction, and a punk rock singer for kicks. I've published several articles on the history of anarchism in Puerto Rico and I've presented on the topic in different spaces in Canada, United States, United Kingdom, and Puerto Rico. I was one of the organizers of the 3rd Annual North American Anarchist Studies Network Conference in San Juan and I'm currently an active member of the Coléctivo Autónomo C.C.C., which runs a Centro Social/Infoshop in the town of Santurce (www.infoshopsanturce.wordpress.com). 

I am trying to gather funds in order to publish a research that I've been doing for the past three years. Originally, it was a M.A. thesis project called "El anarquismo en Puerto Rico: Su influencia en la cultura proletaria puertorriqueña durante las primeras dos décadas del siglo XX". Its aim was to make a contribution to the history of radical ideas in Puerto Rico by presenting anarchism as a historical reality, contrary to what was presented by official Puerto Rican historiography which dealt with the topic from a distance. 

The publication of this book will help expand the field of anarchist studies in the island and would open a space for a Puerto Rican anarchist historiography. Given the nature of the project, the ideas presented in it, and my own ideological concerns, the funds gathered here would help me publish it in the spirit of D.I.Y. (do-it-yourself) politics. My friend Chris Clavin will help distribute the book on his "Secret Sailor Books". 

What We Need & What You Get

The first run would be of 250 copies. The printing house I've consulted charges $3.93 for each copy (softcover + black&white) = $982.50. This quantity does not include shipping & handling nor the cost of setting up the book and other trivialities. That's what the extra $217.50 (minus $84 for the IndieGogo charges) are for. 

With your funds not only will you be helping in the construction of a collective history of anarchism on the island, that will be of crucial importance in building an encompassing movement, but you will get a few perks in return of your solidarity (not charity). You will get stuff from zines published by our own Colectivo Autónomo C.C.C. to posters, thanks, and/or a night out in San Juan (when in the area). 

If the goal is not met, even though my heart will be broken, you will still get your perks (not including the book), and I will save the money until I get enough to publish it. Once I do, the people who were getting a book will do so. 

Other Ways You Can Help

In the spirit of mutual aid and solidarity, which is the backbone of the anarchist ideology, you can also help in other ways that do not necessarily include money.

  • You can tell your friends about the nascent anarchist movement on the island.
  • You can send letters to the Colectivo Autónomo C.C.C.
  • You can go out and create your own radical projects and/or researches.
  • You can invite a few friends over, cook a meal, skip work, and engage in real conversations with real people.
  • Go out.
  • Meet your neighbors.
  • Create allies and know your enemies.
  • Fall madly in love to fuel your rage.
  • Organize.

_________________

Voces libertarias: Los orígenes históricos del anarquismo en Puerto Rico

"Un libro sobre el radicalismo y el anarquismo en Puerto Rico"

Mi nombre es Jorell A. Meléndez Badillo. Soy un investigador independiente interesado en ideas radicales, también soy maestro de profesión, anarquista por convicción y un punk rocker por diversión. He publicado varios artículos relacionados a la historia del anarquismo en Puerto Rico y, además, los he presentado en diferentes espacios en Canadá, Reino Unido, Estados Unidos y Puerto Rico. Fui uno de los organizadores de la 3ra Conferencia Anual del North American Anarchist Studies Network en San Juan y actualmente soy un miembro activo del Colectivo Autónomo C.C.C., el cual corre un Centro Social/Infoshop en la Santurce (www.infoshopsanturce.wordpress.com).

Al momento estoy tratando de recopilar fondos para poder publicar una investigación la cual he ido desarrollando en los últimos tres años. Originalmente fue una tesis para el nivel de maestría bajo el nombre de “El anarquismo en Puerto Rico: Su influencia en la cultura proletaria puertorriqueña durante las primeras dos décadas del siglo XX”. Su propósito era hacer una contribución a la historia de las ideas radicales en Puerto Rico al presentar el anarquismo como una realidad histórica, contrario a lo que ha sido presentado por la historiografía oficial puertorriqueña la cual ha tratado el tema desde cierta distancia. La publicación de este libro ayudará a expandir el campo de los estudios anarquistas en la isla mientras que abrirá un espacio para una historiografía anarquista puertorriqueña. Debido a la naturaleza del proyecto, el de las ideas presentadas en el mismo y mi posturas ideológicas, los fondos que sean recopilados me ayudarán a publicar la investigación en el espíritu del D.I.Y. (acrónimo en inglés para Hazlo Tú Mismo).

Lo que necesitamos y lo que recibirás

La primera tirada será de 250 copias. La imprenta consultada cobrará $3.93 por cada copia (carpeta suave + blanco/negro) = $982.50. Esta cantidad no incluye manejo y envío, como tampoco los costos de editar, formatear, junto a otras trivialidades. Para esto se utilizarán los $217.50 (menos $84 que cobra IndieGoGo por sus servicios) que sobran.

Con tus fondos no solo estarías ayudando en la construcción de una historia anarquista colectiva en la isla, sino que también será de crucial importancia para la creación de un movimiento inclusivo sino que también te llevarás algunos regalos en cambio por tu solidaridad (no caridad). Podrás obtener desde zines publicados por el Colectivo Autónomo C.C.C. hasta posters, gracias, y/o una noche en el área de San Juan (cuando estés en el área). Si la meta no se cumple, aunque se me rompa el corazón, todavía se enviarán los regalos (con excepción del libro) y el dinero será guardado hasta poder agrupar los suficiente para poder publicarlo. Una vez se publique, se enviarán copias del libro a aquellos que se les debía.

Otras formas de ayudar

En el espíritu de apoyo mutuo y solidaridad, que son la espina dorsal de la ideología anarquista, también puedes ayudar en otras formas que no necesariamente incluyen dinero.

  • Puedes decirles a tus amigxs sobre al naciente movimiento anarquista en la isla.
  • Puedes salir y crear tus propios proyectos/investigaciones radicales.
  • Puedes invitar algunos amigxs, faltar al trabajo y crear conversaciones reales con personas reales.
  • Sal afuera.
  • Conoce tus vecinxs.
  • Crea alianzas y conoce tus enemigxs.
  • Enamórate locamente para alimentar tu rabia.
  • Organízate.

With your funds not only will you be helping in the construction of a collective history of anarchism on the island, that will be of crucial importance in building an encompassing movement, but you will get a few perks in return of your solidarity (not charity). You will get stuff from zines published by our own Colectivo Autónomo C.C.C. to posters, thanks, and/or a night out in San Juan (when in the area). If the goal is not met, even though my heart will be broken, you will still get your perks (not including the book), and I will save the money until I get enough to publish it. Once I do, the people who were getting a book will do so. 


Other Ways You Can Help
In the spirit of mutual aid and solidarity, which is the backbone of the anarchist ideology, you can also help in other ways that do not necessarily include money.

You can tell your friends about the nascent anarchist movement on the island.
You can send letters to the Colectivo Autónomo C.C.C.
You can go out and create your own radical projects and/or researches.
You can invite a few friends over, cook a meal, skip work, and engage in real conversations with real people.
Go out.
Meet your neighbors.
Create allies and know your enemies.
Fall madly in love to fuel your rage.
Organize.

_________________
Voces libertarias: Los orígenes históricos del anarquismo en Puerto Rico
"Un libro sobre el radicalismo y el anarquismo en Puerto Rico"
Mi nombre es Jorell A. Meléndez Badillo. Soy un investigador independiente interesado en ideas radicales, también soy maestro de profesión, anarquista por convicción y un punk rocker por diversión. He publicado varios artículos relacionados a la historia del anarquismo en Puerto Rico y, además, los he presentado en diferentes espacios en Canadá, Reino Unido, Estados Unidos y Puerto Rico. Fui uno de los organizadores de la 3ra Conferencia Anual del North American Anarchist Studies Network en San Juan y actualmente soy un miembro activo del Colectivo Autónomo C.C.C., el cual corre un Centro Social/Infoshop en la Santurce (www.infoshopsanturce.wordpress.com).
Al momento estoy tratando de recopilar fondos para poder publicar una investigación la cual he ido desarrollando en los últimos tres años. Originalmente fue una tesis para el nivel de maestría bajo el nombre de “El anarquismo en Puerto Rico: Su influencia en la cultura proletaria puertorriqueña durante las primeras dos décadas del siglo XX”. Su propósito era hacer una contribución a la historia de las ideas radicales en Puerto Rico al presentar el anarquismo como una realidad histórica, contrario a lo que ha sido presentado por la historiografía oficial puertorriqueña la cual ha tratado el tema desde cierta distancia. La publicación de este libro ayudará a expandir el campo de los estudios anarquistas en la isla mientras que abrirá un espacio para una historiografía anarquista puertorriqueña. Debido a la naturaleza del proyecto, el de las ideas presentadas en el mismo y mi posturas ideológicas, los fondos que sean recopilados me ayudarán a publicar la investigación en el espíritu del D.I.Y. (acrónimo en inglés para Hazlo Tú Mismo).
Lo que necesitamos y lo que recibirás
La primera tirada será de 250 copias. La imprenta consultada cobrará $3.93 por cada copia (carpeta suave + blanco/negro) = $982.50. Esta cantidad no incluye manejo y envío, como tampoco los costos de editar, formatear, junto a otras trivialidades. Para esto se utilizarán los $217.50 (menos $84 que cobra IndieGoGo por sus servicios) que sobran.
Con tus fondos no solo estarías ayudando en la construcción de una historia anarquista colectiva en la isla, sino que también será de crucial importancia para la creación de un movimiento inclusivo sino que también te llevarás algunos regalos en cambio por tu solidaridad (no caridad). Podrás obtener desde zines publicados por el Colectivo Autónomo C.C.C. hasta posters, gracias, y/o una noche en el área de San Juan (cuando estés en el área). Si la meta no se cumple, aunque se me rompa el corazón, todavía se enviarán los regalos (con excepción del libro) y el dinero será guardado hasta poder agrupar los suficiente para poder publicarlo. Una vez se publique, se enviarán copias del libro a aquellos que se les debía.
Otras formas de ayudar
En el espíritu de apoyo mutuo y solidaridad, que son la espina dorsal de la ideología anarquista, también puedes ayudar en otras formas que no necesariamente incluyen dinero.

Puedes decirles a tus amigxs sobre al naciente movimiento anarquista en la isla.
Puedes salir y crear tus propios proyectos/investigaciones radicales.
Puedes invitar algunos amigxs, faltar al trabajo y crear conversaciones reales con personas reales.
Sal afuera.
Conoce tus vecinxs.
Crea alianzas y conoce tus enemigxs.
Enamórate locamente para alimentar tu rabia.
Organízate.

story:
The Project

We are raising $5000 over the next month to edit, print, and distribute our largest compilation book to date: The Invader's Guide to New Orleans. 

Clocking in at more than 175+ pages, this volume will be the perfect guide of the people, places and projects of New Orleans featuring content from the blog and digital magazine as well as exciting new content just for the book. 

Spanning a number of categories, The Invader's Guide is perfect for locals and tourists. Sections include: Bars and Nightlife, Culture, Food, Fashion, Music, and Lagniappe

Each section includes places to visit, people to know, and quotes from locals. 

 

Why You Should Donate

The money for pre-orders and donations will be used (1) To pay for printing (2) To hire a Nola based copy editor and proofreader (3) To pay for new content (4) To help supplement an issue release party.   

We are self publishing this volume because we are passionate about highlighting the great things about our local culture. Not only will you be investing in independent media, you also get some pretty awesome prizes.

 

 

Help us speed the word. Update your FB and Twitter and encourage your friends to participate!

story:
All across Africa the simple act of kicking a ball brings joy to many people. It is a connection from the cheers for the professionals in stadiums, to the smiles of children in dusty playgrounds. Most of these people are native Africans, but an increasing number are North Americans volunteering to teach children the sport of soccer, and related life lessons. Thousands of people are doing it every year through more than two dozen organizations, and thousands more will do it in years to come. South Africa has been a center of soccer activity over the past few years, and that focus will sharpen once more as it prepares for the upcoming Africa Cup of Nations which it hosts from January 19 - February 10 2013. Within its great cities, still buzzing from the vuvuzelas of the World Cup, anticipation of this event is growing.

This is a three phase project:

1) I will conduct interviews with North Americans who are actually in Africa volunteering their time to teach children soccer through such organizations as: Projects Abroad, International Volunteer HQ, Grassroot Soccer, Cross Cultural Solutions, African Impact, and a number of others. This will be an opportunity to have a series of articles that show how we, ordinary citizens of North America, can positively affect the world around us. Africa has also become a hotbed of talent with the likes of Didier Drogba, Samuel Eto’o, Yaya Toure and many others making an impact in world soccer. I wish to show the connection from dusty African playgrounds staffed by American volunteers, to the premier stadiums of World soccer.

2) I will examine how a local African soccer league operates. Premier Soccer League (PSL) is South Africa's top soccer league. I will look at how it operates under its strict rules of only allowing five foreign born players per team by closely following Ajax Cape Town. I will interview coaches, players, front office staff, and most importantly the fans, to gauge what makes this young league work as well as it does. I aim to show what North American fans can learn from PSL in terms of pride in locally grown talent. I will also look to explore Ajax Cape Town’s Community Scheme, where players and coaches participate with children in their area, is also there.

3) The last phase will incorporate the Africa Cup of Nations, which will be held in South Africa January 19 - February 10 2013. This will be a great opportunity to show what the pinnacle of soccer in Africa can do for its people. The purpose of this phase will be to link together everything from the children learning soccer in the playground, to the professionals with their clubs, to the international stars representing their country.

My current goal is to be fully prepared to undertake this assignment for the beginning of the next PSL season in. I will be basing myself out of Cape Town, South Africa during the duration of this project.All funding will go towards my travel and living expenses while in Africa. Funding for self publishing will be explorel ater on if a publisher is not found.

Depending on the funding I raise I will be in Africa from August or October of 2012 to the conclusion of the Africa Cup of Nations in February of 2013. My focus will only be on the completion of this book, and that is what your contribution will go towards: the successful execution of this exciting and educational project which has the ultimate goal of further breaking down the imagined barriers in the world.

story:
Short Summary

Hello,

My name is Travis Treece. I am a graphic and fine artist, and the proud designer of the CRABBCUTTER. I have been creating for the past twenty years and during that time I came up with the design for the CRABBCUTTER. My campaign is to raise money so that I may market and produce my design and make a positive change in my life and those who surround me. I feel like the CRABBCUTTER can make eating seafood an even more enjoyable occasion than it already is. The world enjoys seafood... I can only hope to make the experience more enjoyable. With your help I will be able to see a dream come to fruition. 


What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for 25000 usd. This money will immediately be used to pay for any legalities one needs when one is bringing a new product to market. I would also like to use the money to produce some samples for marketing purposes and maybe even for our first big order. If I do not reach my campaign goal I will use what funding I have gained to further my cause and to make my dream a reality. As a thank you for your support, you will be one of the first of many, to own a CRABBCUTTER!


The Impact

I feel in my heart that the CRABBCUTTER is a great product that makes eating crab and lobster a more enjoyable experience. Seafood lovers around the globe will find the CRABBCUTTER to be a great and invaluable addition to your kitchen. Please help me get this product into the hands of  every seafood love in the world!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, word of mouth, grass roots networking, goes a long way. Please spread the word. Don't forget the Indiegogo share tools! Thank you for your time, interest, and support.

CRABBCUTTER "cuts through crab like melted butter!"

story:
This is where I'm supposed to explain to you exactly why you should give me your money, because I need it. 

Not this time. 

Since I ran my first writing-related campaign more than a year ago, a lot has changed for me. I'm now a full-time writer, making a living from doing what I love. I'm not rich by any means, but that isn't the goal. I pay the bills with a little extra, and that's plenty for me. 

I'm running this campaign because my readers have made it clear they want me to. They want an easy way to get the perks that come with these campaigns: the chance to name a character, do a beta read, get autographed copies. These are things I *could* do outside of the IndieGoGo platform, but this campaign is an easy way to put it all in one place. 

In other words, I'm not doing this for the money. Don't get me wrong, being paid is a nice benefit. I'm not turning my nose up at a chance to make extra income. 

But I'm doing this for them. For you. Because you asked for it, not because I want your money. If you're reading this, chances are you've already shown your support by buying my books or by backing one of my previous campaigns. 

For that, I thank you, both in words and by creating this campaign at your request. Choose your perk wisely!
