story:
"I worked side-by-side with Kier-la Janisse in the first incarnation of the Alamo Drafthouse creative team.  To this day, I marvel at her depth of understanding and knowledge of the esoteric nooks and crannies of pop culture.  If I learned one thing during our time together it is this: when Kier-la Janisse curates ANY program, your life will be far richer if you check it out.”
- Tim League, founder and CEO of Alamo Drafthouse Cinema

Thanks to everyone who made our campaign successful! Once the campaign closes you can still pre-order the KID POWER book through the Spectacular Optical website, www.spectacularoptical.ca!

And be sure to "like" our Facebook Page to keep up to date on all our future books and book launch screening events!


Short Summary

Growing up, did you ever sit in front of a TV, a 16mm school projector or a VCR and come under the hypnotic spell of the tuff, sassy, cool and inspiring kids that you saw on the screen? Perhaps you grinned as Jacob Two-Two stood up to The Hooded Fang, thrilled as Hawk Jones grabbed a small arsenal to take down some gangsters or cringed as a bespectacled Scott Baio got Stoned?

We certainly looked up to many of these pint-sized tots, tweens and teens, and chances are you did too. That’s why we’re devoting the first anthology in the new Spectacular Optical book series, KID POWER!, to this inspiring world of kid cult classics from North America, the UK, Australia and beyond. From the 1940s antics of Curley and his Gang to the overwrought denim-clad melodrama of The ABC Afterschool Special, from the surreal fantasies of The Peanut Butter Solution to the pre-teen bloodsucking melodrama The Little Vampire, KID POWER! is a heavily-illustrated collection of film writing by a diverse array of some of genre criticism’s most unique voices.

My name is Kier-La Janisse, and I’m very excited to be taking on the role of co-editor and publisher for the Spectacular Optical series. I have been a film writer and programmer since 1997. I’ve had two books of my own published by FAB Press (HOUSE OF PSYCHOTIC WOMEN and A VIOLENT PROFESSIONAL: THE FILMS OF LUCIANO ROSSI), as well as many articles in magazines and journals ranging from FANGORIA to INCITE JOURNAL OF EXPERIMENTAL MEDIA, but KID POWER! will be the first book published under my own imprint, the micro-press Spectacular Optical. This inaugural anthology of kid-centric essays and interviews is co-edited with my friend and Managing Editor Paul Corupe, best known as the founder of both the Canadian cult film website Canuxploitation.com and Toronto’s Black Museum horror lecture series.

For KID POWER!, the first in our series of themed cult film writing anthologies, I’m honoured to have the participation of writers from across the globe including author/film producer Zack Carlson (DESTROY ALL MOVIES!! THE COMPLETE GUIDE TO PUNKS ON FILM and THE AMERICAN SCREAM), FANGORIA Magazine Editor-in-Chief Chris Alexander, underground comic legends Rick Trembles (MOTION PICTURE PURGATORY) and Robin Bougie (CINEMA SEWER), film scholar Alexandra Heller-Nicholas (RAPE REVENGE FILMS: A CRITICAL STUDY) performance artist/pop culture historian Robert Dayton (CANNED HAMM, THE CANADIAN ROMANTIC), film programmers Bret Berg (CineFamily), Jesse Hawthorne Ficks (MiDNiTES FOR MANiACS) and Briony Kidd (Stranger With My Face Horror Film Festival) and writers Owen Williams (EMPIRE) and Cheryl Singleton (FANGORIA) as well as myself and Paul rounding out the bunch. It’s gonna be epic!

What We Need & What You Get

We’ve largely completed pre-production work on KID POWER!, which is set to launch at the Fantasia International Film Festival in Montreal, Canada (July 17-Aug 5), with a U.S. launch shortly thereafter. To help cover the initial printing costs and get Spectacular Optical off the ground, we’re offering the chance to pre-order the book and help us make it the way we envision it. We know you’ll want the book. But we think you’ll want it sooner rather than later!

The funds raised here will go specifically toward printing costs and artist fees – not only designer fees, but all contributors to the book (with the exception of myself – part of my own contribution) will receive royalties on every copy sold. Part of our goal with Spectacular Optical is to create a small but sustainable business that is able to pay artist fees to the many awesome (and often underpaid) writers and graphic artists working in our field, and to give them books they are proud of.

Cover and Chapter Headings for the KID POWER! book are being created by Portland-based artist Austin Sellers (www.austinmadethis.com). The book will be a stylish, full colour trade paperback with a matte-coated cover with spot gloss.Check out the cover below:

The full contents of the book are:

·  It's a Yorkshire Thing: An Interview with David Bradley of KES - by Kier-La Janisse
An in-depth talk with the star of Ken Loach's beloved British classic

·  After-School Shootout: The Lowry Brothers' HAWK JONES - by Paul Corupe
Paul Corupe interviews the director of the all-kid 80s cop action movie

·  Bad Hair Day: Producer Rock Demers on THE PEANUT BUTTER SOLUTION – by Bret Berg
The CineFamily's Bret Berg talks to the man who prompted a million childhood nightmares

·  Curley and his Gang: The Laughably Short Life of Hal Roach’s Second Kid Comedy Crew – by Zack Carlson
Destroy All Movies!! co-author Zack Carlson takes Hal "Little Rascals" Roach to task over his flubbed follow-up

·  They Can See In The Dark:  An Interview with Richard Nielsen, Writer/Producer of THE LITTLE VAMPIRE - by Cheryl Singleton
A rare conversation with the creator of the strange, short-lived Canadian-German TV series

·  Motherless Child: The Power and Poetry of THE UGLY LITTLE BOY - by Chris Alexander
A personal remembrance of coming-of-age with Isaac Asimov's moving tale, adapted for the small screen with 70s series Classics Dark and Dangerous.

·  They Let Me Keep a Crocodile: A Conversation with Stephen Rosenberg, Child Star of 1978's JACOB TWO-TWO MEETS THE HOODED FANG- by Zack Carlson
Zack Carlson tracks down the star of the DIY Canadian classic adapted from Mordecai Richler's celebrated kids book.

·  THE CHILDREN OF TIMES SQUARE – by Robin Bougie
Robin Bougie interweaves his own history with that of Curtis Hanson's seedy, streetwise 1986 TV movie.

·  Dear Judy: Australian Childhood Mythologized in SEVEN LITTLE AUSTRALIANS  - by Briony Kidd
Briony Kidd's love-letter to the feisty, tragic character at the center of Ethel Turner's classic 1894 novel, as seen in the 1973 TV miniseries.

·  The Dark Side of Disney: An Interview with Directors John Hough and Paul Hough - by Kier-La Janisse
We talk to John Hough - director of The Watcher in the Woods and the Witch Mountain films - and his son, filmmaker Paul Hough, about the implications of making (and watching) children's entertainment in the 1970s.

·  Cosmic Rays and Mind Travel: Anthony Read's CHOCKY Trilogy - by Owen Williams
Owen Williams looks at Anthony Read's odd and scary television adaptation of John Wyndham's final novel, Chocky, and its subsequent sequels.

·  Knowing is Half the Battle: An Interview with ABC Afterschool Specials Producer Martin Tahse - by Kier-La Janisse

·  A Who's Who of ABC Afterschool Specials – by Kier-La Janisse
An A-Z of our favourite familiar faces from the series in the 70s and 80s.

·  Stinky: Abbott and Costello’s Resident Man-Child - by Robert Dayton
Robert Dayton, the Canadian Romantic himself, asks, "Who is Stinky? And what does he mean?"

·  Motion Picture Purgatory: KENNY, THE KID BROTHER (1988)- by Rick Trembles
Trembles' legendary comic-form movie review takes on the half-bodied hero of Claude Gagnon's unforgettable docu-drama.

·  Kids Flicks Are No Laughing Matter - by Jesse Hawthorne Ficks
From Song of the South to Bugsy Malone and Rich Kids, Jesse Ficks looks at the life lessons imparted by classic family films.

·  Ann Turner’s CELIA: They Kill Rabbits, Don't They?- by Briony Kidd
Briony Kidd talks to Rebecca Smart, the child star of Ann Turner's terrifying and genre-defying coming of age film.

·  Nicoletta Elmi: Italian Horror's Imp Ascendent – by Alexandra Heller-Nicholas and Craig Martin
The most memorable child actress from the heyday of Italian horror films gets a retrospective appreciation from Oz' most astute and enthusiastic scholars.

Editions of the book include:

·  Regular Edition

·  Collector’s Edition (limited to 50, comes with compilation CD)

·  Collector’s Set (limited to 25, comes with compilation CD, JACOB TWO-TWO “Child Power” T-shirt and KENNY skateboard deck designed by Jay Shaw (www.kingdomofnonsense.com)

Aside from these pre-sale packages, we also have many additional perks ranging from movie tickets to original artwork, care of our campaign sponsors Drafthouse Films, Fantastic Fest, The Fantasia International Film Festival, MONDO, Trash Palace, CineFamily, FAB Press, The Black Museum and animator/illustrator Leslie Supnet. Check out the detailed perk levels in the right-hand column!

The Impact

"Having been fortunate enough to work alongside Kier-La at multiple events, I could not be more convinced that she's one of the most knowledgeable, creative and insightful voices in the world of genre film today. She doesn't just know her shit, she knows how to help other people know her shit, too, in the most entertaining way possible."

- Todd Brown, Founder and Editor-in-chief, Twitch / Acquisitions, XYZ Films

This may be the first book I’m publishing under my own imprint, but it’s far from the first project I’ve managed at this scale. I’ve founded and operated film festivals (CineMuerte Film Festival, Vancouver) and independent micro-cinemas (the Blue Sunshine Psychotronic Film Centre, Montreal), and have also coordinated a number of film commission projects and live performances. Even the skills I learned running a fanzine back in the ‘90s have proven useful on this project! But aside from whatever skills, experience and connections we bring to the table (you can read our full bios below), we’ve also been mentored all along the way by the British cult film publisher FAB Press - so we have some good people on our side making sure we don’t fall.

KID POWER! will be published even if we don’t meet our goal—the book is completely written and copy-edited, contracts have been signed, photographs have been sourced and the book is being laid out. We’re well on our way!

This funding challenge not only allows you to pre-order a limited edition copy of KID POWER!, it’s also intended to help make the book as awesome as we know it can be—a heavily-illustrated, full colour edition with a beautiful cover. If we don’t meet our goal, we will still print the book, but it will be in black & white, with less frills. And we’re hoping that our debut can represent the best we have to offer, which will lead to the kind of word of mouth that will allow us to continue Spectacular Optical. Success with selling this first book will go a long way in ensuring a stable foundation for our next book.

Who we are:
Owner and Editor-in-Chief: Kier-La Janisse

Kier-La Janisse is a film programmer for Fantastic Fest and SF Indie, the founder of The Miskatonic Institute of Horror Studies and Owner/Editor-in-Chief of Spectacular Optical. She has been a programmer for the Alamo Drafthouse Cinema in Austin, Texas, co-founded Montreal microcinema Blue Sunshine, founded the CineMuerte Horror Film Festival in Vancouver (1999-2005) and was the subject of the documentary Celluloid Horror (2005). She has written for Filmmaker, Shindig!, Incite: Journal of Experimental Media, Rue Morgue and Fangoria magazines, has contributed to The Scarecrow Movie Guide (Sasquatch Books, 2004) and Destroy All Movies!! A Complete Guide to Punk on Film (Fantagraphics, 2011), and is the author of A Violent Professional: The Films of Luciano Rossi (FAB Press, 2007) and House of Psychotic Women: An Autobiographical Topography of Female Neurosis in Horror and Exploitation Films (FAB Press, 2012). She is currently working on the book A Song From the Heart Beats the Devil Every Time about children’s programming in the counterculture era.

Managing Editor: Paul Corupe
www.paulcorupe.com

Since 1999 Paul Corupe has shared his passion for Canada’s film history at Canuxploitation.com, a site recognized as the essential source for uncovering the forgotten films of Canada’s past. He regularly writes about genre film and Canadian cinema in publications including Rue Morgue magazine. and documentaries including Bravo’s On Screen! television series.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can’t contribute financially doesn’t mean you can’t help! It would be a great help just to post a link to our campaign on Facebook, Twitter and/or other social media, and encourage others to share the link too!

Regular Edition

Collector’s Set (limited to 25, comes with compilation CD, JACOB

Aside
from these pre-sale packages, we also have many additional perks ranging from
movie tickets to original artwork, care of our campaign sponsors Drafthouse Films, Fantastic Fest, The Fantasia International Film Festival, MONDO, Trash Palace, CineFamily, FAB Press, The Black Museum and animator/illustrator Leslie Supnet. Check out the detailed perk levels in the right-hand column! The Impact
"Having been fortunate enough to work alongside Kier-La at multiple events, I could not be more convinced that she's one of the most knowledgeable, creative and insightful voices in the world of genre 
film today. She doesn't just know her shit, she knows how to help other people know her shit, too, in the most entertaining way possible."- Todd Brown, Founder and Editor-in-chief, Twitch / Acquisitions, XYZ Films
This may be the first book I’m publishing under my
own imprint, but it’s far from the first project I’ve managed at this scale.
I’ve founded and operated film festivals (CineMuerte Film Festival, Vancouver)
and independent micro-cinemas (the Blue Sunshine Psychotronic Film Centre,
Montreal), and have also coordinated a number of film commission projects and
live performances. Even the skills I learned running a fanzine back in the ‘90s
have proven useful on this project! But aside from whatever skills, experience
and connections we bring to the table (you can read our full bios below), we’ve
also been mentored all along the way by the British cult film publisher FAB
Press - so we have some good people on our side making sure we don’t fall. 
KID POWER! will be published even if we don’t meet
our goal—the book is completely written and copy-edited, contracts have been
signed, photographs have been sourced and the book is being laid out. We’re
well on our way! 
This funding challenge not only allows you to
pre-order a limited edition copy of KID POWER!, it’s also intended to help make
the book as awesome as we know it can be—a heavily-illustrated, full colour edition
with a beautiful cover. If we don’t meet our goal, we will still print the
book, but it will be in black & white, with less frills. And we’re hoping
that our debut can represent the best we have to offer, which will lead to the
kind of word of mouth that will allow us to continue Spectacular Optical. Success
with selling this first book will go a long way in ensuring a stable foundation
for our next book. 
Who we are:Owner and Editor-in-Chief: Kier-La Janisse
Kier-La
Janisse is a film programmer for Fantastic Fest and SF Indie, the founder of The Miskatonic Institute of Horror Studies and
Owner/Editor-in-Chief of Spectacular Optical. She has been a programmer for the
Alamo Drafthouse Cinema in Austin, Texas, co-founded Montreal microcinema Blue
Sunshine, founded the CineMuerte Horror Film Festival in Vancouver (1999-2005)
and was the subject of the documentary Celluloid Horror (2005). She has
written for Filmmaker, Shindig!, Incite: Journal of Experimental Media, Rue
Morgue and Fangoria magazines, has contributed to The Scarecrow
Movie Guide (Sasquatch Books, 2004) and Destroy All Movies!! A Complete
Guide to Punk on Film (Fantagraphics, 2011), and is the author of A Violent
Professional: The Films of Luciano Rossi (FAB Press, 2007) and
House of Psychotic Women: An Autobiographical Topography of Female Neurosis in
Horror and Exploitation Films (FAB Press, 2012). She is currently working
on the book A Song From the Heart Beats the Devil Every Time about
children’s programming in the counterculture era.
Managing
Editor: Paul Corupewww.paulcorupe.com
Since
1999 Paul Corupe has shared his passion for Canada’s film history at Canuxploitation.com, a site recognized as the essential source
for uncovering the forgotten films of Canada’s past. He regularly writes about
genre film and Canadian cinema in publications including Rue Morgue
magazine. and documentaries including Bravo’s On Screen! television series.Other Ways You Can Help
Just because you can’t contribute financially doesn’t
mean you can’t help! It would be a great help just to post a link to our
campaign on Facebook, Twitter and/or other social media, and encourage others
to share the link too!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Taylor Evans, and I am a senior in high school. When I was 12 years old, I decided I wanted to write and publish a book. Five years and 78,000 words later, I'm proud to say that I've accomplished part of my goal. I have learned over the years that we owe it to ourselves to see our goals to their completion, and now I need your help. Support me and my dream and help me publish my book. (Scroll to the bottom to read an excerpt!)

What We Need & What You Get

In order to get my book published I need:

  • Copy editing, cover design, conversion to print and eBook formats, International Standard Book Number (ISBN), publication coordination, and distribution which will cost over $3,000.
  • I am also trying to get 100 supporters for my book, in addition to my monetary goal!
For those early supporters who help me get my book launched, there are perks:

  • limited edition "The Unknown" bookmark

  • your purchased book will be autographed

  • a portion of pledged amount will be credited towards purchase of my book

  • large pledges will receive a limited edition "The Unknown" bookmark and a FREE autographed copy of my book

The Impact

For the past four years I have traveled to local school districts to try to spark a passion for reading and writing in middle school students. This age group is near and dear to my heart because it was the age I decided to write a book. By publishing my book, I hope to show all the kids to whom I have spoken over the years that with hard work and determination, any dream can become a reality.

Check out the links below to learn more about my reading and writing presentations around my community:

https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?v=10150819609803797

http://www.wlwt.com/Teenage-Author-Encourages-Kids-To-Write/14550400#!9IMFN

Risks & Challenges

Over the past two years I have been learning to navigate the publishing industry. I have contacted hundreds of literary agents, publishers, editors, and other authors in order to gain insight and create a road map to publish my book. Getting a book published has proven to be a difficult task, since the industry is extremely competitive. Despite this, I have received several offers to publish my book and now only lack the necessary funding to launch it.

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand that pledging money is not a possibility for everyone, but that doesn't mean you can’t help. The best thing I can ask of anyone is to SPREAD THE WORD!


"The Unknown" Excerpt:

Prologue

     Layna faced the woman that could destroy her life and everything she held dear, and yet she was oddly calm.  Layna came here knowing the outcome, what would happen, what would have to happen.  She had accepted this inevitable fact months ago.  Amidst countless nights of crying, she realized she only ever had one choice.

     Azlaya appraised the woman whose blond hair spilled over her shoulders, taking mental notice of this strangely compliant Layna.  “You know that sooner or later Iwill get them.  You can’t keep them from me forever,” she paused, “And you know that.”

     Azlaya’s words gnawed at Layna.  “They don’t need forever,” Layna whispered to herself more than to the tall, pale woman.  Layna lowered her gaze and stole a glance back the way she had come.  Back there lay her life and where she was lay her impending death.

     Suddenly Layna felt a sharp stab in her stomach where Azlaya had hurled a spell at her.  Layna doubled over when she was hit again, and her knees collapsed.  She would not raise a hand to protect herself, would not utter a counter spell, or fight back.  She was gasping and on her knees as Azlaya’s hands stayed raised in anticipation to throw another spell at the crumpled woman unwilling to save herself.

    “Oh, Layna,” Azlaya said slowly as if discovering she had done something unforgivable.  “You are the greatest sorceress in Alagia, are you not?  Rise, defend your name, your title,” Azlaya taunted.  Layna painstakingly rose.  The two were only a few feet apart, but the subjects of their confrontation were worlds away.

     “Where have you hidden them?” Azlaya said through clenched teeth.

     Still breathing hard, Layna responded as Azlaya inched closer to her.  “You think that my fear for you will make me tell you where they are…,” Layna stopped to catch her breath, “but you’re wrong.  I love them so much more than I fear you.”

     A snarl ripped across Azlaya’s lips at Layna’s insult.  Layna had her back to the jagged cliffs that lined the ocean below.  Azlaya locked eyes with Layna, but found no challenge, only compliance.  Azlaya would never forget seeing the defeat in Layna’s eyes before the final curse cast her over the edge.

     Numbness set over Azlaya, the strange sensation one feels after accomplishing a goal and realizing a sudden emptiness.  Then the sounds of battle ended her reverie and revealed her new goal, her ultimate goal.  One which kept her vehement quest to control this land alive, one that depended on what Layna Coles had died protecting.

     “I will find your daughters,” Azlaya whispered and returned to battle.

story:
"Beasts of the Southern Wild", the movie that I wrote with my friend and director Benh Zeitlin, based on my play, "Juicy and Delicious", is an Official Selection at Cannes Film Festival.  I am tremendously proud of it--it's a very personal story, and writing it and then watching it come to life was nothing short of tranforming.  It's also been incredible to watch audience response to it.  I spent five years altogether working on this story, and I couldn't ask for a better ending.  Or beginning!  

As far as what I'm trying to raise, and why doing it quickly--

A round trip ticket is $1544,

I've raise $875 and have housing, which is great (the most expensive part is covered!)

So I'm raising the difference ($669) as quickly as possible so that I can buy my ticket as soon as screening times are announced.

Being at Cannes would be a dream come true, personally and professionally.  (Charlie Kaufman is teaching a masterclass!  PT Anderson's new Scientology movie!  And Quevenzhene Wallis on the RED CARPET!!!!)  

So I would appreciate, from the bottom of my heart, any help you'd be able to give.  

 Thanks so much, and I can't wait to show you "Beasts of the Southern Wild" on June 27!

 

With love and gratitude,
Lucy

story:
The riots in Little India on the 8th of December will come to be a definitive moment in the history of our country.


As the shock and outrage wears off, the critical question to be asking is not how to deal with the rioters but why did they riot.


Treating this as an isolated incident misses the mark by a wide margin; this is not an incident that can be attributed to circumstantial factors of the evening of the 8th, but rather a whole spectrum of underlying issues that we must consider collectively.


These men are housed in dormitories or on-site facilities that are barely livable, they are paid a wage which would not be considered fair by any standard of living, the hours they work and the labour they perform are feats of incredible physical strength - but yet, despite all of the hardship they endure to build and maintain this country, we barely acknowledge their existence.


This is a campaign for equality - the darkest night in Singaporean history can be turned into something positive, but we need your help - together we can stand up to the hate and the vitriol that has spewed forth in the aftermath of this incident.


If we do not take a stand we lose the opportunity to dictate the path of our country - the vocal minority are baying for blood, they want to toss all these workers out, they want more restrictions, more policing and in general to just make the lives of these men more miserable than it already is.


Share this page, stop the hatred, stand up for what you believe in. We watch them warily, suspicious of their every move, openly avoiding them, criticising them, they are human too, with feelings and hopes and dreams - lets treat them with respect and dignity.



What We Need & What You Get


Your funds will be used to:

- Help raise awareness of the conditions that they and other similar migrant workers live in and raise living standards across the board.


- Help the family of the deceased (Mr Sakthieval Kumaravelu who leaves behind a mother and young brother)


We reached out to social workers who have experience in these matters - special thanks to Ms Shelley Thio, Mr Jolovan Wham, Mr Vincent Wijeysingha for their advice and for agreeing to assist in the transfer of funds to the family.


*Please click on the appropriate ‘reward’ box if you want to specify your funds for the family or for raising awareness. 


The money raised will be allocated according to the option you have selected in the rewards column. A general contribution without a specific selection will be allocated on a 60/40 basis (60% to family | 40% to awareness)


The specific breakdown is further down the page.


For all donors, your name will be added to a list – on this page - of people who believe in the ideals of Singapore and what we stand for.


Who are we?

We are a group of young Singaporeans who believe strongly that the future of our country relies on a bedrock of mutual understanding, compassion and equality.


Specific details on how the money will be disbursed:


To ensure transparency and full accountability of all parties involved, all funds received will be held with an escrow agent prior to being remitted to the intended beneficiaries.


At this point we estimate that the family will need at least $30,000 - social workers have managed to get in touch with the family as well as the NGO - Meetppu, based in India and will establish a trust to disburse the money to the family.


*The number of $30,000USD is based on the following estimation.

Monthly remittance of $250USD for 12 months = $3,000

10 years of remittances at $3,000 per year = $30,000


The remainder of the funds will go to helping the Singapore based NGOs HOME and TWC2 in their efforts to raise awareness of the plight of migrant workers.

Donors:

Richard Sim

Kian Tay

Cody Liew

Rachel Liew

Gus Ho

Yun Zhou

Jimmy Siow

Amy Lauschke

Chew Peng Ee

Paul Tambyah

Nithya

Caroline Gordon

Suresh Shankar

Cecilia Tan

Biddy

story:
In September 2012 the first ever book on guitar legend Yngwie Malmsteen was published in Sweden. The author was well known music journalist Anders Tengner. Reviews have been excellent.
 
The book is unauthorized, i.e. Yngwie and his management does not approve, but gives a very real and close picture of the raging guitar players life. It is a story about extreme passion and determination, and the sacrifices needed to be made to achieve your dream. The price has been high, both for Yngwie himself and for those close to him.
 
The book is based around 50 interviews made with people who, during different periods of Yngwies life, have been really close to Yngwie. Here are some of the interviewed people:
 
  • Joe Lynn Turner - Ex-Rainbow singer and co-writer of Odyssey
  • Graham Bonnet - Founder of Alcatrazz and ex-Rainbow singer
  • Tallee Savage - Yngwies first girlfriend who moved to LA with him
  • Mike Varney - Founder of Shrapnel Records and the first to recognize Yngwie in Guitar Player's Spotlight
  • Eric Singer - Kiss drummer
  • Amber Dawn Landin - Yngwies second wife
  • Peter Rooth - Guitar tech and friend. Was in the car crash with Yngwie in 1987
  • Jeff Scott Soto - Legendary Rising Force singer
  • Mats Olausson - Keyboard player
  • Greta Nelson - Girl friend
  • Jim Lewis - Long time manager
and more ...
 
Anders Tengner is by far the most celebrated music journalist in Sweden. A Swedish Neil Strauss or Mick Wall if you will. Starting as a writer at music mag Okej in the 80's, he soon got the opportunity to work with his own TV shows. If you didn't know Anders, there was no way you were gonna sell your music in Sweden. Literally every rock star stopped for an interview, a friendly chat and a photo shoot. In his successfull biographical memoir of these crazy times, Access all areas - My life with the giants of rock, he tells the story of his encounters with the metal elite. Access ... has sold more than 35 000 copies. Still today Anders keeps in contact with some of the icons, such as Ian Gillan of Deep Purple and shock rocker Alice Cooper to name a few. 
 
The story is like a Hollywood movie and could very well end up on the screen.

story_txt:
In September 2012 the first ever book on guitar legend Yngwie Malmsteen was published in Sweden. The author was well known music journalist Anders Tengner. Reviews have been excellent.
 
The book is unauthorized, i.e. Yngwie and his management does not approve, but gives a very real and close picture of the raging guitar players life. It is a story about extreme passion and determination, and the sacrifices needed to be made to achieve your dream. The price has been high, both for Yngwie himself and for those close to him.
 
The book is based around 50 interviews made with people who, during different periods of Yngwies life, have been really close to Yngwie. Here are some of the interviewed people:
 


Joe Lynn Turner - Ex-Rainbow singer and co-writer of Odyssey

Graham Bonnet - Founder of Alcatrazz and ex-Rainbow singer



Tallee Savage - Yngwies first girlfriend who moved to LA with him
Mike Varney - Founder of Shrapnel Records and the first to recognize Yngwie in Guitar Player's Spotlight
Eric Singer - Kiss drummer
Amber Dawn Landin - Yngwies second wife
Peter Rooth - Guitar tech and friend. Was in the car crash with Yngwie in 1987
Jeff Scott Soto - Legendary Rising Force singer
Mats Olausson - Keyboard player
Greta Nelson - Girl friend
Jim Lewis - Long time manager
and more ...
 
Anders Tengner is by far the most celebrated music journalist in Sweden. A Swedish Neil Strauss or Mick Wall if you will. Starting as a writer at music mag Okej in the 80's, he soon got the opportunity to work with his own TV shows. If you didn't know Anders, there was no way you were gonna sell your music in Sweden. Literally every rock star stopped for an interview, a friendly chat and a photo shoot. In his successfull biographical memoir of these crazy times, Access all areas - My life with the giants of rock, he tells the story of his encounters with the metal elite. Access ... has sold more than 35 000 copies. Still today Anders keeps in contact with some of the icons, such as Ian Gillan of Deep Purple and shock rocker Alice Cooper to name a few. 
 
The story is like a Hollywood movie and could very well end up on the screen.
 
The translation has already started, but your contribution will help us get there faster AND you will be able to get a copy of the book before everybody else!

story:
My name is Talmon Firestone and I have been selected to represent Canada at the Maccabiah Games in the sport of Tae Kwon Do. Over the past 18 years, as a practitioner, coach and instructor, this sport has become a part of my soul and I'm honoured to have the opportunity to represent Canada at this prestigious international event.

Every four years, talented Jewish athletes from all over the world meet in Israel for The Maccabiah Games and display courage, determination, sportsmanship.

I am honored and excited to have qualified and have been chosen to represent Canada at the 19th Maccabiah Games, July 2013. At the Maccabiah Games, "The Jewish Olympics", athletes compete in over 40 different sports. I will be part of a world delegation of more than 8,000 athletes. Our Canadian team will be composed of over 600 athletes, coaches, medical and support staff. The Maccabiah is the 3rd largest sporting event in the world and is the most significant social tradition of the Jewish people in recent generations.

Maccabi Canada is a volunteer based national registered amateur sports organization that strives to promote athletic, cultural and educational programs.

There is no feeling like the one an athlete experiences, playing to represent their country. The opportunity to compete against the best Jewish athletes in the world, meet lifelong friends and experience growth from the fine athletes of today into the leaders of tomorrow.

The cost of going to the games is high and covers my airfare, accommodation, medical care, insurance, team uniform, and other expenses.

Please support my journey of proudly representing Canada by donating to Maccabi Canada in my honour. Any amount will assist me in obtaining my goal, your generosity is greatly appreciated.

Maccabi Canada is a registered non-profit organization and all donators will receive an immediate tax receipt for 100% of the amount donated.

To donate to Maccabi Canada in my honour, please follow the bellow URL:

http://tinyurl.com/opd8o3v

Sincerely,
Talmon Firestone
Heavy Weight Competitor

story:
When the Fates deliver the witch into his hands, the warlock knows only one thing. She is his mate - the one witch he is fated to love for all eternity. The devil spell that binds her has stolen everything - even her voice and her very name. To free her, the warlock must do the unthinkable. He must kill the woman he loves.

When the witch wakes in an unfamiliar bed, safe for the first time in years, she must learn how to trust again. The warlock with the face of a dark angel wants nothing from her save her happiness. But he is hiding something - a secret that will give her the strength to finally allow her to fulfill her destiny.

By the Fates, Freed

Witches and Humans and Devils are all locked in a struggle for the future of the world. Devil magic has the power to destroy everything that Witches and Humans have worked to protect for thousands of years. 

Lovers of paranormal romance will swoon over Raven, the handsome warlock who rescues the tortured witch and protects her from harm. Fans of strong, confident women characters will embrace Ealasaid, the powerful witch who holds the key to the future. Action, adventure, true love... By the Fates, Freed has it all. 

Coming soon to an e-book retailer near you!

My editor is now doing a deep developmental edit that looks at word choice, plot tweaks, and character development. This edit is $1200. Copy editing is another $300. This campaign will help fund the editing needed to polish the novel thoroughly. 

The Perks!

Backers of this campaign can look forward to the following:

  • For only $5, you receive a copy of the novel in whatever ebook format you'd like (Kindle, Nook, PDF, etc)
  • For any amount, you receive a personal thank you in the acknowledgements for the book

 

Update: If this campaign reaches $1100, I will send all backers a bonus scene (a good, steamy bonus scene) that takes place between Book 1 and Book 2. 

For a preview of the 1st scene, see http://www.pdeddy.com/a-sneak-peak/

Stretch goals:

At $1750, I will postpone work on the post-apocalyptic novella I'm currently working on and move right to the sequel to By the Fates, Freed. 

At $2000 I will sell hard copies of By the Fates, Freed on Amazon as well as digital copies.

**ANY AMOUNT CAN HELP! EVEN $1. IF ALL OF MY TWITTER FOLLOWERS DONATED $1, RETWEETED THE CAMPAIGN, AND HALF OF THEIR TWITTER FOLLOWERS DONATED $1, THE CAMPAIGN WOULD BE SUCCESSFUL!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute but still want to help, you can share this campaign with friends. Tweet about it, share it on Facebook, point people to my blog (http://www.pdeddy.com). All of it, any of it. Help me realize my dream of self-publishing a successful novel.

story:
Welcome to Deep Darkness!

Giant alien creatures, colossal space battles, ancient derelict starships, the survival of humanity all wrapped in a character driven story spanning over a decade... 

What is Deep Darkness?

 Deep Darkness is a new science fiction/horror property/book that takes place 30,000 years from now. It follows a man named Sev from his childhood on the alien planet Errikus to his life living and surviving aboard the starship Erebus. Humans are at war and on the run from an alien race called the Skrav heading to a place called the void. Deep Darkness doesn't just take place all in the future though. There is an element called the nexus onboard the ship that allows users like Sev to see the past, present, and future through someone else's eyes. This allows me to tell some amazing stories taking place in the not so distant future and the past. Parts of Deep Darkness are even based on real accounts from World War 2 veterans that I have had the privelage to talk to.  

The book itself is about 31 chapters and close to 100,000 words.

WHAT THE FUNDING IS FOR:

  • Printing and publishing of the first edition of Deep Darkness
  • Manuscript preparation and formatting 
  • Copy editing and proofreading
  • Interior design and cover design
  • Delivery of books
  • E-Conversion
  • Official website
  • Concept trailer/ short film

When you fund this campaign you are not just funding a book being made. You are showing there is a demand for new original science fiction. You are helping us create a living world full of artwork, 3D models, props and more. If this campaign is successfully funded we will be creating a concept trailer/short film (that we plan to run about 10-15 minutes). 

In the concept trailer we are planning to show:

• A short scene from the book that will have a sci-fi/horror vibe.

• A view of the alien colony Errikus along with the Erebus and other alien   starships created by professional 3D artists

• Heavy use of Prosthetics and props for monsters. 

• Sci-Fi looking body armor/props (for a $500 pledge you can own)

• A personal-character driven story set in the future that is scary and unknown. 

• That we can create a big budget looking film without a hollywood size budget.

We already have mics, cameras, and lights but for this to be a success we need to be sure that we can launch the book and cover any lingering costs. This means that this campaign has to be a success. 

This can only be accomplished with your help.

DEEP DARKNESS

   

 

Summary

Mankind is endangered. The Skrav have destroyed our sun and sent us into the depths of space. On the run our only hope lies in a place called the void. A place foretold by the nexus, an element that lets us see past, present, and future. Everywhere we go destruction follows. We have been running for 30,000 years. 

The war with the Skrav has been at a standstill for years now. Humans have settled on the colony Errikus, an alien colony and last stop before the empty space between the spirals in the milky way galaxy. Sev was born on this world but he wasn't made for it. His lungs aren't use to the open air, his eyes can't tolerate the natural light, and his mind is meant to be somewhere else. By age twelve the starship Erebus and Aelita leave with the last of mankind aboard.

Sev is a user. His life consists of living on the starship Erebus. Day in and day out he watches through the eyes of people who have died. People who haven't been born. It is through his eyes, his words, his actions this war will come to an end. Will he bring mankind to the end of our journey or will he be our fall. 

MONSTERS OF DEEP DARKNESS POSTER

This is one of the many 11x17 posters you can get when you donate $15 or more. 

 


Deep Darkness is full of different creatures. Some genetically altered others more exotic. 

SKRAV CONCEPT ART

 

The Skrav are an alien race at war with humans for reasons unknown to us. Ever since they destroyed our sun they have been hunting any surviving humans in the galaxy. They are bipedal. Their skin looks like tree bark. They speak no langauge we can understand. They have enslaved or destroyed hundreds of other races in the galaxy and are feared almost as much as man, the only species ever to fight them back.  

 

Human Armor 

Deep Darkness includes many hard science fiction elements. Technology based on ideas coming to life today from spacesuits and weapons to organic compunds and DNA being used to process and store information.  

Joesph Everett

Not every story in Deep Darkness takes place in the future. Some of chapters show Sev using the Nexus and seeing through the eyes of a soldier from World War 2. Parts of these chapters are based on real interviews and accounts taken by veterans (a combination of real battles and fictional ones). 

 

PERKS

 

*At the end of the campaign we will message you asking what tshirt/posters you want. 

Who Am I Exactly?

My name is Stephen Landry, I was born in Nashville, Tennessee. I have a Bachelors degree in graphic design. I have had the privelage of working with some great startup companies, indie game studios, and indie film studios creating exciting projects. I have spent the last year stuggling as a freelance graphic designer while also being able to work with up and coming authors in fantasy, science fiction, and horror designing book covers, creating character art, and even helping some of them develop their stories. Aside from my graphic design I also am an amateur film director. I have created two award winning short films in the Nashville area.

I have suffered from depression and anxiety my whole life. Science fiction has always been a great escape for me. This is my way of taking my life and giving back not just for myself but for others like me seeking new worlds to help them surivive the day in and day out. It has taken me a long time to get to a comfortable point posting this and releasing this much to the world. I am nervous, afraid, scared but I am not going to let it get the best of me.

My ultimate goal is to release the book and pitch this for a full length science fiction film. It all begins here with your help. 

Impact

When this project gets funded a half dozen artists will have their work showcased inside the book. The book will also feature some excerpts from some other excellent writers.In less than six months we'll have a trailer and we'll be launching Deep Darkness as a new original science fiction property. After this is a success we have plans for a film, graphic novel, and future novels. 

We are redefining the way science fiction is made. 

WHEN this book is a success and adapted into a film all contributors will be listed in the CREDITS. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute no worries, I hope you will share this page with your friends/family anyone you think might be interested. I am also always looking for more artists to contribue and/or beta readers. 

Spread the word.

Enjoy the book. 

 

Links

My Graphic Design Website: http://stephen_landry.prosite.com/

Facebook:http://www.facebook.com/NexusSCIFI

story:
Short Summary

During my many years teaching in the inner-city, I have had many memorable students. Some I remember were good students, some behavior problems, some courageous, and others were heartbreaking. I learned many lessons from these students and would like to be able to share my memories, outlook, and the way music had played a part in my teaching throughout the years. I feel I have a lot to offer the world. As my editor said, "All educators should read that book! It's very moving, and your 37 years of teaching experience is priceless." Even if you are not in the education field, you will be moved by the stories I share. You can make my retirement  dream come true by contributing!

What We Need & What You Get

$1000 of the  funds will be used to publish my book in print and ebook format. The rest of the funds will be used to help me publicise the book and send out the perks. Any funds over the $1700 will be applied to the publishing of my next book, which is about half-written at this point.

Speaking of perks, some of them are really cool!

Depending on your level of contribution, you could receive a handwritten thank-you, an mp3 of my class singing an original song, a signed copy of the book,  acknowledgement in the book, an mp3 of my reading a chapter, or a 30 minute teaching consultation/interview via Skype. 

The Impact

Being able to publish this book will allow me to introduce the world to life inside an inner-city school. You will laugh, cry, and feel pride and puzzlement  as you read about the school lives and lessons of memorable students. I hope to have an impact on future teachers by sharing my experiences in my classroom.

Other Ways You Can Help

The economy what it is these days, you may not be able to contribute, but you can still help me by telling friends, family, Twitter followers and Facebook friends about the book and this campaign.

story:
To those who know her, Mia Ozu is a nice, yet often distant business owner whose greatest flaw might be the fact that she'd rather prune her precious Bonzai than participate in a conversation.

What they don't know, is that Mia is harboring a deadly secret. Motivated by the vicious murder of her parents, she's spent a lifetime exacting revenge on anyone involved until one day, one murder spawns a chain of events that alters everything she thought she knew about her life.

 

 

Bonjour and welcome to my project, a fundraiser to self-publish my debut novel, The Irony of Vengeance. Your prayers and support are appreciated. 

NOTE: This project will NOT be funded unless I reach my goal so please, help a sista out, haha!

 

Here's what I need:

 

It has always been my dream to have at least one of the many books in my head published! True, I could go the route of sending my manuscript to traditional publishing companies, but it would mean so much more for me to do this myself by forming my own publishing company. I'd also like to take what I learn in this process to publish other writers.   

To make this dream a reality, I'm asking for your help! Your contributions will make this project a success by funding:

  • Formation of publishing company (LLC)
  • Proofreading/Editing
  • Cover design and inner layout formatting
  • Website creation
  • Professional printing of novel
  • Perks fulfillment
  • Marketing
  • Indiegogo fee

 

 

Wait a minute...your name isn't Valeri!

For those of you who know me personally, it's very astute of you to recognize that fact! For me, writing is something I adore and while I'd love to be as successful as say, J.K. Rowling, I'd rather not have my given name become a brand. So, instead, I chose something super cute (don't you think) that's a portion of my name but not really, ha! ha!

 

Umm, isn't that the cover on that picture up there?

I wish!!! That's just a little something I put together as a representation of the book (to reiterate, that image does not belong to me). The cover art and graphics for the bookmarks/postcards aren't completed, but I do have some samples (below) of the style/quality you can expect. Also, just to say, The Irony of Vengeance is NOT a graphic novel...yet!!! I just love Anime and I thought it would be cool to have the characters created in that way. Shout-out (yes, people still say that) to my designer RiamAzariel <<click to contact or for more samples of her work.  

NOTE: These are only samples of the artists work and are NOT my characters. Please do not copy/use these without her permission! 

 

Hey, what does that necklace look like?


Glad you asked! Below is a pic of the beautiful crescent moon necklace you'll receive for your donation of $75. **Please note that this jewelry is handmade. This results in a unique and one of a kind necklace that is made just for you!**

 

So...how long do I have to wait for all these yummy goodies???

Once the goal has been reached (thank you in advance!), I estimate that it will take around 5-8 weeks to have everything ready for shipment. The plan is to have everything shipped out by the end of April, but as I know there may be challenges (below), I listed a May date, at the latest.

 I will be sending weekly updates to let you know how things are going and in the event that something seems to be taking longer than expected, I will relay that information as well.

 

CHALLENGES

I don't anticipate many obstacles once the ball starts rolling, but one can never tell. At this point, the novel has one more round of editing to undergo. Once that's finished, it will probably take around 2 weeks to make the adjustments. If this project is fully funded, I expect it to take 5-8 weeks to complete production. Of course, if funding isn't reached, the process will take longer. If there are any issues, I will update everyone accordingly and probably add some additional goodies for the wait!

To those who know her, Mia Ozu is a nice, yet often distant business owner whose greatest flaw might be the fact that she'd rather prune her precious Bonzai than participate in a conversation.
What they don't know, is that Mia is harboring a deadly secret. Motivated by the vicious murder of her parents, she's spent a lifetime exacting revenge on anyone involved until one day, one murder spawns a chain of events that alters everything she thought she knew about her life.
 
 
Bonjour and welcome to my project, a fundraiser to self-publish my debut novel, The Irony of Vengeance. Your prayers and support are appreciated. 
NOTE: This project will NOT be funded unless I reach my goal so please, help a sista out, haha!
 
Here's what I need:
 
It has always been my dream to have at least one of the many books in my head published! True, I could go the route of sending my manuscript to traditional publishing companies, but it would mean so much more for me to do this myself by forming my own publishing company. I'd also like to take what I learn in this process to publish other writers.   
To make this dream a reality, I'm asking for your help! Your contributions will make this project a success by funding:

Formation of publishing company (LLC)
Proofreading/Editing
Cover design and inner layout formatting
Website creation
Professional printing of novel
Perks fulfillment
Marketing
Indiegogo fee
 
 
Wait a minute...your name isn't Valeri!
For those of you who know me personally, it's very astute of you to recognize that fact! For me, writing is something I adore and while I'd love to be as successful as say, J.K. Rowling, I'd rather not have my given name become a brand. So, instead, I chose something super cute (don't you think) that's a portion of my name but not really, ha! ha!
 
Umm, isn't that the cover on that picture up there?
I wish!!! What We Need & What You Get

Our last book in this series was 'Your Immune System and You'

Our readers say...

"The author takes a complex subject and makes it fun and easy to comprehend"
 
"This book gives more value than what it costs"
 
"I recommend this book to you if you want to learn about the immune system in a quick and interesting way"
 
"The book is clearly written, easy to read and not full of jargon and it did provide food for thought"
 
"This book gets to the heart of matter without fluffy needless monologue"
 
"The best part, which I have touted for many years, is "Be a bit dirty"

"I'd recommend this book to anyone wanting some insight into the immune system particularly those with ailments illnesses and young and old relatives that want to boost immunity"
 
"I liked that it covered the immune system and cancer, and transplants and more"
 
"It is very useful and I would recommend it to everyone, not just that who has health issues but everyone"

story:
In A Nutshell:

Your sponsorship and support will enable me to pay an editor to work with me and finish my most recent book.

It seems the immediate assumption is this book is religious or spiritual?

The aim of the book is to dispel religious and spiritual messages of previous centuries and to dismantle the new religion of this century, science and attempt to uncover what's true.

I imagine that everything about this book / campaign will threaten your sense of identity. I invite you to step beyond fear to discover what's possible.

This is all about losing "you" and breaking free.

Some say "you are what you are seeking" - but frankly that's a lie.

Seeking happens because the sense of self has been misidentified!

Why do we seek?

You can never satisfy that itch, because what you cannot see is "what you believe to be you is that which you think that you have lost".

The mind will not want to give up this sense of "I" easily, it protects itself because it thinks it is you.

Life is beyond that. Life is everything and life is nothing - all at once, life is a paradox.

At about sixteen minutes past six on the tenth of december, two thousand and eleven… I contacted my guru to say "okay the penny dropped while driving".

What I have learned from thirty years of seeking is that seeking itself is a pointer to who you are not. My guru showed me one direct path. This book is about another.

This book tears apart all of reality and invites you to peer through the cracks at who you really are.

Something for you:

Snails In Hyperspace (PDF)

I promise to send everyone who contributes or donates a PDF version of the short / introductory/ outline version of the book which is currently available on Amazon Kindle as a thank you.

I asked my friend Emeli to help me with my marketing. I have included my original pitch for those of you who want more information.

There is also more than one video related to this project on my YouTube channel. 

I am deeply grateful for your contribution/ donation towards this project/ work.

With thanks,

Mark Ty-Wharton.

Emeli's marketing pitch:

Hello I am Mark Ty-Wharton and I am a writer. I am diagnosed with Asperger Syndrome (a high functioning form of Autism).

I have studied spirituality, enlightenment and personal development for over 30 years. In this, my latest book I have been able to bring together answers to some of our deepest questions about ‘who am I?’ and ‘why am I here?’ in a new, unique and yet incredibly simple way.

I would love the ideas in this book to be available to as many people as possible because they may just be able to transform the way you think about yourself and your life in a profoundly significant way.

If you have ever wondered what was the point to anything - really, then this is the book for you.

Written in an engaging, irreverent and downright hilarious way this book gives you the answers that no other will.

As a result of my finally experiencing a peace of mind and sense of belonging in the world I can now share that experience with you.

I really need your donation to get my book professionally edited so that you can read it.  

Profits from the finished book will be invested to help fund other projects by people with Autism.

I will be hugely grateful for all donations and if you believe in karma you know you will be eternally rewarded!

 Before now I was always fighting against life. Looking for my own Individual answers. Living in a world that was all about me. An isolated prison of “Markness.”

This book and this entire campaign is actually about moving away from such an insular way of being into a world that embraces togetherness. A world where we can all help each other. And most especially a world where we can all help each other to express our greatest passions and play to our greatest strengths.

Writing this book has seen the end of my eternal seeking. It has resulted in a peace of mind, body and spirit that I would love to share with you.

Wouldn’t it be wonderful to live in a world like this?

Please help me get this book published. Be a part of this phenomenal ride. Check out the perks. Read the book.

See you on the other side of the looking glass.

www.likebeing.com

My original pitch:

Synopsis:

Who am I?

For the sake of conversation, my name is Mark Ty-Wharton (aka Mark Tinley), I am a 49 year old writer diagnosed with asperger syndrome. This will be my third published book. 

As a part of universal source energy, that which makes us all whole and complete, I am reqeusting your help to take my individual expression of writing to a new level; by paying for a professional book editor to work with me to finalise an existing manuscript for publication. Remaining funds will be used for promotion and to raise awareness.

As a person on the autistic spectrum, I see the world in a different way. I have been told my ideas can be of profound significance.

This campaign is about making those ideas accessible to as many people as possible.

My book contains a simple message, designed as a new path to lead you the reader to direct spiritual realization. Beyond answering the question "Who Am I" the book explains how you made the error of misidentification of "self" in the first place and sets things straight.

After some thirty years, perhaps more as a spiritual seeker...

After struggling to find a place in life, a purpose...

There is finally peace of mind, a sense of belonging...

This is life and you and I are living it!

The Impact:

What have you done for me lately?

Moving human beings away from an ego based environment to a more holistic environment nurtures a spirit of mutual growth and co-operation.

You can relax knowing that your hard earned donation is in the hands of someone who will use it to ultimately change the world into a better place.

I will treat your donation with the same respect that you would treat the money with yourself> I will put your money to work for your karma and invest it in good will in the same way you would choose to do for yourself.

Never Mind The Buzzcocks: What Do I Get?

What You Will Get When You Contribute:

First and foremost, I promise to send you a PDF copy of the first book in the series which will give you a clear outline of the idea/work. 

Secondly, a pre-requisite of being human, is an intrinsic need to find meaning and purpose in all that we do. One of the most significant ways humanity finds meaning in life is by making genuine contributions towards the wellbeing and growth of others.

One thing that leaves all of us with a sense of joy, is when we empower people less fortunate than ourselves, leaving them in a position where they can move forward with life.

This campaign is not simply about helping one autistic person to write a book.

Revenue from the book will be used to fund other projects designed to help other adults with autism. These projects include a transport archive and museum and various sound art projects.

I am choosing to use crowd sourcing as funding so that I can work with a professional book editor / cover designer and create a single coherent and organised message throughout an entire book.

Why edit at all?

Turning this book into a commercial success will provide funds to enable a number of other philanthropic enterprises to go ahead. 

Why do I need your help?

So where do you fit in?

Until now, I was fighting against life, looking for my own individual answers, inhabiting a me, me, me world, where only Mark mattered.

This campaign is about shifting away from an insular world and embracing a world where people can help one another to get along and express their aptitudes and passions.

Writing this book shares an idea born out of spiritual seeking, a path that a great many people have contributed to and completion acknowledges their contribution.

Who Am I helping?

Your contribution will make a huge difference to a great many more people than just one autistic writer!

This is not a new question to which there are certainly no absolute answers, yet this book, which is based on new evidence, provides unique perspectives and new insights.

This book is a comprehensive guide to something not immediately apparent in the common sense world view of things, yet gives straight no nonsense direct path knowledge to a full recognition of self and access consciousness.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can’t contribute financially, you can spread the word via social networks like FaceBook, Google+ and Twitter using Indiegogo’s share tools.

A good campaign needs duration, frequency and impact.

By mentioning this campaign daily for the next thirty days (till the end of the campaign) you can increase the likelihood people willing to fund the project can come forward and make donations.

Mentioning the campaign frequently is very generous use of your time and I sincerley appreciate your efforts.

Kind regards.

Funding in this campaign is flexible. At the end of the campaign all donations will be used to provide core / seed funding for the book project.


Funds over and above the initial campaign request will be used to kick start other philanthropic projects including but not limited to Transport Autism.

Please do ask questions about any detail should you need clarification.

story:
Who Are We & Why Indiegogo?

Have you read Qwerty Magazine lately? It’s the literary magazine run by the University of New Brunswick’s English Literature and Creative Writing grad students. We look for well-crafted, innovative fiction/non-fiction/poetry/art to grace the pages and the covers of our magazine. Take a look at our most recent covers below.

Initially, Qwerty put out an issue once every academic year, but in recent years we’ve made an effort to increase our readership and gain further recognition on the literary scene by bumping that number up to two. However, that effort is in jeopardy due to a small, unforeseen gap in our funding. 


What We Need & What You Get

If, reading this, you’re thinking, “Aha! That’s where I come in!” you would be right. We are looking to you, our readers, contributors, friends, and much-loved supporters to help us fill the funding gap. We’re not that far off: we’ve got the submissions read, the editors primed, and the copy-editing party scheduled. We only need $900 to get our fall 2013 issue – Q30! – up and running.

Take a look at the side-bar on the right to check out what we’re offering in exchange for contributions. No pressure. Any donation large or very very small helps – we appreciate you taking the time to check out (and maybe even share) our campaign. 

And If You Don't Reach Your Goal?

Rest assured that if we don't meet our goal and get to print Q30 this fall, any money raised will be used for Q30's release in the spring. That way the new Managing Editors can go forward with a 2-issue year next year.

Thanks a Million and Qwerty On!

Love, Your Managing Editors and the Qwerty Team

story:
hi everyone,

i have been accepted to a brilliant two-week residency and workshop at the banff centre. the banff centre is one of canada's premier arts and research facilities, offering a number of innovative residencies and arts programs each year and attracting artists from all over the world. the residency i was awarded is called In(ter)ventions: Literary Practice at the Edge and is designed for writers who work with hybrid formats, new narrative, and experimentation with language. you can check out the official program details here:

http://www.banffcentre.ca/programs/program.aspx?id=1393

did i mention that i WOULD LOVE the opportunity to attend?

as an emerging writer who lacks access to the major channels for representation and craft, working at the banff centre will not only connect me to other artists working in a similar vein, but give me access to critical resources for artistic growth and professionalism. above all, attending this residency means that i will be able to continue putting in serious work on my first book of hybrid poetry, prose, visual treatises and tracts; right now it is a massive work in progress that i would love to share with everyone by the end of this year.

however,

to make this happen, i need to raise $600 in ten days.

how can you help?

while i am the recipient of a generous financial aid package from banff, covering over 85% of my tuition, what i need now are additional funds to cover minor travel expenses, buy a few residency supplies and used winter/snow gear, and pay the remaining balance on my tuition. here's the breakdown:

+ ground transportation (rt) from calgary to banff: $120

+ tuition balance: $250

+ winter gear: $150

+residency supplies: $80

total: $600

why should you help?

although i have been on many adventures in my years, over the past two, i have been blessed with a few particularly pointed opportunities for artistic growth. i have moved from california to oregon, traveled to nigeria to work on a non-fiction film, found success studying a very old and brilliant language, and co-authored a book of poems that i trans/created from spanish to english, a project that required global correspondence and a work that ended up challenging the historical aims of translation itself.

in short, your help is of great import because i am ready to shine.

a  salvo of voices, my first book is currently looking like an out loud mediation on literate illiteracy- so far it includes the kind of stuff you can't really read about or into. i am really blessed to have the time and patience to continue writing and imaging toward its completion.

plus, you'll receive some neat perquisites like broadsides, books, and prints!

(of course every little bit helps. please do not allow the perk tiers to discourage you! i will try to do something sweet for everyone who contributes.)

can't contribute dollars?

no worries- i can't either- that's why i'm running this campaign.
you can definitely still help by tweeting, posting, emailing and linking this page to anyone you think would like to send me to the banff centre next month with warm gear and a lighter financial burden.

thank you kindly,

sidony

experimentation with language. you can check out the official program details
 here: http://www.banffcentre.ca/programs/program.aspx?id=1393did i mention that i WOULD LOVE the opportunity to attend?as an emerging writer who lacks access to the major channels for representation and craft, working at the banff centre will not only connect me to other artists working in a similar vein, but give me access to critical resources for artistic growth and professionalism. above all, attending this residency means that i will be able to continue putting in serious work on my first book of hybrid poetry, prose, visual treatises and tracts; right now it is a massive work in progress that i would love to share with everyone by the end of this year. however, 
to make this happen, i need to raise $600 in ten days.how can you help?while i am the recipient of a generous financial aid package from banff, covering over 85% of my tuition, what i need now are additional funds to cover minor travel expenses, buy a few residency supplies and used winter/snow gear, and pay the remaining balance on my tuition. here's the breakdown:+ ground transportation (rt) from calgary to banff: $120+ tuition balance: $250+ winter gear: $150+residency supplies: $80total: $600why should you help?although i have been on many adventures in my years, over the past two, i have been blessed with a few particularly pointed opportunities for artistic growth. i have moved from california to oregon, traveled to nigeria to work on a non-fiction film, found success studying a very old and brilliant language, and co-authored a book of poems that i trans/created from spanish to english, a project that required global correspondence and a work that ended up challenging the historical aims of translation itself. in short, your help is of great import because i am ready to shine. a  salvo of voices, my first book is currently looking like an out loud mediation on literate illiteracy- so far it includes the kind of stuff you can't really read about or into. i am really blessed to have the time and patience to continue writing and imaging toward its completion.plus, you'll receive some neat perquisites like broadsides, books, and prints!(of course every little bit helps. please do not allow the perk tiers to discourage you! i will try to do something sweet for everyone who contributes.)can't contribute dollars?
no worries- i can't either- that's why i'm running this campaign. you can definitely still help by tweeting, posting, emailing and linking this page to anyone you think would like to send me to the banff centre next month with warm gear and a lighter financial burden. thank you kindly,sidony

story:
Can you help me get my award-winning Jewish thriller seen on major TV Networks?

I'm just $500 shy from getting A and I Publishing to create my book trailer and broadcast it on major US TV stations so that 80,000 to 100,000 TV viewers will see my book trailer.

Once I raise the funds, A and I Publishing will create a TV broadcast-worthy book trailer and air it on major TV stations like MSNBC, the History channel, TNT, A&E, and others.


With each donation, you can get:

  • A never-before released very short prequel Mourner's Kaddish,

  • My award-winning bestseller The Torah Codes,

  • A bestselling anthology 6 Short Stories of Suspense which includes my story "From Above,"

  • Beth's grand prize winning YA fantasy Henrietta the Dragon Slayer,

  • My first album of 8 songs The Strongest Whisper,

  • My second album dedicated to my bride Beth Sacred Seas,


  • My third album with 15 songs Muse Me,


  • And an exclusive Collector's Edition of my yet-to-be-released novel The 36 Righteous (5 copies only)! My mom says, "It's better than The Torah Codes!"


What People Have Been Saying...

Here are some reviews of The Torah Codes:

"FIVE STARS - I wish I could put an additional star on the rating system for this book." - Roseanne Schmidt, Goodreads.com, July 21, 2011

"FIVE STARS - I read this book in one sitting because I could not put it down. Every chapter kept me hooked. Fascinating and smart." - Andrew Christenson, Esq., Amazon.com, July 13, 2011

"FIVE STARS -  Let me put this quite baldly: the question before us is not a fictional one. If The Torah Codes describes a real phenomenon, then we are talking about statistical evidence that the scriptures are indeed supernatural - that is to say, holy, inspired by a force with, at the very least, a god's-eye-view of history. Including, one might presume, future history." - Ien Nivens, Berkshire Fine Arts, May 23, 2011

"FIVE STARS - Nathan is smart, odd, witty, and a bit world-weary. He's a great character to tag along with. The pages seem to turn themselves. But what the book really is, in the end, is a bit of well packaged theology. What truly drives the book is not the cleverness, determination, courage, cowardice, or contrivances of any of the characters. Rather, the book is really about who Nathan and his girlfriend are meant to be. The force behind the book is a strain of Jewish mysticism that allows for coincidence and fate. Underlying it all is the faith that, in spite of everything, God wills us to live in righteousness. In reading the book I learned something new about religious belief, got something to think about, and had a great time in the process." Jonathan Berman, Amazon Customer


Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone can make a donation. If that's the case, who in your world do you know that would be curious about supporting a Jewish award-winning thriller? 

  • Do you have Facebook? Post this message: What if you could help an award-winning thriller novelist change the lives of his readers? http://igg.me/at/JewishDaVinciCode  
  • Do you have Twitter? Tweet this message: Help an award-winning thriller novel change lives. Pls RT! http://igg.me/at/JewishDaVinciCode
  • Indigogo has other share tools on this page. Please share!

story:
Overview

I met the woman of my dreams then lost her. That was how my 14 year search began for an alternative to the destructive methods people use to find and "build" relationships. 10 years in, I started writing about my own relationships - at the intersection of society, belief, desire, unspoken rules, human nature, and communication to uncover where conflict comes from.

The problem turns out to be a destructive state of mind I call obsession (see the video of Chapter 2 under the gallery tab):

I've spent the last 8 months and my life savings, identifying the sources of obsession in relationships, turning those sources into a book, and creating a visual map designed to lead couples away from a world based on obsession, to a world based on connection.

What makes this book unique

First, many books focus on only a subset of the problem. This results in books that are concise, but unrealistic. For example, a book that deals with communication without also addressing human nature will be almost useless in real relationships.

Second, many books fail to address the messy parts of real relationships: the petty battles and the bag of tricks people publicly denounce, but privately employ to win arguments such as name calling, guilt tripping, and picture painting. The high minded tactics presented in many books are no match for the 'street fighting' used in real relationships.

Third, many books are long which creates an incentive not to read them. By reviewing my ideas with over 100 people, the complexity and fluff have been reduced. Believe it or not, I am able to describe the whole problem and the solution in under 80 pages, making this a tool couples can read to each other in under 3 hours.

Fourth, this is the only book I am aware of that contains a map in the traditional sense, as a navigational aid. The map is designed to identify the safe and unsafe areas in relationships and help couples navigate them. Once the book is read, the map makes it easy to recall the key points and doubles as a visual table of contents.

Where the Funds Will Go

Your backing helps me do three things: Dedicate my time to the creation of a great book, test the usability of the ideas with readers, and complete all of the miscellaneous tasks required to get a book out of my brain and into your hands.
More specifically, your support helps me with the following tasks:

  • Copy editing
  • Proofreading
  • Professional illustration
  • Book layout and the design of the map
  • Setup costs and test samples of the book and the map for quality control
  • Marketing and Project management
  • Obtaining ISBN numbers, paying registration fees
  • Envelopes, packing materials, and postage
  • Extra copies to replace those that get lost in the mail, etc.

 
Rewards
Every backer will receive a copy of the book. You can also obtain a cloth version of the map designed to make navigating conflict even easier (and maybe even fun), have your name appear in the book, or have me facilitate your next book club meeting. In addition, I've outlined several stretch goals designed to reward all backers with cool stuff if the project hits certain funding goals such as:

  • STRETCH GOAL 1 - $10,000: Questionnaires tied to important landmarks on the map.
  • STRETCH GOAL 2 - $12,000: A video walk through of the map. A 30-45 minute overview of the key concepts in the book. The goal the video is to get you and your mate excited about using the map and reading the material in the book (as a downloadable AVI, MP4, or QuickTime file in a zip archive).
  • STRETCH GOAL 3 - $15,000: Book in Audio format (as a set of downloadable mp3 files in a zip archive).
  • STRETCH GOAL 4 - $17,000: A web based resource guide dedicated to additional examples, and related articles, books, and videos I've hand picked for more information.
  • STRETCH GOAL 5 - $27,000: A web based community where people can safely go to submit questions and receive answers moderated by me and others who understand the concepts in the book.
